So, you end up in a tranquil area just like this Minecraft seed which spawns the new biome next to a long river. If you are on the Java edition, you can also discover a Pillager Outpost and plains village on the other side of the river.

  • Seed: 338861
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock
  • Pillager Outpost Coordinates: 34, 91, 150 (Java)
  • Nearest Village Coordinates: 48, 83, 319 (Java)

5. Snowy Petals in Minecraft Cherry Grove Seeds

This Minecraft Cherry Grove seed has a bunch of great features in it. For starters, it spawns you next to a group of large Cherry Trees which are surrounded by snow on all sides. There is also a small waterfall making its way to the trees and turning the entire spot quite pleasing.

Then, as if all of this isn't enough, there is also an exposed dripstone cave right next to these trees. There are a bunch of exposed ores in the same including diamonds and emeralds. Moreover, once you plan to venture away from Cherry Grove, there are two plains villages to support you further.

  • Seed: 81498
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock
  • Dripstone Cave Coordinates: 22, 131, -44
  • First Village Coordinates: 24, 86, -317 (Java)
  • Second Village Coordinates: -137, 94, -269 (Java)

6. A White House in the Pink Biome

Because of their rare spawn rate, igloos are considered to be one of the hardest structures to find in Minecraft. Moreover, their blocks blend so well with the biome that you can miss it even if it's in front of you. But not if you spawn in this Minecraft Cherry Grove seed.

It drops you right on top of an igloo right inside a forest of cherry wood. This igloo is a complete structure with an underground basement beneath it. So, you get a resourceful house right where you spawn. Then, you can walk out of it to witness beautiful scenery.

  • Seed: 19934097
  • Edition: Java

7. Crater With Ruined Portal

Out of all the amazing Minecraft Cherry Grove seeds on our list, this is one of the most beautiful options you can get. The cherry blossom trees here spawn inside a crater that is surrounded by snow and ice. It's like a nest for the pink biome with a white border.

Furthermore, there is also a ruined portal in the same crater that you can turn into a Nether Portal. The Netherrack and the obsidian blocks fit quite well with the overall theme of Cherry Grove and make the crater even more appealing.

  • Seed: 4424490
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock
  • Ruined Portal Coordinates: 8, 119, 5(Java)

8. 500 Blocks of Cherry Grove in Minecraft

If you are a true fan of the Cherry Grove biome then you are going to love this seed. It generates a massive 500-block-long area made of entirely cherry trees. If you want to try creating structures with the new Minecraft 1.20 wood then this is the only seed you need. Just try not to get lost in the thick pink forest before finding a good spot for your base.

  • Seed: 275492403
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock

9. The Pink Hill

As the name reveals, this Minecraft seed spawns you on a massive hill made up entirely of the Cherry Grove biome. The spot is perfect for building a tower-style base because you can see clearly in every direction. Furthermore, there is also a Pillager Outpost right next to the spawn point.

You can either fight the Pillagers to get some good loot early on in the game. Or, you can tame the Allays that spawn in a broken cage and flee the outpost right away. The hill expands over a large area so, before you know it, the Pillagers will be out of your view.

  • Seed: 275529716
  • Edition: Java
  • Outpost Coordinates: 76, 119, 26 (Java)

10. Biome Mixup in Minecraft Cherry Grove Seeds




One of the most interesting aspects of the biomes in Minecraft is the way they interact with and contradict each other. A prime example of the same appears in this Minecraft seed. It spawns a cheerful Cherry Grove mountain on the side of a savanna wasteland. You can notice a clear division between the two thanks to the color of the grass.

This is the perfect spot for creating a Minecraft house with a beautiful garden up front and a dry barn in the back. Not to forget, since both biomes have different temperature requirements, you might not discover a spawn similar to this anytime soon.

  • Seed: 284022503
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock

11. A Drop of Pink in Minecraft Cherry Grove Seeds

While all the other Minecraft Cherry Grove seeds on our list give you overwhelming and often, significant instances of the new biome, this seed is slightly different. It spawns you next to probably the smallest Cherry Grove that can ever exist. Made up of only 3 cherry trees, this biome sits next to a massive forest and a mountain.

Nevertheless, by giving you a drop of pink in the massive green area, this seed signifies how unmissable this beautiful biome is. Moreover, there are dozens of cave openings and even a plains village close to your spawn to help you get started. So, you end up with a taste of Cherry Grove with a mission and resources to expand it.

  • Seed: 60579
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock
  • Village Coordinates: -159, 75, -181 (Java)

12. Spawn on Top of Ancient City

On the scale of joy, Minecraft's Cherry Grove and the Ancient Cities sit on opposite ends. The former is made up of welcoming features and bright areas. Meanwhile the latter acts like a fatal mistake for the underprepared. Even with such a contrary image, this seed gives you both of these features in the same spot.

You spawn in beautiful scenery made up of snow, cherry trees, and pink petals. There is peace in every direction. But, if you make the mistake of digging beneath your feet you will end up in the house of the Warden. Such a world generation with Ancient City and Cherry Grove appearing at your world spawn is quite rare. Though, it is also perfect to give you a break from the otherwise serene atmosphere.

  • Seed: 12922644
  • Edition: Java
  • Ancient City Coordinates: 0, -21, 0

13. Pink Snow

Putting the real-world mountains to shame, this Minecraft 1.20 cherry grove seed spawns a beautiful snowy peak surrounded by cherry trees. The shape of the hill is comparable to actual mountains which adds an extra layer of character to it.

While there are no reliable structures nearby, if you bring the building blocks, this is the perfect spot for making a base. Alternatively, you can also grab the beautiful pink wood and pair it with stone from the mountain for a unique build.

  • Seed: 88917323
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock

14. Two Sides of a Coin

The spawn point on this seed perfectly reflects the contrast in the elements of a Minecraft world. On your left is a lush and inviting grove of cherry trees, while on your right, a daunting savanna looms. If you place water between these two biomes, you'll witness a mesmerizing blend of two distinct watercolors.

Discovering such a fascinating location while exploring can be quite rare. So, make sure to build a structure to mark the occasion. Moreover, within this vast biome, you'll find two savanna villages that can assist you in your building plans.

  • Seed: 89132114
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock

15. Massive Flowering Continent

Taking the definition of massive islands to the level, this seed spawns a mystifying cherry grove biome surrounded by a layer of flowers and a long river. The location is not only visually captivating but also offers a plethora of activities.

Indulge in serene fishing sessions, embark on delightful boat rides along the river, or even construct a charming bungalow to call your own. Plus, if you put up a wall around the island, it would be nothing less than your very own kingdom. It is sure to turn players on popular Minecraft 1.20 servers into your fans.

  • Seed: 89138089
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock

16. Layers of Flowers

This seed spawns you on a beautiful seaside mountain which, much like the real world, is made up of several layers. The bottom layer consists of sunflower plains next to a beach. Moving upward, you'll find a vast and enchanting cherry blossom forest. Finally, crowning the mountain is a stunning snowy peak which takes the entire scene to a whole new level. 

  • Seed: 92227




17. Armadillos Wandering in Cherry

As you might know, Armadillos are coming to the savanna biome in Minecraft. But, the dead wasteland isn’t a perfect fit for their cute and friendly nature. That’s why we have this unique seed that generates a savanna right next to a cherry grove.

Thanks to this unique generation, you and your Armadillos can enjoy two colorful biomes in the same spot. Moreover, on the Java edition, there is also a savanna village near the spawn, perfect to get all the basic resources.  

  • Seed: 103587




18. Snowy Cherry Blossom Seed in Minecraft

Minecraft’s snowy biomes and the cherry groves often go head to head for the title of the most beautiful spot in the game. But, what if you could enjoy the best of both worlds at the same spot? 

That’s what this amazing seed offers by generating a beautiful pink forest surrounded by snow on all sides. The spot is perfect for creating a mountain base and even a spawn area for the best Minecraft SMP servers. 

  • Seed: 109875




19. Spiky Cherries

Ice spikes are one of the most confusing and dangerous biomes in Minecraft. One wrong step and you can fall into freezing water or a deep ravine. While this seed cannot save you from the same, it at the same time, offers beautiful cherry surroundings. 

As you might expect, these biomes are not supposed to be next to one another. But, this seed’s unique generation forces them to blend together. The result is glitchy, unique, and quite scattered, perfect for practicing your movement for the best Minecraft parkour servers.  

  • Seed: 121606




20. A Drop of Pink in a Yellow Sea

When you spawn in this seed, there is nothing but sunflowers surrounding you for hundreds of blocks. But, within the same massive field of yellow flowers is a small patch of cherry trees. 

They fit perfectly with the flowers while leaving a large area open for building structures. Plus, the presence of pink within a swarm of sunflowers offers a great contrast and a fresh terrain design. It’s almost impossible to find such an interesting spot in any of the other best Minecraft cherry grove seeds. 

  • Seed: 369158




21. Igloo Under Cherry Blossom

Igloos are easily one of the most interesting structures in the game. While offering great loot, they also offer a chance for you to learn how to cure zombie villagers in Minecraft. The only issue with them is that they blend well with snowy surroundings and are hard to find.

But, it’s time to fix that with this simple yet powerful seed. It generates an igloo on the edge of the cherry grove biome. You can even witness beautiful cherry petals on top of the snowy structure. 

  • Seed: 30372188




22. Zombie Village Covered in Petals

If you are a fan of villages in Minecraft then you are going to love this seed. It generates an extremely rare zombie village inside the cherry grove biome. Moreover, since this biome doesn’t support village generation by default, the presence of this structure is even rarer.  

You can repair the structure and cure the villagers to turn it into a habitable place. Or, you can let the monsters spawn and hunt them to collect rare loot. But, the latter choice might make it challenging to keep your cherry base safe. 

  • Seed: 564246945




Frequently Asked Questions

How do you grow a cherry tree from a seed in Minecraft?

The only way to grow a cherry tree in Minecraft is through a cherry sapling. To get a sapling, break the leaves of a cherry tree until they drop a sapling.

Is there a Cherry Grove Village in Minecraft?

At the moment, there are no dedicated villagers in the Cherry Grove biome of Minecraft. But, you can use the seeds on our list to discover villages from other biomes glitched into the cherry area

What structures spawn in Cherry Grove?

Officially, only the Pillager Ouposts can generate inside the Cherry Grove biome of Minecraft. But, occasionally, you can also discover structures like villages from other biomes glitching into it.

Explore the Cherry Grove Biome in Minecraft Today

Now that you have access to the best Minecraft Cherry Grove seeds it's time to make the most out of them. One of the best ways to do so is by enabling Minecraft shaders into your world. They will enhance the way Cherry Grove looks but might even end up completely changing how you play Minecraft. Though, to run these shaders you will first have to get Optifine for Minecraft. It is a powerful visual mod that improves performance, graphics, and the overall gameplay of Minecraft. With that said, it's time for you to dive into the pink biome and create a house out of cherry wood. So, good luck and happy crafting!
excerpt: Explore the new pink biome with these amazing Minecraft Cherry Grove seeds along with coordinates to key locations and more.

title: 12 Best Minecraft Modpacks for an Epic Adventure in 2023
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: 12 Best Minecraft Modpacks for an Epic Adventure in 2023
content:
Even with a bunch of updates over the years, the world of Minecraft hasn't changed much in terms of the core gameplay. Moreover, its new features, more often than not, don't impact how you play the game. But what if you could change everything you know about Minecraft with just a single update? That's exactly what you get with the best Minecraft modpacks. These are powerful add-ons that unlock a ton of features, hundreds of mobs, and a whole set of biomes in the game. There is so much to cover. So, let's stop beating around the bush and jump right in!

Best Minecraft Modpacks

We are first going over what Minecraft modpacks are and how you can use them. But, if already know their basics, please feel free to skip to the main list.

What is a Minecraft Modpack

A Minecraft modpack is a collection of various mods working together to give you a better gameplay experience. Unlike a mod which only affects one aspect of the game, modpacks end up changing almost everything in Minecraft including mobs, biomes, and more.

More often than not, each modpacks only consists of mods that are following a similar or connected theme. So, even though they're from different developers, all the mods in one Minecraft modpack feel like members of the same family. If you are new to the world of modding, we suggest you first try some of the best Minecraft mods before venturing into modpacks.

How to Run Minecraft Modpacks

Much like mods, you need a mod engine to run Minecraft modpacks as well. So, first, download and install Forge for Minecraft before getting any modpack. It is a third-party tool that helps Minecraft run and handle multiple mods without compromising performance. While you can install and run several mods and modpacks without Forge, it's a must-have for all the options on our list.

Best Minecraft Modpacks for 2023

1. All the Mods

Don't let its name confuse you. Since Minecraft gets hundreds of new mobs each day, it's impossible to pack them in a single modpack. But ATM8 has most of the good ones. It is an ambitious project that tries to put as many mods as possible inside a single modpack without making the game crash.

So, chances are, you can find almost all mods from the rest of the best Minecraft modpacks inside ATM8. However, this is also a drawback of this powerful project. Having so many mods in a single modpack eliminates the chance of creating a themed gameplay experience. But if you want to explore a surprisingly and sometimes, chaotic version of Minecraft then this modpack is for you.

  • Download All the Mods Minecraft Modpack
  • Game Version: 1.19

2. Valhelsia

Valhelsia is a unique Minecraft modpack that offers some of the most iconic classic mods along with the popular new ones. So, you end up with a perfect experience that caters to all types of Minecrafters.

The builders and engineers get a diverse set of blocks to build with. Meanwhile, adventures get to explore a world made up of unique structures and dangerous mobs. From new overworld biomes to secret underground caves, there is something for everyone. You just have to find what fits your style in Valhelsia.

  • Download Valhelsia
  • Game Version: 1.19

3. RL Craft

RL Craft or Real Life Craft is one of the most dangerous Minecraft modpacks out there. It implements a bunch of new mechanics in the game that aims to replicate real-world mechanics but end up limiting you. For example, you have to take care of thirst, temperature changes, and even your sleeping location.

Moreover, alongside the realistic weaknesses, there are hostile mobs and a challenging world for you to explore. You end up in a world that requires you to take extra care of yourself while its mobs try to kill you. But, if you somehow survive RL Craft, there are over 340 side quests to keep you occupied for days.

  • Download RL Craft Minecraft Modpack
  • Game Version: 1.12.2

4. Sevtech Ages

This Minecraft modpack fixes the everlasting issue of players running out of stuff to do in the game. It adds a bunch of new mechanics to the game including new ores, hidden items, and even new mobs. But the best part is that all of them only appear as you make progress in the game. So, instead of a completely open world, you get a progress-based sandbox game.

The modpacks separate these progressions in the form of "ages". Much like how the industrial age changed the real world, the new ages of the modpack offer a new Minecraft experience as you progress. From the stone age to space, there are thousands of items, blocks, and mobs for you to unlock. But will you be able to unlock them all? Only one way to find out.

  • Download Sevtech Ages
  • Game Version: 1.12.2

5. FTB Revelation

Feed The Beast team is behind a bunch of great Minecraft projects and FTB Revelation is a prime example of their talent. It is a massive modpack with over 200 mods in it. The best part is that all of these mods are carefully chosen to keep your performance intact. As for the main theme, this modpack gives you an improved Minecraft with better recipes, diverse items, and a robust Redstone system.

So, whether you plan on building or exploring, there will always be a ton of technologies and magic to help you out. But, with more resources, there will be more challenges as well. Make sure to keep an eye out for the new bosses while exploring the darker biomes. Though, you can invite your friends to one of the best FTB Minecraft servers to make the world a bit safer.

  • Download FTB Revelation
  • Game Version: 1.12.2

6. InsaneCraft Modpack

This Minecraft modpack, as the name suggests, is insane in terms of the machines and structures you can build. But that's just the surface of its game-changing mechanics. With over 250 powerful mods, this modpack creates some truly unexpected worlds which include new dimensions, large mobs, and even superpowers.

Furthermore, everything you do in InsaneCraft's world must lead you toward one of the 6 infinity stones. With a direct not to the Marvel comics and MCU, InsaneCraft wants you to take over the world becoming Thanos. But the journey isn't as simple as defeating the Ender Dragon. So, are you up for the challenge? Get the modpack and find out!

  • Download InsaneCraft Modpack
  • Game Version: 1.12.2

7. Crazy Craft

If you like experiencing surprises in life and don't mind random chaos then Crazy Craft is going to be your favorite Minecraft mod. It has 100s of hours worth of content and every single piece of it is a different kind of fun. There are 100+ biomes, 500+ mobs, and 300+ structures spread across 8 unique dimensions of Minecraft.

Even after playing this modpack for months, many players end up discovering new stuff every single day. The only drawback is that you need a strong system to make the most out of this modpack. While Crazy Craft tries to maintain performance, it is the most fun on a system that can handle its wildness.

  • Download Crazy Craft
  • Game Version: 1.16.5

8. Pixelmon


Ever imagined defeating the Ender Dragon with a Charizard? Now you can make it happen. Unless you are new to the Minecraft community you must be already familiar with Pixelmon. This game-changing modpack brings the world of Pokemon to Minecraft complete with all its creatures, structures, and even fighting mechanics.

Even if you are not a fan of the Pokemon franchise, this modpack is still worth your time thanks to the controllable supernatural mobs. But, do keep in mind that the world of Pokemon is only fun if you are other players in it. So, before getting the modpack, we suggest you try it on one of the best Pixelmon servers for a memorable experience.

  • Download Pixelmon Minecraft Modpack
  • Game Version: 1.16.5

9. Enigmatica

With a great focus on storytelling, Enigmatica is a simple yet powerful quest-based Minecraft modpack. It offers a world that's made up of dozens of biomes leading to over 800 quests. On one side, there are monsters, traders, and even some new friends for you to meet.

Meanwhile, on the other hand, you get powerfully customizable blocks to create bridges, castles, and everything in between. If you are a fan of storytelling and enjoy playing on the Minecraft roleplay servers then Enigmatica is right up your alley. It is also perfect for players that are looking for new stories that play out in the world of Minecraft.

  • Download Enigmatica Minecraft Modpack
  • Game Version: 1.19

10. Vault Hunters Modpack for Minecraft

Vault Hunters is an RPG-style modpack for Minecraft which completely changes the way you experience the game. It makes you explore a brand new dimension by the name of The Vault where a ton of mysteries and dangers await you. There, you have to trade with collect currency, defeat bosses, and trade with other creatures to survive.

Your main mission is to collect 25 unique artifacts and uncover the story of The Vault. But before getting there you must upgrade your skills, develop talents and craft a bunch of powerful weapons. No one knows what the last chamber of the vault might be hiding. All you can do is be ready to take it down.

  • Download Vault Hunters 
  • Game Version: 1.18.2

11. Better Minecraft Modpack

Our chances of getting a sequel to Minecraft are quite low. But Better Minecraft Modpack gives us a fair estimate of what it might be like. Its world is made up of 4 new dimensions with dozens of new mobs and biomes.

The best part is that all the new stuff that Better Minecraft brings to Minecraft feels like it belongs in the game. This even applies to all the new bosses that you get to fight. Furthermore, there are also a ton of quality-of-life changes including a backpack that even the current version of Minecraft can learn from.

  • Download Better Minecraft
  • Game Version: 1.19

12. Medieval MC Modpack

To perfectly sum out the wildness of the best Minecraft modpacks, we have Medieval MC. With a big focus on magic, this is easily the best and most powerful medieval adventure modpack for Minecraft. There are tons of bosses and mini-bosses for you to fight. But since each one of them has distinct powers and weaknesses, you also have to obtain unique weapons.

From an open-world perspective, the modpack brings new civilizations and colonies to the game. You get to choose if you want to conquer or befriend them. So, you can either try to finish up all the amazing quests or you can start your kingdom. The only thing you won't experience here is getting bored.

  • Download Medieval MC
  • Game Version: 1.16.5


Explore All the Top Minecraft Modpacks Today

With that, it's time for you to enter completely new variants of Minecraft and explore all the features that each one of them has to offer. But, before you do, make sure to install OptiFine in Minecraft. It is a visual and performance mod for Minecraft that will help your game handle multiple mods at the same time. Moreover, you can also use the same OptiFine mod to run shaders in Minecraft and heavily upgrade its graphics. Having said that, do you know any other great Minecraft modpack? Don't forget to drop it in our Discord server.
excerpt: Here are our picks for the best Minecraft modpacks including new mobs, diverse biomes, and a ton of game-changing features.

title: How to Make a Potion of Slow Falling in Minecraft (2023)
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Potion of Slow Falling in Minecraft (2023)
content:
Have you ever ventured to the highest peaks of Minecraft or created tall structures only to fall off and die? That's a common nightmare that many players across the community share. But what if you could fall so slowly that it didn't have any effect on your health? That's exactly what happens if you use the Potion of Slow Falling in Minecraft. It is a powerful consumable item in the game that allows you to eliminate fall damage. And that's not all that it offers. So, let's dive and figure out how to make and use a Potion of Slow Falling in Minecraft.

Potion of Slow Falling in Minecraft (2023)

Before you make the actual potion, it’s important to understand how it works and the stuff you need to make it. So, we suggest you first explore the basics of the Potion Slow Falling before learning how to make one.

What is a Potion of Slow Falling in Minecraft

The Potion of Slow Falling in Minecraft decreases the speed of a player or a mob while it is falling. Due to the slower fall speed, the target entity ends up taking no fall damage at all. This effect works irrespective of how high you are falling from. It is quite useful while exploring the mountainous biome of Minecraft including the new cherry grove.

Much like the other potions in the game, you have to drink the Slow Falling potion to get its status effect. You can also turn it into a lingering potion or a splash potion to spread its effects to other mobs. However, it doesn't affect any boss mobs or the Shulkers. But you can still use it on other players while playing on the Minecraft survival servers.

Materials Required to Make this Potion

You need the following items to make a Potion of Slow Falling in Minecraft:

  • Phantom Membrane
  • Water Bottle
  • Nether Wart
  • Brewing Stand
  • Blaze Powder

Water bottles are the base of all potions in Minecraft. So, you first need to either kill some witches or combine three glass blocks on the crafting table to get a glass bottle. Then, simply use that bottle on a water source to get a water bottle. Furthermore, we suggest you get three water bottles since each ingredient of a potion can be used to create three bottles of potions at once.

How to Make a Brewing Stand in Minecraft



Brewing Stand, much like a crafting table, is a utility block that allows you to craft potions in Minecraft. To create it, you have to combine three cobblestone blocks with a Blaze rod in the crating table. You can get the cobblestone by breaking stone blocks in the overworld.

Meanwhile, you have to kill a Blaze mob to get the blaze rods. This hostile mob only spawns in the Nether dimension. So have to make a Nether portal in Minecraft if you want to hunt Blazes. Though, make sure to get extra blaze rods so that you can turn them into blaze power to fuel the stand.

Where to Find Nether Wart in Minecraft

While you are in the Nether dimension, you should also get some Nether warts for your potion. They are a type of fungus that only grows in the Nether Fortress and Bastion Remnant. You can easily find farms of Nether warts by exploring these structures. Once you find the fungus, simply break it to pick it up. You only need one Nether wart to make a Potion of Slow Falling.

How to Get Phantom Membrane

A phantom membrane is the main ingredient that gives Potion of Slow Falling its powers. Here's how to get it.

1. First, you simply have to spend three days in the game without sleeping or dying in Minecraft. Then, a hostile mob phantom will spawn on the fourth night.

2. You have to kill the phantoms to get some phantom membranes. The easiest way to do it is by waiting for the sun to show up. Being an undead mob, phantoms start burning in the sunlight.

3. When the phantom is low on health, use a sword to kill it and pick up the phantom membrane drop.

How to Craft Potion of Slow Falling (1:30 Minutes)

With all the ingredients ready, let's learn how to brew the Potion of Slow Falling in Minecraft:

1. First, open your Brewing Stand and place the Blaze powder in the fuel cell on the left. It will automatically get consumed.

2. Then, place the Nether wart in the top middle cell of the stand. It's located right next to the arrow.

3. Then, place the water bottle in any of the cells at the bottom. You will end up with an Awkward potion which is the base for most potions in Minecraft.

4. Finally, place the phantom membrane in the top cell and let the stand brew your potion. Within seconds, your Potion of Slow Falling will be ready.

Extended Potion of Slow Falling (4:00 Minutes)

The default Potion of Slow Falling is perfect for surviving tricky situations. However, it only lasts for one minute and thirty seconds. If you plan on exploring the best Minecraft parkour servers then you must extend the Potion of Slow Falling to four minutes. Here's how:

1. First, go underground or to the caves of your overworld to find Redstone ore. It usually spawns between the world heights "y=-63" and "y=-34".

2. Then, use an iron pickaxe or higher to mine the ore block and get Redstone dust.

3. Next, place the collected Redstone dust in the top middle cell of the Brewing Stand. And then, put the Potion of Slow Falling in the bottom cell to extend it. But before you do that, you might have to refuel the stand with Blaze powder.

Make a Splash Potion of Slow Falling (1:30 Minutes)

Most players use this Minecraft potion only in the situation when they are about to fall or already falling. However, in such tricky situations, you often don't have the time to consume the potion. That's when a splash potion comes in handy. It is a throwable version of a regular Minecraft potion that can be used immediately.

Follow these steps to make a splash Potion of Slow Falling:

1. First, find and kill a creeper in Minecraft. It drops 0-2 pieces of gunpowder on dying.

2. Then, place the gunpowder inside the Brewing Stand and brew it with a Potion of Slow Falling.

3. Once your potion is ready, you have to throw it to use it. All the players and mobs that get hit by it will receive the Slow Falling effect. Though, you must use it on the head of the target to get maximum duration.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do you make an 8-minute Slow Falling potion?

The maximum duration for a Slow Falling potion is 4 minutes. Unless you are using commands or Minecraft mods, there is no way to extend it more.

What Potion for feather falling?

The feather-falling is a popular boots enchantment in Minecraft that slows the speed of your falling. You can get similar effects from the Potion of Slow Falling.

Is there Slow Falling 2 in Minecraft?

Unlike enchantments, there are no levels of the Slow Falling potion. However, you can extend its duration by adding Redstone dust to its base version.

Get and Use Potion of Slow Falling in Minecraft Today

With that, you are now ready to freely conquer the highest points of Minecraft. But that's not the only way you can use this amazing potion. Many players also rely on the Slow Falling Potion while creating structures on the Minecraft CityBuild servers. The potion prevents the builders from falling from high structures and allows them to build more freely. Though, that's still the surface of this potion's uses. So, how are you planning to use a Potion of Slow Falling in Minecraft? Share your ideas on our Discord server!
excerpt: Take your Minecraft game to the next level with this easy guide on making a Potion of Slow Falling in Minecraft! Learn how to completely eliminate the fall damage and unlock slow falling in the game.

title: How to Get and Use Phantom Membrane in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Get and Use Phantom Membrane in Minecraft
tags: Phantom Membrane, Minecraft Mobs, Minecraft Potions
content:
Elytra is one of the most useful but also rarest utility items in Minecraft. It only spawns in the End dimension and you have to travel to End Cities to get them. But just like any other tool in the game, Elytra eventually runs out of durability and breaks. Then, you must stick with traveling by foot or repeat the entire adventure. Luckily, if you know how to get a phantom membrane in Minecraft, it can help your Elytras last much longer. But that's not the only use for this amazing item. So, let's dive in and find out everything you need to know about phantom membranes in Minecraft.

Phantom Membrane in Minecraft

We are covering the mechanics, spawning, and usage of phantom membranes in Minecraft within different sections. Feel free to explore each of them at your convenience.

How to Obtain Phantom Membrane

The most reliable way to get a phantom membrane in Minecraft is by finding and killing a Phantom. But unfortunately, this hostile mob doesn't spawn naturally in the overworld. Instead, you have to spend three in-game days (or 72 minutes in real life) without sleeping or dying.

Then, on the 4th night, a phantom will spawn in your world and try to attack you. It is a flying hostile mob so you might have to wait for it to get close to you before attacking it. Alternatively, you can also wait for the sun to rise. Since the phantom is an undead mob, the sunshine sets it on fire. So, when it's low on health, you can simply walk up to it and kill it to get the drop.

Each phantom drops 0-2 phantom membranes when killed by a player or a tamed wolf. But you can use the Looting III enchantment on a weapon like the diamond sword to get 4 phantom membranes at once. Though, that's not the only way to get multiple copies of this item. You can also simply not sleep for multiple nights to make the game spawn more than on phantoms.

Get Cat Gifts

If dealing with the phantom or waiting for them to spawn feels tiresome, you can also get phantom membranes from cats. All tamed cats in Minecraft have a 70% chance of giving gifts to players when they wake up from bed. Within these gifts, you have a 3.22% chance of getting a phantom membrane.

This method of getting the membranes might not be reliable but it is much safer than fighting a hostile mob. Though, having multiple tamed cats can improve your chances of getting the desired gift from them.

Phantom Membrane Uses in Minecraft

You can only use the phantom membrane in the following two ways within Minecraft. Let's explore each of them in detail.

Potion of Slow Falling

Follow these steps to use the phantom membrane for making a Potion of Slow Falling:

1. First, open a Brewing Stand and place Blaze powder in the left-side fuel cell. This will charge the stand and get it ready for brewing.

2. Then, place a Nether wart in the top cell with a water bottle in the bottom cell. The stand will brew an Awkward potion which is the base for most potions in the game.

3. Then, put the phantom membrane in the top cell of the Brewing stand and keep the Awkward potion in the bottom cell. Within seconds, your Potion of Slow Falling will be ready.

If you want more information, we also have a dedicated guide to making a Potion of Slow Falling in Minecraft. It goes into detail about all the ingredients you will need for brewing this potion.

Repair Elytra

Here's how to repair an Elytra with the help of a phantom membrane in Minecraft:

1. To begin, use 3 blocks of iron and 4 iron ingots to craft an anvil on the crafting table. It is a utility block that allows you to rename and repair items in Minecraft.

2. Then, open the anvil and place your Elytra in the left cell. Make sure the Elytra you are placing is low on its durability.

3. Finally, place the phantom membrane on the middle cell of the anvil. The anvil will combine the two and give you an Elytra with restored durability. Each phantom membrane restores 108 durability points (25% of total durability).

Frequently Asked Questions

What can you do with the phantom membrane?

Phantom Membranes are used to craft the Potion of Slow Falling and restore the durability of Elytra.

How to get phantom membranes?

The simplest way to get a phantom membrane is by killing a phantom in Minecraft. But you can also obtain it as a gift from a tamed cat.

Do phantoms go away during the day?

Phantoms are undead mobs in Minecraft so they burn and die in sunlight during the daytime. This is similar to how other undead mobs like zombies and skeletons also get set ablaze in sunlight.

Get and Use Phantom Membranes in Minecraft

With that, you have now unlocked one of the most powerful items in the game. It will come in handy in a variety of situations, especially on the best Minecraft Parkour servers. There, you can use the phantom membranes to make your flights last longer and your fall less drastic. With that out of the gate, it’s time for you to challenge the phantom and get amazing loot in Minecraft. Good luck and keep exploring!
excerpt: Discover how to kill the hostile phantoms and get Phantom Membrane in Minecraft to repair Elytra and make a Potion of Slow Falling.

title: Minecraft 1.20: Trails & Tales Update is Coming in June
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: Minecraft 1.20: Trails & Tales Update is Coming in June
content:
Without a doubt, the 1.20 Trails & Tales update is one of the most feature-packed updates to ever reach Minecraft. It brings a ton of new functionality, new blocks, and even new mobs to the game. From Sniffer to archaeology, there is something to light up everyone's day. However, when it comes to the release date of Minecraft 1.20, all players are still in the dark. But don't worry, we won't leave you hanging. After scouring hints, clues, and official information we have come up with the most likely release date for Minecraft 1.20. So, get ready to mark your calendar and embark on new adventures because Minecraft 1.20 is just around the corner!

Minecraft 1.20 Release Date (2023)

Note: We are only speculating on the release date of the Minecraft 1.20 update based on the available information. There is no official announcement for the same yet.

UPDATE: Official Release Date of Minecraft 1.20

As revealed in an official post, the Minecraft 1.20 update is releasing on June 7, 2023, for all editions. It will come out on Xbox, PlayStation, Nintendo Switch, iOS, Android, Windows, macOS, Linux, and for the first time ever, on Chromebooks too! So, make your calendars and join the best Minecraft 1.20 servers to enjoy the new features as soon as they launch.

When is the Minecraft 1.20 Coming Out

As per the release timeline on Minecraft Wiki, most large updates for this sandbox game usually have a 6-month gap between them. But things are starting to change lately. Now, instead of going for two large updates in a single year, Minecraft gets a bunch of small updates between two large ones.

So, even though the Minecraft 1.19 update was released in June 2022, we didn't get to see Minecraft 1.20 at the end of 2022. The update didn't even have an official name back then. But, over the past few months, the upcoming update has developed into one of the largest Minecraft updates in recent years.

Players are constantly getting new test features every week and the developers are releasing changes based on the community feedback. Many of the key features are still far from their final version. With that, we expect Minecraft 1.20 update's release date to be in June 2023. This will make it a summer update and also one of the largest gaps between two major updates.

Java and Bedrock Editions: Will Minecraft 1.20 Update Release Simultaneously?

Looking at the efforts towards parity of the two editions in recent years, Mojang will keep the same release date of Minecraft 1.20 for Java and Bedrock editions. Furthermore, unlike the Caves & Cliffs update, Minecraft 1.20 will release as just one update so you will get all of its features as soon as it comes out. But, when that is going to happen is still a mystery.

Devices that Support Minecraft 1.20 Update

Minecraft 1.20 update will be available on the same platforms that currently support the 1.19 Wild Update. These include:

  • Xbox
  • PlayStation
  • Nintendo Switch
  • iOS
  • iPad OS
  • Android
  • ChromeOS (with Android support)
  • Windows
  • macOS*
  • Linus*

*Java Edition

Out of all these platforms, only Windows support both editions of Minecraft. This is partly because Mojang, the developer of Minecraft is owned by Microsoft and partly due to the popularity of Windows. Moreover, you don't even have to pay anything to play either addition of Minecraft on Windows as long as you are an active game-pass user.

Meanwhile, it is also worth noting that the 1.20 Trails & Tales Update will be the first regular version of Minecraft to officially support Chromebooks. Currently, the developers are testing the Bedrock edition on Chrome devices but they should conclude as the new update's release date comes closer.

Why is Minecraft 1.20 Called Trails & Tales Update?

As per the official blog post, the name "Trails & Tales" reflects the power of self-expression and the stories we tell in Minecraft. It represents the unique adventures that the game takes each player on and leads everyone to a unique tale.

At What Time Does the Minecraft 1.20 Update Release?

Taking a hint from the previous releases, the Minecraft 1.20 update should come out at around 04:00 PM GMT (or 9:00 AM PT). This is the standard time when the last two major updates and all the snapshots for the 1.20 update have dropped. Contrary to popular belief, the new update will not release at midnight of the Minecraft 1.20 release date.

New Features of 1.20 Update

The Minecraft 1.20 Trails & Tales is bringing a bunch of new features to the game including:

  • Sniffer: Neutral mob that sniffs out ancient seeds which grow into rare plants.
  • Camel: Neutral rideable mob that spawns in the desert villages of Minecraft.
  • Armor Trims: Customization options to add colorful patterns to all armors in the game.
  • Smithing Templates: Additional items that you need to use a Smithing table for trimming armor and upgrading diamond to Netherite.
  • Cherry Grove Biome: New mountain biome based on the cherry blossom phenomena.
  • Hanging Signs: Customizable signs that you can hang on the side and bottom of other blocks.﻿
  • Mob Heads: The Minecraft 1.20 update is bringing a new Piglin mob head to the game along with sound interaction for all existing mob heads.
  • Chiseled Bookshelf: A new storage block in which you can place enchanted and regular books.
  • Bamboo Wood: The only craftable variant of Minecraft wood which you can make with pieces of bamboo.
  • Raft: A vehicle similar to boats but without boundaries and made out of bamboo wood.
  • Cherry Wood: Pink and maroon family of wood which is obtained from cherry trees in the new Cherry Grove biome.
  • Archaeology Features: New Minecraft mechanics that allow you to hunt for rare items, pottery shards, and Sniffer eggs in suspicious blocks.

Minecraft 1.20 Trailer

Unfortunately, we don't have an official trailer for the Trails & Tales update yet. However, we might get one when the release date of Minecraft 1.20 is around the corner. Until then, please enjoy this official feature-reveal video by the team of Minecraft:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jQ58UEXrFzs&t=1s

Get Ready for the Release Date of Minecraft 1.20

Based on our speculations, the release date of the Minecraft 1.20 update is still months away. But, you don't have to wait that long to enjoy the upcoming features in your world. All you need to do is join one of the best Minecraft 1.20 servers and enjoy the new features before the official release. Though, if you want a simple single-player interaction with these features, we also have a dedicated guide to getting the Sniffer in Minecraft. You can refer to the linked guide to get any new features immediately. Having said that, when do you think the new update will come out? Drop your theories on our official Discord server.
excerpt: Excited about the upcoming Trails & Tales update? Find out when the Minecraft 1.20 update is coming out with our release date guide!

title: Minecraft Cobblemon: How to Download, Install and Play
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: Minecraft Cobblemon: How to Download, Install and Play (Easy Guide)
content:
At the core, the worlds of Minecraft and Pokemon are quite similar. You start in a mysterious land and travel all around it while encountering strange creatures. Some of them, like the Sniffer, give you amazing loot while others try to fight you. So, naturally, it makes sense to bring Minecraft and Pokemon together to unlock a great experience and for years, Pixelmon has done the job. But now, there is a new player in the town and it's about to change everything. Yes, we are talking about Cobblemon, a brand-new Pokemon mod for Minecraft. But, what exactly is Minecraft Cobblemon? How you can get it? And most importantly, is this mod better than Pixelmon? Let's find out!

Minecraft Cobblemon

Our guide covers all the basics of Cobblemon for Minecraft from its mechanics to installation in separate sections. Feel free to explore each of the sections at your convenience.

What is Minecraft Cobblemon

Cobblemon is a new open-source mod that brings a bunch of amazing mechanics from the classic Pokemon games to Minecraft. But unlike other mods, it doesn't only use the world of Minecraft as a background for the Pokemon features. Instead, Cobblemon integrates all the new Pokemon mechanics into the vanilla experience.

Every single item and Pokemon looks like it belongs in the default world of Minecraft and carries its iconic blocky look. Even Poke balls leave their curves behind to adopt a cubic form. Furthermore, the existing biomes of Minecraft also modify themselves to integrate the elements of this modpack. Because of this, some Pokemon and items spawn exclusively in certain locations which creates a whole new Minecraft quest to explore and catch 'em all.

Taking a step away from the gameplay, Minecraft Cobblemon also stands out in terms of how it is designed. Being an open-source project, it is open for the community to edit, develop and improve. So, even though it still might be in an early stage, the future of Cobblestone is filled with amazing adventures.

Features of Cobblemon

The Cobblemon mod for Minecraft has the following main features:

  • All generation 1 Pokemon alongside some from newer generations in Minecraft's blocky design
  • Toggle free-movement during battles that allow you to explore the world while your Pokemon fights
  • Pokemon capturing, training, and fighting mechanics
  • Unique battle mechanics similar to Pokémon Legends: Arceus
  • Pokemon animation and world interaction
  • Biome-based items and various Pokemon species
  • Dozens of distinct types of Poke balls, evolution stones, and other items
  • Support for custom Pokemon via resource packs
  • Built-in compatibility for both Fabric and Forge

Other than these, team Cobblemon is working on a bunch of additional features that will release in the upcoming months. They include NPCs, riding Pokémon, breeding, and structures.

Custom Pokemon in Cobblemon

There are a bunch of amazing features that help Cobblemon stand out among all the other best Minecraft modpacks. But what makes it truly special is the ability to bring custom Pokemon to the game. All you have to do is model your character with the help of BlockBench and import it into the modpack. Cobblemon will take care of the rest.

Moreover, since this modpack is open source, you can use its base mechanics to create your variants of the same. This opens up a whole lot of possibilities for the future of Minecraft. Who knows, someone might use Cobblemon to bring Digimon to the game. All that's stopping you is your imagination.

Cobblemon vs Pixelmon: Which is Better

On the surface, both Pixelmon and Cobblemon offer a great Minecraft X Pokemon experience. But the way they implement is quite contrasting. So, let's explore the differences between the two to find out which is the right pick for you:

  • Version: Pixelmon runs on Minecraft 1.16.5 and doesn't have plans for any upgrades. However, Cobblemon runs on 1.19.2 and it might even get updated to Minecraft 1.20.
  • Number of Pokemon: While Pixelmon has over 800 Pokemon, Cobblemon only has close to 200 creatures, most of which are from Gen 1. But, do keep in mind that the latter is quite new and will get more Pokemon in near future.
  • Character Design: Pokemon in Pixelmon look like creatures from a regular 3D game but Cobblemon follows the blocky style of Minecraft.
  • Structures: Only Pixelmon has unique structures inspired by the original Pokemon games.
  • Compatibility: Pixelmon, as a modpack, offers a complete experience in itself. Meanwhile, Cobblemon is open to interaction with other mods to improve the gameplay.
  • Movement & Battles: Cobblemon introduces free movement during battles alongside mechanics for relearning and running from battle.
  • Evolutions: Pixelmon has a high-level evolution system consisting of breeding and mega evolutions.
  • Community: Because it has been years since the initial release of Pixelmon, it has a larger community and more extensive resources than Cobblemon.

With that, it must be clear that if you want a more true Minecraft experience of Pokemon then Cobblemon is the obvious choice. Meanwhile, Pixelmon is perfect for players who want an advanced 3D experience.

How Do I Download Minecraft Cobblemon

Now that you are aware of the basics of Minecraft Cobblemon, it's time to get in on the action. So, let's figure out how to get this mod up and running.

Minimum Requirements to Run Cobblemon

If you can run Minecraft on your system, it is more than capable of running the game with the Cobblemon mod installed on it. However, to make the most out of this Pokemon experience, we suggest you get at least the following specifications:

  • OS: Windows 7 or later, macOS 10.12 Sierra or later, or Linux
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 or later
  • Memory: 3GB RAM or more
  • Graphics Card: NVIDIA GeForce 400 Series or stronger

Items Required to Run Cobblemon

Before you can run the Cobblemon mod in Minecraft, you need to download and install the following elements:

  • Forge: A mod engine and manager which can run multiple Minecraft mods at once. You can also use the Fabric mod engine instead.
  • Kotlin: A set of libraries that allow Minecraft to run mods coded in Kotlin language.
  • Architectury: An API that makes it possible to create multi-platform mods that work on both Fabric and Forge.

You can run the Forge install to automatically install it in your Minecraft directory. Meanwhile, you have to manually place the Kotlin and Architecture files in your mods folder to install them. The "mods" folder can be found in the following locations:

  • Windows: %appdata%/.minecraft/mods/
  • Mac OS: ~/Library/Application Support/minecraft/mods/
  • Linux: ~/.minecraft/mods/

Install Minecraft Cobblemon

Follow these steps to easily download and install Cobblemon in Minecraft:

1. First, go to the official website of Cobblemon (here) and then click on the "download" button on the home page.

2. Next, go to the "versions" tab and click on the download icon next to the latest version of Cobblemon for Forge. You will end up with a ".jar" Java file.

3. Then, place the Cobblemon mob file in the "mods" folder of your Minecraft directory.

4. Finally, launch the Forge installation of Minecraft in your Minecraft Launcher to run Cobblemon mod.

How do I Play Cobblemon

The world of Cobblemon in Minecraft might feel a bit overwhelming when you first load into it. But if you know the basics, things are going to be a lot simpler.

Starter Pokemon

Minecraft Cobblemon can be a complete experience unless you get your first Pokemon right off the bat. So, follow these steps to obtain your favorite starter:

1. First, press the "M" key to open up the "Starter Selection" window. Next, use the left-side menu to select any region to see its starter Pokemon options.

2. Then, use the arrow keys to navigate through your options and click on the "I Choose You" button to get your first Pokemon in Cobblemon.

3. Your selected Pokemon will show up on the left side of your screen and you can press the "R" key to spawn it.

Capturing a Pokemon

Now that you have your first Pokemon, let's figure out how to catch more and get your adventures started:

1. First, find an Apricorn tree in the overworld. Then right-click on the Apricorns to collect them. The color of the Apricorn determines the type of Poke ball you are going to get.

2. Then, it's time to put your Minecraft skills to use and collect a copper ingot. You will first have to mine copper ore which spawns between −16 to 112 world height and then smelt raw copper inside a furnace.

3. Combine the collected Apricorns with the copper ingot on a crafting table to create your first Poke ball. You need four Apricorns of the same color to create one Poke ball.

4. Next, explore the different Minecraft biomes until you stumble upon a Pokemon. Then, right-click and throw your Pokeball on the Pokemon to capture it. Though, you might have to fight a Pokemon and weaken it first to capture it.

How to Fight Pokemon in Cobblemon

Character battles are an essential mechanic of all Pokemon games and Cobblemon in Minecraft is no exception. So, here's how to start and win your first fight in Cobblemon:

1. First, go around your Minecraft world and find a suitable Pokemon to fight. In the beginning, it's best to target Pokemon who are at a level lower than 30.

2. Then, get close to the Pokemon and while looking at it, press the "R" key. The game will open up a pop-up menu. Then, click on the "Fight" button to start your battle.

3. Alternatively, you can click on the "switch" button to change the Pokemon you want to send in the battle.

4. Once the battle begins, you can use any of the available attacks by clicking on their buttons. Cobblemon will give you all the updates in the fight within a small text window on the right side.

5. If your Pokemon faints during the battle, Cobblemon will allow you to switch to another Pokemon and continue the fight. The battle ends when your target or all of your Pokemon faint.

FAQ: Minecraft Cobblemon

How long does it take for a Pokemon to recover in Cobblemon?

It usually takes around 15-20 minutes in real time for a Cobblemon Pokemon to recover in Minecraft. However, you can use a healer to speed up the process.

Is Minecraft Cobblemon free?

Minecraft Cobblemon is completely free to download and use.

How many Pokemon can you have at once?

Cobblemon allows you to have a maximum of 6 Pokemon in your inventory. All your other Pokemon get stored inside a PC which you can use to exchange your characters.

How do you harvest Apricorns in Cobblemon?

You have to use an axe on a fully grown Apricon to harvest it. If you break it before the Apricon is fully grown, it will disappear completely. Meanwhile, if you can't find an axe, you can also break the entire tree to get Apricon. Though, you might have a hard time finding another tree.

Download and Play Minecraft Cobblemon Today

Whether you are playing Cobblemon, Pixelmon, or the classic Pokemon games, the experience isn't complete without having players to challenge. So, don't forget to check out the best Minecraft Cobblemon servers to get a complete experience with this new mod. Moreover, while we are talking about improved gameplay, you should also install the best Minecraft shaders to add a level of realism to Cobblemon. On the other hand, if your system is struggling while handling Pokemon, you should get OptiFine for Minecraft to unlock a performance boost. With that said, it's time for you to jump into Minecraft and catch them all!
excerpt: Find out everything you need to know about Minecraft Cobblemon. Learn how to download and install this Pokemon mod for Minecraft.

title: Minecraft Armor Trims - List of Locations, Recipes and More
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: Minecraft Armor Trims - List of Locations, Recipes and More
content:
After years of waiting and requesting, Minecraft 1.20 is finally bringing true armor customization to the game. You can change how each piece of your armor looks and decorate it with iconic Minecraft patterns. All of this is possible due to the new Armor Trim smithing templates which are a brand-new class of utility items. So, let's stop beating around the bush and find out everything you need to know about Minecraft Armor Trims and how to use them.

Minecraft Armor Trims

Our guide provides you with a complete breakdown of Armor Trims in Minecraft along with a quick tutorial on how to apply them. The information and mechanics are based on Minecraft Snapshot 23w12a. So, everything is subject to change in the final release.

What are Armor Trims in Minecraft

An Armor Trim is a unique smithing template in Minecraft that allows you to add unique patterns to the pieces of your armor. It is a new customization feature coming out with Minecraft 1.20 to give players a new way to express themselves. The changes these trims provide are only cosmetic and don't improve your armor in any practical way.

Currently, there are 16 different Armor Trims in the game which can be applied in 10 unique colors. Since each trim and color can be applied to each individual piece of armor, you get to create a huge variety of armor combinations in the game. If we throw in all the unique colors of leather armor, you can easily get over a billion options of discrete armor sets.

How to Get Armor Trims in Minecraft

Each armor trim in Minecraft spawns as a smithing template item within different structures in all three dimensions of Minecraft. Some are easier than others. But if you know where to look, you will be able to your custom armor in no time.

Here is the list of all Minecraft Armor Trims and where they can be found:

  • Bolt Armor Trim - Trial Chamber
  • Flow Armor Trim - Trial Chamber
  • Coast Armor Trim - Shipwreck
  • Dune Armor Trim - Desert Pyramid
  • Eye Armor Trim - Stronghold
  • Host Armor Trim - Trail Ruins
  • Raiser Armor Trim - Trail Ruins
  • Rib Armor Trim - Nether Fortress
  • Sentry Armor Trim - Pillager Outpost
  • Shaper Armor Trim - Trail Ruins
  • Silence Armor Trim - Ancient City
  • Snout Armor Trim - Bastion Remnant
  • Spire Armor Trim - End City
  • Tide Armor Trim - Ocean Monument
  • Vex Armor Trim - Woodland Mansion
  • Ward Armor Trim - Ancient City
  • Wayfinder Armor Trim - Trail Ruins
  • Wild Armor Trim - Jungle Temple

How to Apply Armor Trims

Color Material

The Armor Trim smithing template determines the pattern you are applying to your armor. But you still need to get the material to color the pattern. Minecraft allows you to use the following minerals as the color options for armor trimming:

  • Amethyst
  • Copper
  • Diamond
  • Emerald
  • Gold
  • Iron
  • Lapis
  • Netherite
  • Quartz
  • Redstone

Contrary to popular belief, you can even use the same material as the base armor to color its trim. For example, you can add a gold-colored armor trim on a gold chest plate. The resulting pattern will result have a slightly darker shade of gold than the rest of the armor piece.

Use Minecraft Armor Trims in Smithing Table

Once you have your desired Minecraft Armor Trims and color material with you, follow these steps to easily trim your armor:

1. First, create a Smithing Table in Minecraft by combining two iron ingots with four wooden planks.

2. Then, open your Smithing Table and place the Armor Trim in the first (leftmost) slot.

3. Next, put the piece of armor you want to customize in the middle slot.

4. Finally the color material in the third (rightmost) slot of the Smithing Table. The UI will show you how the trimmed piece of armor looks on a preview armor stand.

Please note that you have to trim each piece of your armor individually so you need at least 4 armor trims to get a complete set. Moreover, once a piece of armor is trimmed, you can't trim it again.

Frequently Asked Questions

How many Armor Trims are there in Minecraft?

At the moment, there are 16 distinct Armor Trims in Minecraft. 12 of them spawn inside existing structures of your world. Meanwhile, 4 of them spawn in the new Trail Ruins structure of the Trails & Tales update.

What is a Smithing Template?

Smithing Templates are a new class of items in Minecraft 1.20 that allow you to upgrade your diamond gear to Netherite and customize your armor.

What is the best Armor Trim in Minecraft?

Silence Armor Trim is the largest and the rarest Armor Trim in Minecraft. It only has a 1% chance of spawning in the dangerous Ancient Cities which are home to the Warden.

Is Armor Trim in Minecraft Bedrock?

You can enjoy armor trimming in the Minecraft Preview app for the Bedrock Edition before the official release date of Minecraft 1.20.

Get Minecraft 1.20 Armor Trims Today

Whether you want to flex your Netherite collection on Minecraft PvP servers or explore new ways of self-expression, armor trims are there for you. But your outfit can't be complete without choosing the right Minecraft skin to fit your trimmed armor. So, make sure you know how to change your Minecraft skin and get the most out of your experience. Having said that, which is your favorite type of Armor Trim and which one do you like the least? Let's discuss this in our Discord server.
excerpt: Discover how to customize your armor with Minecraft Armor Trims in the Trails & Tales update with our simple and detailed Wiki guide.

title: How to Get Sniffer in Minecraft 1.20
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Get Sniffer in Minecraft 1.20 - Complete Guide
content:
Sniffer is Minecraft's first dinosaur and it's here to change the game completely. New seeds, new mechanics, and a new era of ancient mobs are right around the edge. But before we witness any of it, you must learn how to find the Sniffer in Minecraft. Unlike other common mobs, it can't spawn naturally in the overworld. Instead, you have to bring the Sniffer to life. The process is long and unique but worth the effort. With that said, let's figure out how to get Sniffer in Minecraft and make the most out of this mob.

Sniffer in Minecraft

Our guide relies on the Sniffer mechanics of Minecraft Snapshot 23W12A. All the steps, images, and functions are subject to change when the release date of Minecraft 1.20 comes around.

What is a Sniffer in Minecraft

Winner of Mob Vote 2022, Sniffer is an upcoming functional ancient Minecraft mob. It has the remarkable ability to sniff the ground and dig out rare seeds. These seeds grow into beautiful plants which don't spawn naturally in the overworld. At the moment, there is no other mob in the game that can summon such exclusive drops.

When it comes to behavior, Sniffer doesn't interact with or attack the player or other mobs. It is completely peaceful and friendly. So, most of the time, it just wanders around aimlessly until it detects and digs out a new seed. You can use our dedicated guide to Sniffer in Minecraft to find out everything you need to know about this unique creature. Though, what makes it really special is the way it spawns.

What is a Sniffer Egg

The Sniffer is one of the very few Minecraft mobs that can't spawn naturally in your world. Instead, you have to bring this ancient mob back to life with the help of a special egg. While relying on the archaeological features of Minecraft 1.20, you have to obtain the Sniffer egg by excavating it from suspicious blocks that spawn in ancient structures.

Unfortunately, we still don't have enough information about the complete mechanic of Sniffer eggs. At the moment, you can only obtain it by manually spawning and breeding Sniffers. But, make sure to bookmark our guide to stay up-to-date if the situation changes.

How to Get Sniffer in Minecraft 1.20 

Follow these steps to easily meet the Sniffer in Minecraft right away:

1. First, install the latest version of Minecraft snapshot or Minecraft preview. Sniffer is still not officially in the game, so you have to use the unfinished test versions.

2. Then, create a new Minecraft world with the game mode set to creative. Furthermore, in the Bedrock edition, make sure to turn on experimental features in the world settings before creating the world.

3. Next, open your creative inventory and search for "Sniffer". It will show you the Sniffer spawn egg. Pick and place it in your inventory slots.

4. Finally, use the spawn egg on any empty spot to spawn the Sniffer. If it is near a dirt-based block then it will sit down on it and sniff out rare seeds within minutes of spawning.

Spawn Sniffer Using a Command

If you want to meet the Sniffer on the best Minecraft survival servers or in an existing world, then creative mode might not be an option. Then, you have to use the Minecraft commands to get this iconic mob in all game modes. The command will also give you more freedom to play with its functionality.

So, just type the following command in your chatbox and execute it to spawn a Sniffer:

/summon sniffer

Meanwhile, if you want to spawn a baby Sniffer or Snifflet in Minecraft, you can use the following command instead:

/summon sniffer ~ ~ ~ {Age:-9999999}

Not to forget, if the command doesn't work in your Minecraft world then you need to turn on cheats from the pause menu. The option is available in the LAN section of Java and the world section of Bedrock edition.

Learn How to Get Sniffer in Minecraft Right Now 

Just like that, you are now ready to step into the world of Minecraft 1.20 and meet the Sniffer. But this cute mob isn't the only game-changing element coming to the game with the next update. Don't forget to check out the best Minecraft cherry grove seeds to visit the perfect biome for Sniffer to call home. Then, once you have a majestic mob accompanying you to a beautiful forest, you just need to make the scene look right. For that, the best Minecraft shaders will hold your hands and unlock truly transcending graphics. But let's not venture too far away from the topic at hand. For now, do you have any other ancient mob, like Sniffer, that Minecraft should add? Tell us on our Discord server!
excerpt: Learn how to get the Sniffer in Minecraft with a step-by-step tutorial on getting the Sniffer egg and spawning this mob.

title: How to Breed Sniffer in Minecraft 1.20
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Breed Sniffer in Minecraft 1.20 (Easy Guide)
content:
If you're a seasoned Minecraft player, you know that mobs come in all shapes and sizes. But have you ever heard of Sniffer? This curious creature has a distinct size, a fresh style of spawning, and a truly game-changing way of interacting with the world. But the uniqueness doesn't end there. Sniffer is one of the very Minecraft mobs that lays eggs and the process is unlike anything you've seen before. So, to avoid any confusion and get you ready for the world of Minecraft 1.20, let's dive in and learn how to breed Sniffer in Minecraft right now!

How to Breed Sniffer in Minecraft

Note: Our guide goes over the experimental mechanics of Sniffer from the upcoming Trails & Tales update. All the mechanics, features, and textures are bound to change before the release date of the Minecraft 1.20 update.

What Does the Sniffer Eat

Just like any other Minecraft mob, Sniffer relies on food for breeding and healing itself. But you don't have to hunt for its food as this mob is quite self-sufficient. At the moment, the Sniffer only eats the TorchFlower seeds that it sniffs out of the ground. Though, we expect the list of its food items to increase over time. So, make sure to follow our dedicated guide on Sniffer in Minecraft to stay up to date.

With that said, let's learn how to obtain TorchFlower seeds in MInecraft:

  1. First, get a Sniffer in Minecraft and take it around sniffing compatible blocks. These include dirt, grass, podzol, coarse dirt, rooted dirt, mud, muddy mangrove roots, and moss blocks.
  2. Then, just let the Sniffer roam around freely until it digs out two TorchFlower seeds. You don't have to worry about sowing them. This mob usually waits for around 10 minutes before finding another seed.

How to Breed Sniffer in Minecraft

Once you have TorchFlower seeds, follow these steps to easily breed a Sniffer in Minecraft to get Snifflet:

  1. To begin, locate two Sniffers in Minecraft and bring them close to each other. You can use a lead in Minecraft to move each mob around.
  2. Then, simply feed one TorchFlower seed to each Sniffer and let them get into "love mode". Within a second, you will end up with a Sniffer egg in Minecraft.
  3. Next, pick up the Sniffer egg and place it on any solid surface. Alternatively, you can collect a bunch of eggs and use them later on as well.
  4. Finally, just wait for the Sniffer egg to hatch, and you will be greeted with a Snifflet (baby Sniffer). It takes 20 minutes for a Sniffer egg to hatch but placing it on a moss block reduces the time to just 10 minutes.
  5. You can breed the Sniffers again after 10 minutes. Not to forget, the Baby Sniffer will become an adult within 20 minutes and then it can join the cycle as well.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do you tame a Sniffer?

There is no way to tame the Sniffer in Minecraft. You can only tie it up with a lead or breed the Sniffer in Minecraft.

How do you summon a sniffer in Minecraft?

At the moment, you can only use commands or creative inventory to summon the Sniffer. But when the release date of Minecraft 1.20 comes around, you will be able to excavate the Sniffer egg in suspicious blocks.

Can you ride the Sniffer in Minecraft?

Even though both Sniffer and baby Sniffer are perfectly sized for players to ride them, it is not an intended function. However, you can still use the "/ride" command in Minecraft to ride this mob.

Breed and Get Baby Sniffer in Minecraft

Breeding a Sniffer in Minecraft is a truly rewarding experience in the game. You help this mob grow its family and the Sniffer, in return, helps you expand your garden. The equation is just flawless. But if you are wondering where to grow its sniffed seeds then our list of best Minecraft cherry grove seeds will come in handy. The new cherry blossom-based biome is perfect for the dinosaur mob and your next base. But it is also usually located on the highest peaks of Minecraft. So, make sure to grab a Potion of Slow Falling before getting lost in the beauty of cherry petals. With that said, it's time to gather your resources and embark on a new adventure with your Sniffer family. Happy breeding!
excerpt: Use this step-by-step guide to easily learn how to breed Sniffer in Minecraft 1.20 and get a baby Snifflet

title: Pixelmon Minecraft - Everything You Need to Know
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: Pixelmon Minecraft - Everything You Need to Know in 2023
content:
Have you ever enjoyed Pokemon games or anime in the past? It gives you a world made up of magical creatures that you can befriend, train and fight. Whether you are an explorer or a fight, there are always endless stories waiting to be told. Now, you can get the same experience with Pixelmon in Minecraft. It brings all the structures, items, and Pokemon you love to your pixelated worlds. So, leaving you with enough time to explore, let's dive into Pixelmon Minecraft and quickly uncover everything you need to know.

Pixelmon Minecraft

We are going over different aspects of the Pixelmon modpack of Minecraft in separate sections. Please feel free to explore all of them sequentially to understand everything you need to know.

What is Pixelmon in Minecraft

Pixelmon is one of the most popular and powerful modpack concepts for Minecraft. It brings the features, mechanics, and creatures of Pokemon to your Minecraft world. Poké balls, Pokemon center, evolutions, you name the element and it's here. Moreover, unlike most existing Pokemon games, Pixelmon also allows you to play with other trainers. But more on that later.

In terms of training and catching mechanics, this modpack matches its inspiration at every step. You also get a bunch of gyms around you world to find and collect gym badges. Moreover, even when you are playing in the single-player mode, Pixelmon has a lot of NPC trainers to keep challenging your Pokemon.

Features of Pixelmon

While playing on a Pixelmon mod or server, you can expect to see the following features:

  • Over 900 Pokemon from different generations
  • Functional Pokedex
  • Mega evolutions
  • PvP and multiplayer support
  • Pokemon breeding, training, and battling
  • NPCs, including gym leaders and trainers
  • Pokeballs, TMs, HMs, and evolutionary stones
  • Poke Marts and other structures
  • New biomes and blocks

Other than these features, you can find all the game mechanics from the Generation 8 Pokémon games.

Minimum Requirements

Since Pixelmon is a massive Minecraft modpack, you need to meet at least the following system requirements to run it without an issue:

  • OS: Windows 7 or later, macOS 10.12 Sierra or later, or Linux
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 or later
  • Memory: 4GB RAM or more
  • Graphics Card: NVIDIA GeForce 400 Series or stronger

How to Get Pixelmon on Minecraft

Install Forge for Minecraft

Since Pixelmon Minecraft is a type of modpack, you first have to install Forge, a mod engine, to run it. Here's how:

1. First, go to our dedicated webpage and download Forge for Minecraft 1.16.5. You will end with a file ending in the ".jar" extension. In case you are wondering, Pixelmon doesn't work properly on the newer versions of the game.

2. Then, open the downloaded file to launch the Forge installer. It will automatically detect your game's installation location. Check the "Install Client" option and click on the "Ok" button.

3. It will take a few minutes for Forge to install. Once it does, click on the "Ok" button to close the installer.

Install Pixelmon Modpack

Now that Forge is ready, it's time to get the main modpack up and running. So, follow these steps to easily get Pixelmon for Minecraft:

1. First, go to the Forge page of Pixelmon (here) and click on the grey "Download" button. Your browser will start downloading another ".jar" file.

2. Then, instead of opening it, copy and paste the downloaded file into your "Mods" folder of the Minecraft directory. It is usually located in the following spots:

  • Windows: %appdata%/.minecraft/mods/
  • Mac OS: ~/Library/Application Support/minecraft/mods/
  • Linux: ~/.minecraft/mods/

3. Finally, to launch Pixelmon, open your Minecraft launcher. Then, select "Forge 1.16.5" in the installation dropdown menu and click on the "Play" button.

4. When the game launches, simply create a new world as you always do and being your Pixelmon Minecraft journey. The game will ask you for your starter Pokemon as soon as the world loads.

Pixelmon Minecraft Servers

If you want to experience the world of Pokemon with other players then you should opt for the best Pixelmon servers out there. You can use our linked guide to find all the Pixelmon server options you have. But let's quickly go through a couple of popular ones.

Complex Gaming

It is one of the most active Minecraft servers with a bunch of amazing game modes including sky block, survival, prison, and also Pixelmon. They rely on the Pixelmon Reforged modpack which includes over 850 Pokemon and a bunch of custom features. You can train your Pokemon, take it to gym battles, or fight other players on the server.

  • Server IP: smc.mc-complex.com (Java & Bedrock)



OPBlocks Network

OPBlocks is another popular Minecraft server that offers a bunch of ways to play the game including Pixelmon. It uses a custom modpack to bring hundreds of Pokemon to you. All the main mechanics of training, fighting, and breeding remain the same as in the original Pixelmon. But you get an additional bonus of unlocking the Pixelmon experience even on a weaker system.

  • Java IP: sm.opblocks.com
  • Bedrock IP: bedrock.opblocks.com (Port 19132)

Pixelmon Servers

As the name suggests, this Minecraft server takes the concept of Pixelmon quite seriously. You get all the basic gameplay features along with high spawn rates of regular and shiny Pokemon. Furthermore, there are also all kinds of bonuses including shiny starters and trading to give you the best experience.

  • Java IP: sm.pixelmonrealms.com

Pixelmon Wiki - All the Basics You Need to Know

Whether you join a Pixelmon server or unlock the Pixelom Minecraft experience on your copy of the game, there are a few basics you shouldn't miss. So, unless you want to roam around cluelessly, let's go over everything you need to know:

How to Use a Poke Ball

The most exciting part of any Pokemon experience, let alone Pixelmon, is catching your favorite creature. Follow these steps to learn how to use a Poke ball to catch a Pokemon:

1. First, you need to make Poke Ball lids with the help of Apricorns and ingots. Then, you have to combine them with a button to craft a Poke Ball.

2. Next, you need to find the Pokemon you want to catch. Unique Pokemon spawn in different biomes at distinct times. So, keep your eye out.

3. Finally, just equip the Poke Ball and throw it on the Pokemon to catch it. Keep in mind that weakening the creature first can increase your chances of successfully capturing it.

How to Train Your Pokemon

To make your Pokemon stronger and better, you have to train them in rigorous battles. There are a bunch of ways to train your friends in Pixelmon. Here are a few of the most reliable ones:

  • Battle experience: Every time your Pokemon battles it gains experience to increase its level and stats.
  • Type Targeting: You can target a specific type of Pokemon for the battle to get easy effort value points.
  • Consumables: There are a bunch of edible items including vitamins, wings, and candies in Pixelmon which give EXP and effort value.
  • EXP Share: You can use a special item to train a Pokemon without putting it into a battle. This comes in handy while training a newly captured Pokemon.

Pokemon Evolution

Most Pokemon in Pixelmon evolve only two times but you can find a few of them going through multiple evolutions too. The evolutions are usually triggered by the level and the environmental conditions of each creature. Though, you can use certain evolution stones to quickly level up a few Pokemon including Evee, Pikachu, and others.

Types of Pokemon in Pixelmon Minecraft

Much like the original Pokemon anime and games, you can find a total of 18 types of Pokemon in Pixelmon. These include Bug, Dark, Dragon, Electric, Fairy, Fighting, Fire, Flying, Ghost, Grass, Ground, Ice, Normal, Poison, Psychic, Rock, Steel, and Water.

Not to forget, much like its source material, the type of a Pixelmon Pokemon heavily affects which Pokemon it can defeat. For example, the water-type Blastroise is quite effective against the fire-type Charizard.

Pixelmon Alter Forms

Similar to the shiny forms of Pokemon, the Pixelmon has a bunch of alter forms. These refer to Pokemon with special textures that only spawn in specific biomes and special conditions. You have to time your adventure accurately to catch these ultra-rare Pokemon.

Some of the easy-to-spot options include the following:

  • Zoroark in plains biome at midnight.
  • Porygon Z & Porygon 2 in the End dimension.
  • Doublade in savannas biome at night.
