The dynamic animations in fluid blocks ensure that you step into a Minecraft world that is not rigid. Instead, you get a world that's inviting, fresh, and still easy on your performance. There are the perfect shaders for anyone looking for basic vanilla upgrades.

  • Download Waving Leaves and Water
  • Target Platform(s): Windows, Android/iOS

5. Kamii Shaders

Kamii shaderpack is one of the most powerful Minecraft Bedrock shaders of all time. At its best settings, you get true tone coloring, life-like light interaction, and accurate shadows. When combined, these features can truly level up the visuals of your game. But they also require the resources to do so.

However, if you don't have a strong device to run Kamii Shaders, they do give you the option to level down. So, you can tune your settings to get a world that looks and also runs well for you.

  • Download Kamii Shader
  • Target Platform(s): Windows (experimental), Android/iOS

6. Capricorn PE Shaders

Capricorn PE Shaders' only aim is to provide you with a realistic world and they do it quite well. The most iconic and unique features you get are realistic water and fluid physics. Meanwhile, all the light sources in Minecraft get beautiful and more accurate light interactions. Your world becomes a place where blocks and items visually interact with each.

However, it also has its downside to it. Because of the realistic light interaction, the cave exploration and Nether become quite dark and scary. So, you have to carefully plan your excavations and rely on more light sources than usual. As for the performance, Capricorn has multiple variants of the shaders and you can choose the one that your device can handle well.

  • Download Capricorn PE Shaders
  • Target Platform(s): Windows, Android/iOS

7. FullBright

Cementing the victory of light over darkness, FullBright shaders tries to give you a world with no dark spots. In it, nights and days are alike and your caves are as bright as the daytime overworld. As a concept, it is similar to having a constant night-vision effect. But practically, it is much more convenient and brighter.

You can easily explore caves without worrying about having enough torches or missing an ore. Moreover, at night, the hostile mobs will still spawn but you can easily notice and fight them off. You can also use these Bedrock shaders on the Minecraft PvP servers to get an additional advantage.

  • Download Capricorn PE Shaders
  • Target Platform(s): Windows, Android/iOS

FAQ: Bedrock Shaders

What is RenderDragon?

RenderDragon is a new rendering engine for Minecraft Bedrock which was supposed to improve performance and add RTX support to the game. But it surprisingly restricted several devices from using shaders. So, many powerful Bedrock shaders require you to downgrade your Minecraft below 1.16.200 to get the most out of them.

Do I need OptiFine for Bedrock Shaders?

OptiFine is a powerful Minecraft mod that allows you to unlock unprecedented visuals and performance on the Java edition. However, you don't have to install OptiFine to run shaders on the Java edition.

Minecraft Bedrock and RenderDragon Shaders Today

Whether you are a fan of playing Minecraft on your PC or your phone, now you have unlocked the peak of its graphics. But when it comes to gameplay, graphics aren't everything. So, if you want to truly experience the best this game can offer, we suggest you explore the best Bedrock Minecraft servers. They combine Bedrock's performance with some powerful add-ons to give you the ultimate Minecraft experience. Meanwhile, these Bedrock shaders will ensure that your game looks its best.
excerpt: Explore the best Bedrock shaders for Minecraft and MCPE to get realistic graphics, better performance, and ray-traced textures.

title: Dream United SMP (USMP) - Minecraft Translator Mod
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: Dream United SMP - Minecraft Translator Mod Will Change the World
content:
Dream is one of the most popular Minecraft creators of all time, known for his engaging content, and innovative ideas. Now, he is back with a project that is going to change the way we play Minecraft survival servers all across the globe. The Dream United SMP server and mod is bringing real-time vocal translations to the game and it's truly game-changing. So, while he continues to push the boundaries of what is possible in Minecraft, let's see what this translator mod has to offer!

Dream United SMP

We are covering everything there is to know about Dream's latest project in different sections. Feel free to explore all of them separately at your convenience.

What is Dream's United SMP Mod?

As per his official announcement, Dream is working on a new Minecraft mod that will bring real-time translation to the game. With it, you can see a translation of everything another player is saying right above their head. This allows you to talk to and understand free people from all across the world.

While there are a few existing translation mods already out there, none of them offer vocal translations like Dream's mod. Furthermore, there is almost no delay in the translation which allows you to have real-time conversations with someone without knowing their language.

How Does the Language Translation Work

An API is an application programming interface that creates a bridge between you and third-party software to do any tasks. For example, you can use Google or Microsoft's API to get their translation or text-to-speech abilities into Minecraft.

Dream's United Minecraft translator mod uses voice-to-text APIs to turn everything you are saying to text. Then, it translates the text and shows it in the chatbox and above the speaker's head. This mod translates speech to text in real-time, with almost no delay. Though, due to context, some sentences do end up changing when the speaker finishes speaking.

United SMP Server

In the spirit of global unity that this mod will bring to Minecraft, Dream is launching a new SMP server. This server will be exclusive to 60 creators speaking 6 unique languages from all across the world. Only 10 of these speakers will be English-speaking. We are not sure which creators will be a part of this server, but it will be a game-changing experience for the community.

Furthermore, this unique server will also have a distinct control system to give equal representation to all languages. In it, there will have a mock EU-style committee that will make all the decisions as a group instead of the server having a single owner. This is a unique system that has not been seen in other Minecraft SMP servers, and this experiment might be a turning point for the community.

What Languages Does United SMP Support

At launch, Dream's United SMP server and the mod will officially support the following languages:

  • English
  • Spanish
  • Portuguese
  • French
  • German
  • Korean

As per Ethnologue, a database of global languages, these languages have roughly 2 billion speakers worldwide. All of them will be able to interact with foreign speakers without learning a new language. Though, support for such a diverse section of language might even make it easy for you to learn a new language while playing Minecraft.

Other Languages

Although the United SMP is currently designed to support only six languages at launch, its potential for expansion is infinite. In Dream's official video, we observed that Hindi and Japanese, two popular languages, were featured despite not being on the official list. However, there is no confirmation regarding their eventual support.

But as Dream plans to release the mod as an open-source project, numerous additional languages may be added shortly. Though, this is only possible after the official release of the Minecraft translator mod.

Release Date of United SMP Mod

As per the description of the official video, this creator-only United SMP server is going to release later this month (April 2023). However, there is no word about the public release of the translator mod yet. With such a large-scale and inclusive project, there is no scope for any bugs.

Though, when it eventually launches, Dream has promised a mostly bug-free and inclusive experience. Moreover, this translator mod will be available as an open-source project so other new Minecraft servers might be able to implement it as well.

Will Minecraft Translator Mod be Free?

Just like all the other popular Minecraft modpacks, Dream's translator mod will be completely free for everyone. However, since the mod relies on a bunch of 3rd party APIs, you might have to handle some manual setup on your end. This additional setup may or may not have an extra cost.

Dream United SMP Mod Will Change Minecraft Forever

Dream's United SMP server and mod have the potential to revolutionize the way we communicate in Minecraft. But this is not the only revolutionary element making it to the game in recent days. The new Bedrock editor is changing the way you edit and create your worlds. Similarly, the new mob, Sniffer in Minecraft 1.20 is transforming how you find and plant seeds in Minecraft. Having said that, are you excited to experience Dream's United SMP? Make sure to bookmark up to stay up to date!
excerpt: Find out everything you need to know about Dream United SMP including language list, mechanics, and more.

title: How to Make a Bed in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Bed in Minecraft - Easy Guide (With Pictures)
content:
Whether you are playing by yourself or on the best Minecraft SMP servers, a bed is an irreplaceable part of your toolkit. It allows you to rest, respawn and even kill enemies in a bunch of unique ways. This multipurpose item can transform the way you play the game if you know how to use it properly. So, let's dive in and learn how to make a bed in Minecraft and get the most out of it.

How to Make a Bed in Minecraft (2023)

Our guide covers mechanics, the crafting process, and the uses of beds in Minecraft within separate sections. Explore all of them thoroughly to understand everything you need to know about this amazing item.

Where Do Beds Spawn

By default, the beds spawn inside the villagers' huts in Minecraft. So, if you want to obtain them with almost no effort, you should hunt villages in the game. But the color of the bed changes as per the base biome of the village. You can find the following beds in the villages of the game:

  • Desert and Meadow villages: cyan, green, and lime beds
  • Plains villages: white and yellow beds
  • Savanna villages: red, yellow, and white beds
  • Snowy tundra villages: red, blue, and white beds
  • Taiga villages: purple and blue beds

Other than these, you can also get a red bed inside igloos which spawn in snowy biomes. Once you find a bed you just need to break it with a tool or your hands to pick it up. Then, you can place it anywhere you want and start using it.

Items Required to Make a Bed

You need to collect the following items to make a bed in Minecraft:

  • 3 Wool Blocks (same color)
  • 3 Wood Planks (any)
  • Crafting Recipe

Wooden planks are quite easy to obtain in Minecraft. You just have to find a tree and break its wood with your fist or a tool. Then place the wood blocks in the crafting area to turn them into planks. The crafting recipe for a bed works with all types of wooden planks including the new bamboo wood in Minecraft.

Meanwhile, the fastest way to obtain wool is by killing sheep. But if you don't want to take the aggressive route you can also craft a shear and use it to harvest wool from a sheep. This method ensures that you have a long-lasting supply of wool.

How to Make a Bed in Minecraft - Crafting Recipe

Once you have all the ingredients, follow these steps to easily make a bed in Minecraft:

1. First, right-click or use your secondary action key on a crafting table to open it.

2. Next, fill up an entire row of the crafting area with three blocks of wool. All of these blocks must be of the same color.

3. Then, place a wooden plank beneath each wool block. You have to fill the entire row with planks. These planks can be made out of any type of wood in the game. With that, your bed is ready.

How Do I Make Beds of Different Colors in Minecraft

The color of your bed in Minecraft depends on the wool you use to craft it. Naturally, sheep only spawn with white, black, gray, light gray, brown, and pink wool. But you can use dyes on sheep to change their wool color and then create uniquely colored beds.

Alternatively, you can also combine dye with a bed on a crafting table to change its color. This mechanic allows you to change the color of any bed on the Bedrock edition and the color of white beds on the Java edition.

How to Get Dye in Minecraft

There are fourteen unique dyes in Minecraft and all of them require different items to craft them. The list includes:

  • Black: Ink Sac or Wither Rose
  • Blue: Lapis Lazuli or Cornflower
  • Brown: Cocoa Beans
  • Cyan: Pitcher Plant (from Minecraft 1.20)
  • Gray: Black Dye + White Dye
  • Green: Cactus
  • Light Blue: Blue Orchid
  • Lime: Sea Pickle
  • Orange: Orange Tulip or Torchflower
  • Pink: Pink Tulip or Peony or Pink Petals
  • Purple: Blue Dye + Red Dye
  • Red: Poppy or Red Tulip or Rose Bush or Beetroot
  • White: Bone Meal or Lily of the Valley
  • Yellow: Bone Meal or Lily of the Valley

You can use any of these dyes to make a bed in Minecraft with a unique color. You have to place the dedicated item in the crafting recipe to obtain the dye. This mechanic works for all dyes except green and lime which require smelting in a furnace.

What Does the Bed Do in Minecraft

Much like the real world, the main purpose of a bed in Minecraft is sleeping. You just have to place your bed down and then right-click on it to sleep at night or during a rainstorm. But this isn't the only way to use it. Here are some other uses of beds in Minecraft:

  • Bouncing: If you jump on top of a bed in Minecraft it bounces you back, like a trampoline. Baby villagers are fond of this mechanic and they jump on top of beds all the time.
  • Reducing Fall Damage: A player takes 50% less fall damage when they fall on top of a bed.
  • Curing: If you want to cure a zombie villager in Minecraft, placing a bed near it will help you speed up the process.
  • Setting Spawn Point: Whenever you sleep on a bed it resets your spawn point. So, if you die in Minecraft the game will respawn you right next to the bed you last slept on. Well, as long as the bed is still intact.
  • Spawning Iron Golems: Having a bed around panicking villagers allows you to trigger the spawning of Iron Golems in Minecraft.
  • Explosion: Using a bed in the Nether or the End dimension of Minecraft makes it explode like a TNT block. This method is great for killing mobs without much effort.

What Does Sleeping in a Bed Do in Minecraft?

At first thought, sleeping might appear like a useless task in the game. But, if used correctly, this simple in-game mechanic can heavily affect how you play Minecraft. For starters, it allows you to skip the dangerous nights and rainstorms in a blink. Doing so also allows you to set a new location to respawn when you die in survival mode.

Furthermore, if you don't sleep for more than three days, the game spawns phantoms. They are hostile flying mobs which are a major hassle to deal with. Though if you manage to kill one, you can get phantom membranes in Minecraft.

Who Can Sleep on a Minecraft Bed?

Other than the players, Minecraft only allows villagers and baby villagers to sleep on the bed. While the sleeping aspect doesn't really affect them in a major way, beds play a significant role in the life of villagers. The bed affects the spawn rate, breeding, and even the zombification of villagers.

Moreover, having a bed around villagers also increases the odds of a cat and an Iron Golem spawning near them. Not to forget, if every villager has their own bed, they consider it as their housing. This mechanic allows villagers to stay calm which affects the player's overall popularity in the village.

Frequently Asked Questions

Do beds stop fall damage in Minecraft?

The beds don't completely cancel out the fall damage in the game. But they help you reduce the damage it causes by 50%. So, if you fall from a high enough spot, the bed won't be able to save you.

Can beds destroy Netherite?

The explosions that bed cause in the Nether dimension are even stronger than TNT. But ancient debris, the block that acts like an ore for Netherite, can survive the blast.

What is the size of the bed in Minecraft?

A bed is two blocks long and slightly higher than a half block in Minecraft.

Make and Use a Bed in Minecraft

Now that you know how to make a bed in Minecraft, you can use it for a variety of purposes. Whether you want to rest or go on a war, the bed is there to have your back. But if you want to see the true limits of this item, you should join some of the best Minecraft Bedwars servers. They are a perfect spot to make new friends and test your combat skills. Though, you might have to get a diamond sword to stand a chance against seasoned players. Having said that, it's time for you to jump into the same and start crafting!
excerpt: Learn how to make a bed in Minecraft with a simple step-by-step tutorial. Explore its crafting recipe, uses, and more.

title: QSMP in Minecraft - First Bilingual Server
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: QSMP in Minecraft - First Bilingual Server Explained
content:
The best Minecraft servers are known for connecting players across borders irrespective of their age, location, or language. However, even with such creative potential, the game has to bow down in front of language barriers. But all of that is about to change, thanks to QSMP in Minecraft. Releasing under the banner of Quackity, it's the first Minecraft server that supports two languages at once. It is unlike anything else we have seen so far. So let’s not waste another second and learn all about the new QSMP in Minecraft.

QSMP in Minecraft

Our guide goes over various aspects of the QSMP server in separate sections. You can check out the official trailer here before diving into the details.

What is QSMP in Minecraft

Taking the world by storm, QSMP (Quackity's Survival Multiplayer) is the first-ever bilingual Minecraft survival server, allowing players to communicate flawlessly between English and Spanish in real time. This is a perfect fit for the Quackity community, which includes both English and Spanish-speaking individuals.

Unfortunately, the server is currently exclusive to popular creators and not accessible to everyone. However, you can still enjoy amazing content in both languages from talented creators. Furthermore, the launch of QSMP may inspire other creators to follow suit and release more multilingual Minecraft content.

How Does the Translation Work

QSMP allows you players to have real-time conversations with other players in English and Spanish. When a player speaks in Spanish, the server translates it and displays English text bubbles on top of the speaker, allowing players who primarily speak English to understand and communicate with Spanish-speaking players. The vice versa also works flawlessly. This translation happens in real time and uses the voice of the players to grab the content. 

Players can freely speak and play their native language without having to type it or worry about others understanding them. So, while watching streams of this bilingual server you can understand Spanish and English languages from global creators.

If more Minecraft survival servers implement this concept that we might see an end to all language barriers in gaming altogether. QSMP is paving the way for a more inclusive and globally accessible gaming community.

Which YouTubers and Twitch Streamers are a Part of QSMP?

As per the official announcement, there are 16 Minecraft creators on the QSMP server, playing and creating content together. The list includes:

  • Wilbursoot
  • FitMC
  • Philza
  • JaidenAnimations
  • BadBoyHalo
  • FoolishGamers
  • DanTDM
  • Slimecicle
  • Luzu
  • Rubius
  • ElMariana
  • Spreen
  • MissaSinFonia
  • Roier
  • Vegetta777
  • Maximus

As the server evolves over time more creators might join the squad and even replace the existing ones in the process. You can keep an eye out for the same on the official accounts of QSMP.

How to Watch QSMP in Minecraft

The QSMP server went online on March 22nd, 2023. Since then, we are getting weekly streams in both English and Spanish with a fresh roleplay concept. You can watch the latest event of the bilingual server on Quackity’s Twitch and Youtube channels.

Currently, we have two steams that you can enjoy right away:

  • Day 1 QSMP
  • Day 2 QSMP

Though, you might be able to find even more content on each creator's social media.

Experience English & Spanish QSMP in Minecraft

From puzzle-solving to storytelling, there is a lot of stuff that QSMP in Minecraft will bring in the upcoming months. But it isn't the only multi-lingual option in the list of best Minecraft SMP servers. The popular Youtube creator Dream also announced his United SMP project which will bring a real-time translation of 6 languages to the game. However, neither of these SMPs has a release date for the general public yet. So, while you wait, make sure to check out the new Cobblemon Minecraft modpack. This Pokemon experience is almost as game-changing as the support for multiple languages.
excerpt: Here's everything you need to know about Quackity's bilingual QSMP in Minecraft. Explore its creator list, features, and more.

title: How to Make a Bunk Bed in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Bunk Bed in Minecraft 1.20 - Easy 2023 Guide
tags: Minecraft Builds, Minecraft Basics, Bunk Bed
content:
Are you tired of the same old boring beds in Minecraft? Why not spice things up with a bunk bed? Not only are they a unique and fun addition to any Minecraft world, but they're also quite practical. You and your squad can experience true team teamplay on the best Minecraft SMP servers by sharing the sleeping area. So, let's unlock some fun memories and cleaner base designs by learning how to make a bunk bed in Minecraft within no time.

How to Make a Bunk Bed in Minecraft

While there is no official bunk bed item in Minecraft, there is no limitation on creative freedom either. Relying on the latter, our guide offers a simple yet effective design to cover your team's bedding needs.

Items Required to Make a Bunk Bed

You have to get the following items to craft a bunk bed in Minecraft:

  • 5 Trapdoors
  • 2 Beds
  • 1 Stairs
  • 2 Ladders
  • 2 Planks

From a technical point of view, you can use any type of wood in the game to craft the required ingredients. We are going with the new bamboo wood in Minecraft for a sleek and modern look. But we suggest you experiment and find the combination that suits your needs.

Crafting Recipe for a Trapdoor

Trapdoors are the main element that establishes the main shape of a bunk bed. They help you make dividers and the borders of the main design. To craft a trapdoor, you need to completely fill two rows of the crafting table with 6 wooden planks.

This crafting recipe will give you 2 trapdoors. You need a total of 30 wooden planks to get the required 5 trapdoors for a bunk bed in Minecraft. The type of wood doesn't affect the practical aspect of the bunk bed.

How to Make Stairs

The stairs have a very straightforward crafting recipe in the game. You just have to create a staircase pattern with planks in the crafting area to turn them into stairs. This recipe uses 6 planks and gives out four stairs. Though, you only need 1 for your build.

How to Make Ladders

Ladders, you can guess, are vital to make your bunk beds functional in Minecraft. To get them, you have to arrange seven sticks in the same pattern as the crafting recipe in the image above. The crafting table will give you three ladders. We only need two for this project. However, you can add the additional to make it easier to climb the top part of your build.

How to Make a Bunk Bed in Minecraft

Now that you have all the required items, let's learn how to make a bunk bed in Minecraft and also prepare its base area.

Where to Make the Bunk Bed in Minecraft

A common bunk bed is four blocks high and three blocks wide. So, you need at least a 2 x 5 x 4 (L x W x H) space to build one. For context, the interior of a villager's hut is a perfect size to create bunk beds in it.

Moreover, we suggest you decorate the selected area to match the design of your bunk bed. For our guide, we are going with the smooth stone blocks to get a modern area for a bamboo bunk bed.

Steps to Make a Bunk Bed in Minecraft

With the basic preparation out of the way, follow these steps to create a bunk bed in Minecraft:

1. First, place a bed in the middle of your chosen area. Make sure it has at least one block gap at its front and back.

2. Next, at the end of the bed, place two planks on top of one another. Then put a stairs block on top of the planks. The smaller side of the stairs should be facing toward the bed.

3. Then, place one ladder on each of the wooden planks. These will help you climb on top of the upper bunk bed.

4. Then, go to the other side of the bed and place three trapdoors on top of each other. You will have to crouch while placing the second trapdoor. Once you are done, open both of them to create a back for your bunk bed.

5. Finally, aim at the upper plank and place two trapdoors on its side. These trapdoors should be parallel to the bed and they must remain closed.

6. Now, you just need to place the second bed on top of the trapdoor and your bunk bed in Minecraft is ready for use.

7. Not to forget, once you are done with the main design, you can also add a bunch of other decorations to the room. Doing so will make the bed fit better with the overall base.

Make a 4-Person Bunk Bed

A regular bunk bed is perfect for a couple of playing and duos playing on Minecraft PvP servers. But if you have a complete squad then a 4-person bunk bed is the ideal option. Fortunately, you don't need an additional tutorial to create it.

You just have to set up a second two-floor bed system on the other side of the plank tower. The new set of beds should be placed inversely to the original beds to create symmetry. You can also replace the stairs block with a wooden slab to get a cleaner designer.

Make and Use a Bunk Bed in Minecraft

Now that you know how to make a bunk bed in Minecraft, you have explored a whole new way to utilize beds in the game. But this is just the surface of possibilities. You just join some of the best Bedwars servers to see the true potential of this item. These servers turn beds into your most precious and even your literal lifeline. Though, surviving them isn't a piece of cake. So, you must learn how to make a diamond sword in Minecraft to even stand a chance. Having said that, do you know any other unique designs for beds in Minecraft? Don't forget to share your unique concept on our Discord server!
excerpt: Learn how to make a bunk bed in Minecraft 1.20 with our easy 2023 guide. Spice up your Bedwars servers with a clean and modern base design.

title: How to Make a Pickaxe in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Pickaxe in Minecraft - Easy Guide (2023)
content:
If you can't guess by the name of the game, let me tell you that a pickaxe is the most crucial tool in Minecraft. It helps you explore caves, get useful resources, and collect blocks for all your builds. Moreover, if you are on one of the best Minecraft prison servers, the pickaxe is vital for your survival. So, let's figure out how to make a pickaxe in Minecraft and unlock its true potential.

How to Make a Pickaxe in Minecraft (2023)

We are first going over the basics of a pickaxe before moving on to its crafting process. If you are a beginner in Minecraft, we strongly suggest you explore our guide chronologically instead of skipping to the crafting recipe.

What is a Pickaxe in Minecraft

A pickaxe is easily the most popular and most used tool in Minecraft. You need it to mine ores, stones, and metallic blocks in the game. While its main purpose is to allow you to pick up a selected group of vital blocks, this tool also helps you mine blocks at a faster rate.

Whether you want to top the leaderboard of the best Minecraft survival servers or quickly create a new base, a pickaxe is unmissable. But what matters, even more, is choosing the right pickaxe.

Types of Pickaxe

On the basis of in-game materials, there are 6 types of pickaxes in Minecraft:

  • Wood
  • Stone
  • Iron
  • Golden
  • Diamond
  • Netherite

The speed and durability of a pickaxe depend upon its material. Out of these, the Netherite pickaxe is the strongest and most long-lasting one. Meanwhile, a gold pickaxe is the fastest option in most cases.

You can also divide pickaxes further as enchanted and non enchanted pickaxes. But usually, the base material has a much more significant effect than the enchantments on a tool. So, if you are playing on Minecraft SMP servers, we suggest you target materials like diamonds first instead of enchantments.

How to Find a Pickaxe in Minecraft

There are a bunch of ways to obtain a pickaxe in Minecraft other than crafting one from scratch. The easiest way to get one is by exploring structures including mineshafts, strongholds, villages, End cities, ruined portals, and bastion remnants. All of these structures generate pickaxes in their chests.

On the other hand, you can also trade with toolsmith villagers to get a variety of pickaxes. But you might have to cure a zombie villager first to unlock reliable trades. Not to forget, killing pillagers and vindicators during a raid can also make them drop damaged pickaxes.

Items Required to Make a Pickaxe

A player must collect the following items to make a Pickaxe in Minecraft:

  • 2 Sticks
  • 3 Pieces of base material
  • Diamonds,
  • Iron ingots,
  • Gold ingots,
  • Wooden planks, or
  • Stone blocks
  • Crafting table

Interestingly, all of the base materials, except gold, are interdependent. You need a wooden pickaxe to get stone, a stone pickaxe to get iron, and an iron pickaxe to get stronger materials. Moreover, you

Meanwhile, you just need to place two wooden planks vertically next to each other in the crafting area to get sticks. This recipe works flawlessly with all types of wood in the game including the new bamboo wood of Minecraft 1.20.

Crafting Recipe of Pickaxe in Minecraft

Once you have all the required ingredients, follow these steps to make a pickaxe in Minecraft:

1. First, completely fill the topmost row of the crafting table with three material items.

2. Then, place a stick in the middle cell of the second and bottommost row. With that, your pickaxe is ready. This crafting recipe works for wood, stone, iron, gold, and diamond pickaxes.

3. Lastly, if you want to create a Netherite pickaxe then you have to rely on a smithing table. In it, you must place a diamond pickaxe along with an upgrade smithing template and Netherite ingot.

How to Repair a Pickaxe in Minecraft

Knowing how to make a pickaxe in Minecraft will unlock a ton of possibilities, but you can’t create a new one every time it breaks. So, follow these steps to repair any pickaxe in Minecraft including diamond and Netherite:

1. First, create an anvil in Minecraft by combining three iron blocks with four iron ingots on the crafting table.

2. Then, place your damaged pickaxe along with its base material it is in the anvil. So, to repair a diamond pickaxe you need to place it with a piece of diamond. Then, the anvil will restore the durability of your tool at the cost of experience levels.

3. Alternatively, you can also combine two damaged pickaxes with each other to get a repaired one. But this method only works if both of the tools are made out of the same material.

Best Pickaxe Enchantments

Now that you know how to make a Pickaxe in Minecraft, let's push it to the next level by giving it special abilities. Here are some of the great enchantments that can make your pickaxes truly powerful:

  • Efficiency: Increases the speed by which a pickaxe mines
  • Fortune: Improves the chances of getting a rarer drop and increases the number of items dropped
  • Silk Touch: Allows you to pick up certain items as themselves instead of their usual mined form
  • Unbreaking: Decreases the chances of durability reduction which effectively makes the pickaxe last longer
  • Mending: Restores the durability of a pickaxe at the cost of experience points

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I make a Wooden Pickaxe in Minecraft?

You can make a wooden pickaxe by combining two sticks with three planks. The planks can be made out of any type of wood in Minecraft.

Which pickaxe is faster?

A gold pickaxe is the fastest tool to mine any block in Minecraft. But it also has a very low durability which makes it quite ineffective in the long run.

What do you use a pickaxe for in Minecraft?

The pickaxe helps you mine a variety of building and natural blocks in Minecraft. It is important for collecting ores, blocks, and even some utility items.

Can I use a pickaxe as a weapon?

While the pickaxe is a much stronger option than fighting with a fist, it is not the best weapon against most enemies. Instead, you should create a diamond sword in Minecraft and keep it handy even during mining adventures.

Make and Use a Pickaxe in Minecraft

Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned player, knowing how to make a pickaxe in Minecraft can significantly improve your gameplay. But as you will discover, simply mining with a regular pickaxe can get boring over time. So, as soon as you get a chance, make sure to install Forge in Minecraft and use some amazing MC modpacks to upgrade your tools. Doing so will not only give your pickaxe supernatural abilities but also make it more fun. Having said that, it's time to grab your pickaxe and start exploring the vast world of Minecraft!
excerpt: Learn how to make a pickaxe in Minecraft with our step-by-step guide. Discover everything you need to know about crafting and using a pickaxe in Minecraft.

title: How to Make Stone Bricks in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make Stone Bricks in Minecraft (2023) - Easy Guide
content:
Blocks in Minecraft usually have a single texture on all of the faces. So, when you make a structure with them it often gives you a clean but simple pattern. This can get quite boring pretty quickly. Luckily, there are stone bricks in the game which are perfect to spice things up. These beautifully designed blocks add depth and sophistication to your creations. They're also incredibly versatile, coming in a variety of styles, from smooth to mossy to cracked. So, let's stop beating around the bush and learn how to make stone bricks in Minecraft.

How to Make Stone Bricks in Minecraft

We are first going over the basic mechanics and types of stone bricks before moving on to the crafting recipes. If you are already familiar with these blocks, you can directly move on to the creation.

What are Stone Bricks in Minecraft

Stone bricks are a type of building block in Minecraft that have a texture resembling small rectangular bricks. These blocks can be used to create visually pleasing and well-connected structures, much like real-world houses. With several variants available, stone bricks offer players a variety of creative possibilities in their builds.

Types of Stone Bricks

There are a total of four types of stone bricks in Minecraft:

  • Stone Bricks: Blocks made up of four stone bricks with a clean and seamless texture
  • Mossy Stone Bricks: A variant of stone bricks but with pieces of moss covering them
  • Chiseled Stone Bricks: Blocks with a hollow square surrounding a small square pattern on all faces
  • Cracked Stone Bricks: A variant of stone bricks with cracks all over it

Not to forget, on the Bedrock edition, you can also get stone bricks made out of smooth stone in Minecraft. However, they look just like regular stone bricks so it's not worth the effort to create them.

How to Find Stone Bricks

The stone bricks naturally generate a bunch of Minecraft structures including strongholds, igloos, ocean ruins, ruined portals, jungle temples, and trail ruins‌. So, you can collect a bunch of them while looking for armor trims across your world. Though, you might have to deal with blocks infested with silverfish in the strongholds. Meanwhile, you can also trade with stone mason villagers to get chiseled stone bricks.

Crafting Recipe of Stone Bricks

Now that you know the basics of this amazing block and its variants, it's time to create it. So, follow these simple steps to create stone bricks in Minecraft:

1. First, find and mine stone blocks by breaking them with a pickaxe. These blocks usually spawn underground or near water and give out cobblestones.

2. Then, place your mined cobblestone blocks inside a furnace and smelt them to get stone blocks. Alternatively, you can use a silk-touch pickaxe to mine the stone blocks to obtain them directly.

3. Finally, place the four stones in a square arrangement on the crafting table to turn them into stone bricks in Minecraft.

Create Mossy Stone Bricks

The mossy stone bricks are a much-desired variant of the regular blocks. They add a rustic look to your structure and also make them more connected to nature. If you want to create a base in the new Cherry Grove biome then this block is a must-have.

To create it, you just have to combine a stone bricks block with vines or a moss block on a crafting table. The final result is the same irrespective of what natural element you combine your bricks block with.

Chiseled Stone Bricks

The chiseled stone bricks are uniquely textured variants of regular stone bricks. Follow these steps to create them:

1. First, place three stone bricks horizontally next to each other in a row on the crafting table. This will turn them into slabs.

2. Then, place two newly created slabs one above another on the crafting table. With that, your chiseled stone bricks are ready.

3. Not to forget, you can also place stone blocks inside a stone cutter to turn them into chiseled bricks.

How to Make Cracked Stone Bricks in Minecraft

Finally, there are cracked stone bricks in Minecraft that are ideal for creating ancient structures. Simply place regular stone bricks in a furnace and smelt them to make these unique blocks. They will be a great addition to the upcoming Minecraft 1.20 update, which focuses on archaeology, ruins, and forgotten past themes.

Uses of Stone Bricks in Minecraft

While all types of stone bricks are great for building, you can do a lot more with them including:

  • Lodestone: Combine chiseled stone bricks with a Netherite ingot to create a lodestone. This block allows you to recalibrate your compass which is great for finding spots in the survival Minecraft servers.
  • Slabs: You can turn all your stone bricks into slabs and unlock more building capabilities with a half block. To create them, you just have to place three regular blocks, next to each other, in the same row of the crafting table.
  • Stairs: If you want to move around your base more easily or decorate it in unique ways, you can create brick stairs. Just arrange a bunch of stone bricks blocks in a staircase format and your stairs are ready.

How to Make Stone Bricks in Minecraft

Stone bricks in Minecraft are perfect to add depth and texture to any of your structures. Whether you're building on the best Minecraft mountain seeds or looking for inspiration on CityBuild servers, stone bricks are sure to enhance your creations. The best Minecraft mountain seeds will give you a great spot to create your next structure. As for what you can create, the best Minecraft CityBuild servers are the perfect spot to get inspiration. Having said that, how are you planning to use the stone bricks? Share your concept on our Discord server.
excerpt: Learn how to make stone bricks in Minecraft and add depth and sophistication to your structures. Explore their variants from smooth to mossy to cracked.

title: Best Enchantments for Pickaxe in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: 6 Best Enchantments for Pickaxe in Minecraft 1.20 - Ranked
content:
There is no doubt that a pickaxe is the most iconic tool in Minecraft. But in itself, it can feel a bit helpless in certain situations. So, to give it a much-needed boost we have some of the best enchantments for pickaxe in Minecraft. From faster mining to increased durability, the right addon can significantly improve your mining experience. So whether you're looking for Armor Trims or rare ores, read on to discover the enchantments that can take your mining to the next level.

Best Enchantments for Pickaxe in Minecraft (2023)

Our list ranks the enchantments on the basis of their usefulness and overall benefits. But based on certain situations, some improvements can be better than others. So, please consider your specific needs when choosing which enchantments to use on your pickaxe.

1. Silk Touch

  • Compatibility: Incompatible with Fortune
  • Obtaining: Enchanting table and librarian villagers
  • Max Level: I

Silk Touch is one of the most powerful and game-changing enchantments for pickaxe in Minecraft. It allows you to pick up a bunch of blocks as a whole instead of their general drops. For example, a diamond ore block usually drops diamonds, but with Silk Touch, you get the ore block as a whole.

Many blocks including amethyst buds, sculk blocks, and ice can't be obtained without Silk Touch. To keep this powerful mechanic in check, the game doesn't allow you to combine it with Fortune enchantment. Moreover, there is only one level of Silk Touch. So, it can't be improved any further in any way.

2. Unbreaking

  • Compatibility: Compatible with all
  • Obtaining: Enchanting table, enchanted books from dungeons, and librarian villagers
  • Max Level: III

Every time you use a pickaxe in Minecraft it loses some of its durability. Once this durability goes all the way down, your tool breaks and disappears completely. The Unbreaking enchantment counters this mechanic reducing the chance of durability reduction.

So, your pickaxe will take damage only after every few rounds of usage instead of after every use. This effectively will make your pickaxe last much longer than usual. Furthermore, you can upgrade your tool to the highest of Unbreaking III to get an almost unbreakable pickaxe.

3. Fortune

  • Compatibility: Incompatible with Silk Touch
  • Obtaining: Enchanting table, enchanted books from dungeons, and librarian villagers
  • Max Level: III

Staying true to its name, the Fortune enchantment makes you richer by providing better and more loot than usual. For example, with Fortune III, you can end up with a maximum of 4 diamonds from a single diamond ore block. But this increase, much like Unbreaking, is based on chance only.

Similarly, when you use the Fortune on certain blocks with multiple drops, they have higher chances of giving their rare drop. So, if you mine a gilded blackstone block with a Fortune III pickaxe, you will always end up with gold nuggets. With that, fortune is the best enchantment for pickaxe in Minecraft for players looking for rare loot.

4. Efficiency — Best Enchantments for Pickaxe

  • Compatibility: Compatible with all
  • Obtaining: Enchanting table, loot in bastion remnant, and End cities
  • Max Level: V

The speed of a pickaxe can heavily affect how useful it is to you in certain situations. That's where Efficiency enchantment comes in; it can increase your mining speed. There are five levels of Efficiency and at level V, you can mine at a 45% faster rate.

If you are on Minecraft CityBuild servers, it can define where you rank on the leaderboard. But do keep in mind that your pickaxe won't last indefinitely. So, you must add some kind of repair mechanism to make it survive your speed upgrade.

5. Mending — Best Enchantments for Pickaxe

  • Compatibility: Compatible with all
  • Obtaining: Loot from fishing, raid, jungle temple, stronghold, ancient cities, and librarian villager
  • Max Level: I

The Mending enchantment allows you to easily restore your pickaxe's durability in exchange for experience orbs. So, as you venture around the world and collect experience orbs, they automatically repair your tool in exchange for experience points.

While this sounds great in theory, acquiring experience while mining can be difficult. Instead, you have to rely on a weapon like a diamond sword and kill mobs who drop XP orbs to repair your pickaxe. This simple limit puts this powerful upgrade so low on our list of the best enchantments for pickaxe in Minecraft.

6. Curse of Vanishing

  • Compatibility: Compatible with all
  • Obtaining: Loot from fishing, raid, jungle temple, stronghold, ancient cities, and librarian villager
  • Max Level: I

To sum up our list of the best enchantments for pickaxe, we have Curse of Vanishing. It makes your pickaxe disappear when you die instead of dropping it. So, you can't get your item back after respawning which makes an undesired addition to your tools.

However, if you are one of the best Minecraft prison servers, it can be a blessing in disguise. The Curse of Vanishing ensures that neither you nor any other player can obtain your vital tool. The situation isn't ideal but it's much better than letting your enemy get a free upgrade.

FAQ: Best Enchantments for Pickaxe

What are the max enchantments on a pickaxe?

You can apply a maximum of three enchantments on a pickaxe in the survival game mode of Minecraft.

What is the best enchantment for a diamond pickaxe?

A combination of Unbreaking and Fortune is best to get the most out of a diamond pickaxe in Minecraft.

Which pickaxe mines faster?

The gold pickaxe with Efficiency V is the fastest tool to mine blocks in a Minecraft world.

Add Amazing Enchantments to Pickaxe in Minecraft

Choosing the best enchantments for pickaxes in Minecraft comes down to your playstyle and needs. But, when it comes to the location of using this enchanted tool, we suggest you explore the best Cherry Grove Minecraft seeds. They not only look beautiful but also spawn you close to a bunch of mountains and cave openings. Though, if patent mining isn't your style, you can also make a TNT in Minecraft and unleash chaos in your world. Happy mining!
excerpt: Looking for the best enchantments for pickaxe in Minecraft? Our comprehensive guide covers everything you need to know to maximize your mining efficiency, speed, and delight.

title: How to Get Scutes in Minecraft - Easy Guide
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Get Scutes in Minecraft - Easy Guide
content:
With hundreds of items and blocks in Minecraft, it's quite easy to miss out on a few of them. One such untreated item is scutes that hold the power to the strongest potion in Minecraft and even make your underwater adventure easier. But this item can't be crafted, looted, or found in the game. Instead, you have to be present at the right spot at the right time to obtain it. If you play on the best Minecraft survival servers, other players might even beat you to it. So, with no time to waste, let's learn how to get scutes in Minecraft right away!

How to Get Scutes in Minecraft

Obtaining scutes in Minecraft involves a bunch of complex in-game mechanics. So, make sure to explore all the segments of our guides sequentially to avoid any errors.

What Are Scutes in Minecraft

Scutes are unique items in Minecraft that only the baby turtles drop. They can't be crafted, smelted, or even obtained by killing mobs. This makes these items quite hard to obtain and almost impossible to farm.

In the real world, the term "scutes" refers to the scales that are on the back of turtles. As the turtle grows, the scutes shed themselves and large scutes that are growing under the original ones take over. The game has implemented a similar mechanic for this unique item and even though it feels a bit complex, the benefits make it worth the effort.

Uses of Scutes

You can use scutes in three unique ways within Minecraft:

  • Turtle Shells: A special type of helmet that allows you to breathe underwater for 10 seconds longer than usual. You need 5 scutes to make them.
  • Potion of the Turtle Master: You can use the turtle shells to create this special potion that protects you from up to 80% damage. So, effectively, the scutes also become a part of this potion's brewing process.
  • Trading: Expert-level cleric and leatherworker villagers buy scutes for emeralds.

Other than these uses, you can also rely on scutes to repair the turtle shells when they get damaged. This mechanic works just like all the other armor materials in the game. Though, surprisingly, the scutes don't have any role in the armor trims of Minecraft, not even as a coloring material.

How to Obtain Scutes in Minecraft

In Minecraft survival, scutes only appear when baby turtles grow into adult turtles and drop this item. So, you first need to get baby turtles and then you must protect them until they grow up to get the desired loot.

Find and Breed Turtles

Follow these steps to get breed turtles in Minecraft:

1. First, go to the beaches of Minecraft to look for turtles. They only spawn in the sandy variants of beaches during daytime and they can be in a group of up to 5 turtles at once. You also have a 10% chance of finding baby turtles but we suggest you don't rely on it.

2. Then, you have to find and collect seagrass which spawns on the floor of oceans in Minecraft except for the frozen oceans. You only need two pieces of seagrass for the breeding process.

3. Then, feed the seagrass to two turtles and let them get into "love" mode. Within seconds, one of them will lay 1–4 turtle eggs in a nearby sand block.

Tips to Take Care of Turtle Eggs and Baby Turtles

While the turtle eggs slowly hatch and the baby turtles grow into adults, you just have to patiently wait to get your scutes. However, it isn't as simple as it sounds. Both eggs and baby turtles are prone to attacks by a variety of mobs but they can't protect themselves. So, you have to turn into a parent and protect the turtle family until the egg turns into an adult.

The mobs that attack baby turtles and turtle eggs include:

  • Zombies, zombie villagers, husks, and drowned
  • Zombified Piglins and Zoglins
  • Wither skeletons, skeletons, strays and
  • Ocelots, Wolves, Cats, and Foxes (untamed ones)
  • Withers

Other than these, even friendly mobs like the Sniffer can accidentally break turtle eggs by stepping on them. But your biggest worry should be the zombie mobs to deal with whom, you must have a diamond sword in Minecraft.

How long does it take for a baby turtle to grow?

It usually takes around 4 to 5 in-game days for the eggs to hatch. Then, it takes another whole Minecraft day to grow into an adult. Moreover, the eggs grow most during the night. So, you might have to stay up multiple days within the game to get scutes in Minecraft.

Unfortunately, not sleeping for three or more days makes the game spawn phantoms which are flying hostile mobs. They can get pretty annoying to kill if you don't have the right equipment. But if you do kill them, you will end up getting phantom membranes in Minecraft. These are vital brewing ingredients that allow you to create a Potion of Slow Falling in Minecraft.

Get and Use Scutes in Minecraft

With that, you are now ready to explore the depths of the oceans. But, before you start your sea journey, don't forget to create a raft with bamboo wood in Minecraft. While you are at it, you should also try the best Minecraft shaders to ensure that the water you are spending time in looks its best. Though, you will have to download OptiFine to get them to work. But, let's not venture too far from the topic at hand and come up with ways to farm scutes in Minecraft. Drop your ideas on our Discord server and they might make it into the next guide.
excerpt: Learn how to get scutes in Minecraft and use them with a detailed step-by-step tutorial with images.

title: How to Make Potion of Night Vision in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make Potion of Night Vision in Minecraft - Simple Guide
content:
The world of Minecraft is beautiful and welcoming throughout the day. There are mobs to meet, structures to loot, and biomes like Cherry Grove to explore. But the same world becomes ominous when the sun goes down and the hostile mobs come out. And to make the matters worse, you can't even see clearly most of the time. Luckily, you can make all of it go away with the help of a potion that allows you to see in the dark. With it, your cave, underwater, and nighttime adventures will become a piece of cake. So, let's stop beating around the bush and learn how to make a Potion of Night Vision in Minecraft.

How to Make Potion of Night Vision in Minecraft (2023)

We are going over the basics, ingredients, and the brewing process of the Potion of Night Vision in separate sections. You can go through them as per your interest. But don't forget to explore some alternate ways to get the effects of this powerful potion at then of our guide.

What is a Potion of Night Vision in Minecraft

As you can guess, the Potion of Night Vision is the ultimate visual upgrade in the game. It allows you to see clearly in low-light areas and even in places with no light. With night vision, your nighttime world looks as bright and clear as it does during the day. Moreover, you can also use it in caves and underwater where the light is almost nonexistent even during the day.

Some players also rely on this potion while exploring the Nether dimension to easily find structures. So, whether you want to find rare ores in caves, loot buried treasure in the deep ocean, or fight phantoms at night, the Potion of Night Vision has your back.

Items Required to Make Potion of Night Vision

You need the following items to make a Potion of Night Vision:

  • Golden Carrot
  • Nether Warts
  • Bottle of Water
  • Brewing Stand
  • Blaze Powder

All potions in the game, require storage space. For that, you must create a bottle by combining three blocks of glass. Then, you need to use that bottle of water source to get a bottle of water. Then, make a Nether Portal in Minecraft and then go to the Nether dimension.

There, you have to look for Nether warts that grow inside the Nether Fortress and Bastion Remnant structures. Before leaving the Nether, you must find and kill a Blaze to get Blaze rods. Placing these rods on the crafting table will give you Blaze powder which is the fuel for the brewing stand.

How to Make a Brewing Stand


The brewing stand is the main utility block that allows you to brew potions in Minecraft. Unlike you find it in a village, you have to make it yourself. To make a brewing stand, you need to combine three cobblestone blocks with a Blaze rod and the above-mentioned crafting recipe.

How to Get Golden Carrot

While keeping up with the popular belief of carrots improve eye-sight, golden carrots are the main element of Potion of Night Vision. Follow these steps to quickly make one:

1. First, look for a gold ore block in the caves of the overworld. Then, smelt the raw gold inside a furnace to get a gold ingot.

2. Then, place the gold ingot on the crafting table to break it down into nine gold nuggets.

3. Next, you have to look for carrots that spawn in the farms of plains and snowy villages.

4. Finally, combine one carrot with eight gold nuggets on a crafting table. With that, your golden carrot is ready.

How to Make Potion of Night Vision (3:00)

Now that you have all the required brewing ingredients, let's learn how to make a Potion of Night Vision in Minecraft with simple steps:

1. To begin, open your brewing stand and place the bottle of water in the bottom slot and the Blaze powder in the left slot. The Blaze powder will immediately turn into fuel.

2. Next, put Nether warts in the top slot of the brewing stand. It will start brewing into the bottle and turn the water into an Awkward Potion. This effectless potion is the base of stronger potions in the game.

3. Finally, let the Awkward Potion stay in the bottom slot and place a golden carrot in the top slot of the brewing stand. Within seconds, your Potion of Night Vision will be ready.

Note: Each golden carrot and Nether wart can be used to create up to three potions at once. So, make sure to completely fill the bottle slots while brewing your potion.

Extended Potion of Night Vision (8:00)

By default, the Potion of Night Vision only lasts for three minutes. This duration is nowhere close to being enough for exploring the nighttime or even caves. Luckily, you can get additional five minutes by brewing the potion with Redstone dust. The Redstone ore usually generates between Y=-16 and Y=256.

To extend your potion, you just have to place the Potion of Night Vision at the bottom of the brewing stand and the Redstone dust in the top slot. The effects of this newly brewed potion will last for a total of eight minutes.

How to Make Splash Potion of Night Vision

Generally, you drink a potion, and its effects get applied to your character. But this simple action, in dire situations, can take away precious time from your hand. Moreover, if you are playing one of the best Minecraft SMP servers, you need additional potion bottles for your team.

Fortunately, it's quite easy to bypass this restriction. You just need to brew your existing Potion of Night Vision with gunpowder and it will turn into a splash potion. As its name suggests, the splash variant of the potion is throwable and affects all the players in its range. Though, keep in mind that you must throw the splash potion on the target's head. Other, the duration of a splash potion's effect is much lower than a regular effect.

Other Ways to Get Night Vision

If you know how to make a Potion of Night Vision in Minecraft, you probably won't need any other method to unlock this special ability. However, if things don't go your way, here are some alternatives you can try.

Commands

The easiest way to get the night-vision effect is with the help of command. To use them, you first need to turn on cheats in your Minecraft world. The toggle for the same is available in the world settings of Bedrock edition and LAN settings of Java edition. Then, simply execute the following command in your chat box:

/effect give @s night_vision infinite 255 true

Please note that the above-mentioned command only works with Minecraft 1.20 and its snapshots. For the earlier versions of the game, you must replace the term "infinite" with the exact number of seconds you want this effect to last.

Shaders

The major reason why the becomes almost unplayable is because of how light works in the game. Fortunately, you can change that with the help of the best Minecraft Bedrock shaders. These are visual add-ons that can help you to manipulate the game's light system as per your desire. Some of these shaders also allow you to achieve the effect of night vision beyond what's possible in the game.

OptiFine

Now that you know how to make a Potion of Night Vision in Minecraft, you can practically eliminate the dark parts of the game. However, as useful as it might sound, it also gets rids of the intended horror experience. Fortunately, if you use download OptiFine for Minecraft, you can find a reliable middle ground.

This powerful mod unlocks a bunch of game-changing video settings in the game. You can use them to make the game brighter and nights easier to explore without completely removing darkness. Though, you might have to experiment with the toggles before finding what works best for you.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do you get permanent night vision in Minecraft?

The only way to apply a permanent night vision effect in Minecraft is by using the "/effect" command.

What food gives you night vision in Minecraft?

You have to use a golden carrot to brew a potion to get night vision in the game.

How do you make a glow vision potion in Minecraft?

There is no glow vision potion in the game. However, you can use spectral arrows on the Java edition to make your targets glow.

Make and Use Potion of Night Vision in Minecraft

Just like that, you are now ready to eliminate darkness and get night vision in Minecraft. But doing so isn't enough to keep you safe in the dangerous open world. So, make sure to keep a diamond sword in Minecraft handy if the situation goes out of hand. Though, if you want to take things to the next level, creating a TNT in Minecraft might be the way to go. Having said that, it's time for you to jump into the game and unlock a whole new side of Minecraft. Happy exploring!
excerpt: Learn how to make Potion of Night Vision in Minecraft with a step-by-step guide to see clearly in dark areas.

title: How to Make a Potion of Invisibility in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Potion of Invisibility in Minecraft: A Complete Guide
content:
On one hand, the world of survival Minecraft boasts its limitless territory which is perfect for exploration. But on the other hand, you have to keep an eye out for hostile mobs that attack you as soon as they spot you. From sneaky creepers to skeletons with aim-bots, there are a bunch of dangerous opponents out there. Fortunately, if you know how to make a Potion of Invisibility in Minecraft, you can venture through its land undetected. This powerful potion allows you to hide in plain sight and counter opponents of every type. So, grab your Brewing Stand, and let's get started on the path to becoming invisible in Minecraft!

How to Make a Potion of Invisibility in Minecraft

In this guide, we are going into the basics and limitations of the invisibility potion first before delving into its creation. We suggest you don't skip any segment to get the most out of this powerful item.

What is a Potion of Invisibility

As you can guess by its name, the Potion of Invisibility turns you invisible in Minecraft so no mobs or players can see you. This item’s effect not only hides your body but even your name tag making it quite useful on the best Minecraft servers.

So, until you get close to another entity, they can't detect you and thus, have a much lower chance of harming you. If you like to play defensively, this simple utility can completely transform your in-game experience. But, with great powers comes great limitations too.

Limitations of Invisibility

Here are all the limitations of invisibility in Minecraft that prevent it from being overpowered:


  • The invisibility effect doesn't work on Ender Dragon, Wither, and even cats.
  • Even while you are invisible, your armor, the item you are holding and any particles including fire are still visible.
  • If you get too close to a hostile mob it can detect your presence and attack you. This is especially true with Wardens who are naturally blind, to begin with.
  • When you attack a hostile or neutral mob it attacks you as if you are completely visible.

Benefits of a Potion of Invisibility

The Potion of Invisibility has the following benefits in the world of Minecraft:


  • Hidden Base: If you are playing on competitive servers, this potion helps you to explore the world without getting detected. If someone is following you, you can use it to avoid exposing your base.
  • Mobs Combat: The invisibility potion can keep you safe whether you are planning to fight Pillagers or travel during the night. It is a great way to escape tricky situations and even avoid getting into them in the first place.
  • Bedwars: There is no doubt that this potion can give you a major advantage in PvP scenarios. So it is a must-have on the best Minecraft Bedwards servers which are all about PvP and sneaky combat.

Ingredients for a Potion of Invisibility

Here is the complete list of items you need to collect to craft a Potion of Invisibility in Minecraft:


  • 1 Fermented Spider Eye
  • Potion of Night Vision (up to 3 bottles)
  • Brewing Stand
  • Blaze Powder

First, you have to create a Nether portal and travel to the Nether dimension. There, you will find a Nether Fortress where hostile mob Blaze spawns. Killing a blaze gets you a Blaze rod placing that you can turn into Blaze powder by placing it into the crafting table.

Moreover, combing a Blaze rod with three cobblestone blocks will result in a Brewing Stand which is vital for brewing any potion in Minecraft. Meanwhile, you can refer to the linked article to quickly create a night vision potion. It covers everything you need to do in simple but detailed steps.

How to Make a Fermented Spider Eye in Minecraft

If you want to make Potion of Invisibility in Minecraft, you must corrupt a night vision potion to change its properties. So, follow these steps to obtain a fermented spider eye that acts like corrupting agent in the game:

1. First, find and kill a spider or cave spider to obtain a spider's eye. The former is easier to find and is not hostile during day time.

2. Then, look for brown mushrooms which generate in low-light areas of the overworld and everywhere in the Nether.

3. To complete the fermentation recipe, the last thing you need is a lump of sugar. For that, you need to get sugar canes that spawn next to the water and turn them into sugar in the crafting area.

4. Finally, combine the sugar and brown mushrooms with spider eye to turn it into a fermented spider eye.

Crafting a Potion of Invisibility

Now that you have all the required ingredients, follow these steps to brew a Potion of Invisibility in Minecraft:

1. To begin, place the blaze powder in the fuel cell (left side) of the Brewing Stand. It will immediately turn into the fuel that powers the stand.

2. Then, place your Potion of Night Vision bottles in the bottom cells of the stand. You can convert up to three potion bottles at once.

3. Finally, put the fermented spider eye in the ingredient cell (top) of the Brewing Stand. Within seconds it will corrupt the original potion and turn it into a Potion of Invisibility.

How to Make an 8-Minute Invisibility Potion in Minecraft

By default, this potion only lasts for 3 minutes in Minecraft. But, you can extend its duration by brewing it with Redstone dust in the Brewing Stand. The extended invisibility potion lasts for 8 minutes on the Java edition and 9 minutes on the Bedrock edition.

If you want the potion to last even longer then you have to rely on commands or the best Minecraft modpacks. Though, unless you have a whole stealth mission planned, the extended potion is enough to take care of most of your needs.

How to Use a Potion of Invisibility

Much like any other best potions in Minecraft, you simply have to drink the Potion of Invisibility to get its effects. To do so, equip the potion bottle in your hand and then use your secondary action key to use it. The effects will activate as soon as you finish drinking and will last for a few minutes.

Simply press the "E" key or your dedicated inventory key to check active potion effects at any time. Minecraft displays the invisibility effect with a mirror-like icon along with its remaining duration on the right side of your inventory. The same icon also appears on the top-right corner of your screen. When the potion is about to wear off the mirror icon will start flashing.

Create a Splash Potion

As you know at this point, the invisibility potion is a great tool to escape unwinnable fights and even play hide & seek in Minecraft. But it is only effective for the person who drinks. If you want to share the potion's effects with your friends or other mobs, you can make it throwable.

So, follow these steps to create a throwable splash Potion of Invisibility in Minecraft:

1. First, find and kill a creeper to get gunpowder. These hostile mobs spawn throughout the overworld during day and night. But you might want to use a diamond sword to take it out before the creeper explodes and deals serious damage.

2. Then, brew the gunpowder with your potion bottle in the Brewing Stand. Doing so will turn the regular potion into a splash potion. Even the bottle's appearance changes and its neck bends.

3. Next, you have to throw the splash potion on mobs and other players to turn them invisible. But, make sure to throw the bottle on the target's head to get the maximum duration of the potion's effects.

How to Find Invisible Players in Minecraft

Now that you know how to make a Potion of Invisibility in Minecraft, let's also find a few ways to tackle it. Doing so will ensure that others players with the same knowledge don't have an edge over you.

Sculk Sensors

As you might know, the Sculk sensors can detect vibrations from movement and sound near them. So, if you set up Redstone traps with Sculk sensors around your base, they can detect players entering your area even when they are invisible. Though, make sure to mob-proof the area as a mob can accidentally trigger your sensors too.

Hitboxes

On the older versions of Minecraft Java, you can turn on hitboxes by pressing Ctrl + B keys. This shows a rectangle around all entities in the game including invisible players. Then, you can find the hitbox and attack your opponent even when they are invisible.

But as you might expect, this overpowered exploit got patched in 2017. So, if you are playing on Minecraft Bedrock or a newer version of the Java edition, this solution is ineffective.

OptiFine

You can download OptiFine for Minecraft to unlock a bunch of video settings in the game. These include zooming capabilities, X-ray shaders, and the option to highlight particle effects. All of these options can significantly improve your chances of finding invisible players. You just have to keep your eyes peeled and your senses sharp.

Make and Use an Invisibility Potion in Minecraft

Whether you want to be a ninja in Minecraft or surprise your friends, the Potion of Invisibility is there to help you. But this isn't the only way to camouflage in the game. You can also change your skin in Minecraft to something that matches the textures of natural blocks. There is a scope for creativity wherever you spot it. Having said that, how are you planning to use the invisibility potion? Share your ideas on our Discord server!
excerpt: Learn how to make potion of invisibility in Minecraft

title: 15 Best Minecraft Parkour Maps That You Shouldn't Miss
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: 15 Best Minecraft Parkour Maps That You Shouldn't Miss
content:
Do you love Minecraft parkour and want to test your movement and reflexes? From scaling peaks in Minecraft mountain seeds to reaching End Cities, the world of this game offers plenty of challenges. But if you really want to take your parkour game to the next level, you need to try out the best Minecraft parkour maps. With a variety of puzzle systems and endless routes, there's something for everyone. So, let's dive in and find the perfect parkour map to push your skills to the limit!

Best Minecraft Parkour Maps

Our list goes over a variety of great custom Minecraft maps for you to choose from. Make sure to explore each of them thoroughly to find the one that fits your playstyle.

1. Parkour Spiral

Breaking the linear nature of parkour maps quite literally, our first entry presents a spiral of challenges. You start at the bottom and you have to travel to the top of the tower. Each twist offers a new Minecraft biome or structure for you to test your skills in.

Furthermore, this map comes packed with a bunch of multiplayer systems including ranks, scoreboards, and more. You can invite your friends over to make the climb a bit more fun. But, there is very limited space on each level so, you might end up facing more competition and challenges as you go higher.

Download Parkour Spiral

2. Assassin's Creep

In the world of video games, there is nothing more parkour and movement-focused than the Assassin's Creed franchise. And now, you can enjoy the same within Minecraft. Although the game doesn't have any wall climbing mechanics by default, this map uses clever designs to complete your experience.

As for the design, the map uses old-school stone blocks for the majority of the design which fits with the theme of its inspiration. Though, we suggest you use some of the best Minecraft texture packs to take the gameplay to a new level. If you go with medieval-themed options, you might just end up with a replica of the core game.

Download Assassin's Creep

3. Parkour Paradise 3

Staying true to its name, this Minecraft map is really a paradise for parkour lovers. It offers 100 interconnected levels that work like a maze that you have to find your way out of. Each new level offers a fresh challenge and increase that will make you adapt your playstyle at every turn.

But the list of unique features on this map doesn't end there. You also get to enjoy custom music, time-based levels, and even dedicated UI for your progress. So, whether you want to have a good time or take your skill to an entirely new level, this is the obvious choice for you.

Download Parkour Paradise 3

4. Minecraft Word Parkour

This is an oddball in our list of best Minecraft parkour maps because it offers a short but distinct world for you to enjoy. There are a total of 11 levels in it, each taking place inside the shape of a letter from the name "Minecraft".

The design is not only quite unique but also quite challenging to navigate through. You have to find paths, master tricky movements, and even place blocks to unlock certain parts of the map. One wrong move and you will be back at the "M" of Minecraft.

Download Minecraft Word Parkour

5. Black Hole Parkour

Unless you are already a fan of Minecraft Parkour maps, it can be a bit tricky to enter the world of movement mastery out of nowhere. Luckily, the Black Hole Parkour map has a great way to counter it. Instead of throwing you into a random world of blocks, it uses a story narrative to uplift the parkour experience.

You spawn in a post-apocalyptic world that only has crumbles of a city left to explore. Now, you have to jump your way across the shattered land to find out what really happened in this world. But don't get distracted by the plot because one missed jump will send you deep into the void.

Download Black Hole Parkour

6. A Light In the Dark

The best Minecraft Parkour maps are already a bit scary to explore thanks to the constant fear of falling into the abyss. But what if you could take it to an entirely new level? That's what this map does by engulfing all its levels into darkness.

Only the blocks you are supposed to jump upon are visible but the rest of the Minecraft world is in complete darkness. Moreover, in some darker areas, you have to be extra careful while finding the next block to jump onto. With a perfect mix of thrill and challenge, this map is great for veteran players.

Download A Light In the Dark

7. Parkour Pyramid

The Parkour Pyramid is easily one of the largest Minecraft parkour maps out there. It has 100 massive levels, each one of which is based on a unique theme and offers a distinct challenge. Some levels challenge your skills to avoid dangers like lava, while others put your Elytra movements on trial.

Overall, this course promises to unlock a minimum of 3 hours of enjoyable content. However, for those who desire to delve deeper, it also includes 10 hidden easter eggs, a challenging snake parkour mode, and multiplayer gameplay to keep you engaged for even longer.

Download Parkour Pyramid

8. Master Quest

Master Quest is a unique pack of adventures that combines a parkour with the core gameplay of Minecraft. It begins in the overworld but takes you through all three dimensions of the game and the difficulty increases over time.

Beginners can easily clear the overworld but you need a high skillset to make it through the Nether and End dimensions. In case you are wondering, the End level also has an Ender Dragon that can push you off the edge with a single stroke.

Download Master Quest

9. Parkour of Minecraft

If we include the new Cherry Grove, there are over 40 amazing biomes in Minecraft all of which have features and blocks of their own. This parkour map takes you on a voyage across Minecraft by covering most of these biomes.

The surroundings, borders, and even the platforms are made up of the blocks from the biome in which that level takes place. Do you have what it takes to explore all biospheres in the game? Only one way to find out!

Download Parkour of Minecraft

10. The Ender Games

Our next best Minecraft parkour map takes a break from all the jumping challenges to test your aim and timing. You spawn in a world of floating platforms with only one stack of Ender pearls and they have to last before you reach the end.

If you fall the entire game restarts and if you run out of pearls, there is no way to make progress. This high-stake parkour map is the only one that you can clear without jumping. But, your aim should be as clean as a smooth stone to even stand a chance.

Download The Ender Games

11. Levels

"Levels" is one of the very few parkour maps for Minecraft that bring puzzle-solving and a plot to the mix. In it, you are trapped in a series of rooms and you have to rely on your wit and movement skills to get out.

It is perfect for hours of solo gameplay but you can also invite your friends to help you solve complex problems. Though, if you want to simply practice your movements, there are a bunch of other great options for you to try.

Download Levels

12. GameV

There is no doubt that Minecraft is one of the most popular games of all time. Though, it isn't the only contender on the leaderboard and now you can enjoy all the other amazing games right inside Minecraft. This custom map features parkour levels made with unique video games in mind.

There are blocks, structures, and even plot points that are from Portal, Super Mario, Zelda, Pokemon, and more. The only better experience you can get of other games merging into Minecraft is in the form of Cobblemon.

Download GameV

13. The Longest Parkour

As its name reveals, this is the longest parkour map for Minecraft that you can find out there. It consists of 325 stages, over 2000 jumps, and a bunch of puzzles. You start on a floating platform and have to make it to the end of a series of challenges.

Unlike other maps, TLP doesn't dwell on the overall theme and story elements but offers a reliable, simple yet quite challenging parkour experience. So, just can just jump in and enjoy hours of challenging gameplay. Well, as long as you don't get frustrated with the harder part of the map.

Download The Longest Parkour

14. Sprint or Fall

This Minecraft parkour map introduces a thrilling speed element to the gameplay, making it one of the most challenging and compact options available. With only 10 levels, the player must sprint through each one, as standing still for too long will cause the blocks beneath their feet to crumble and force them to start over. The high stakes of this parkour challenge leave you with a clear choice: the sprint to success or fall to failure.

Download Sprint or Fall

15. The Floor Is Lava

If a world of falling blocks is not challenging enough then maybe dangers at your back will get you to move. This map takes you across different biomes of Minecraft from all three dimensions but there is lava constantly following you.
