In terms of parkour, this map is strictly for pro players, likes of whom are on the Dream's USMP. But that doesn't mean you can't try your hands at the same. Who knows, you might be the next great Minecrafter on top of the leaderboard.

Download The Floor Is Lava

Experience Parkour Maps in Minecraft

With that, you now have an endless supply of amazing parkour challenges to keep you busy for hours. However, the true fun lies in sharing these experiences with others. So, make sure to check out our list of best Minecraft Parkour servers to compete on a global scale. Each one of them offers amazing maps, custom features, and a bunch of talented people you can befriend. Though, you might have to install OptiFine in Minecraft to manage your FPS while loading their amazing features. With that said, what are you waiting for? Grab your keyboard and start parkouring!
excerpt: Test your skills with the best Minecraft parkour maps! Explore challenging themes, unique designs, and hours of adventure.

title: How to Make a Shield in Minecraft Bedrock and Java
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Shield in Minecraft Bedrock and Java (2023)
content:
Whether you travel to the Nether dimension or explore the structure of the overworld, the world of Minecraft is filled with countless dangers. If you have a diamond sword in the game, half of the monstrous element will get easily taken care of. But what if you don't have the right equipment or even enough health to fight? That's when a shield comes in handy. Acting as a holdable piece of armor, a shield can keep you safe from incoming attacks and projectiles. So, if you're ready to add an extra layer of protection, here's how to make a shield in Minecraft.

How to Make a Shield in Minecraft (2023)

Note: Our guide also covers the experimental features of Minecraft 1.20 that bring custom shields to the Bedrock edition. All the in-game mechanics around that feature are subject to change in the final release. However, if you just want to learn how to make a shield in Minecraft then you can freely use our guide in any version of the game. 

What is a Shield in Minecraft

Shields are protective gear in Minecraft that allow players to block any incoming attacks and projectiles without taking any damage. For a shield to work, you must be actively holding it and facing toward the incoming attack. But in terms of range, it blocks every attack that's in your field of view.

However, if an attack is worth 3 points or stronger, it ends up damaging the shield's durability. Once the durability bar goes completely down the shield breaks and you have to create a new one. Though, you can repair a damaged shield by adding planks to it on an anvil.

Limitations of Shield

While a shield is useful in a variety of scenarios, it cannot block the following attacks:

  • Arrows fired from a crossbow with Piercing enchantment
  • Splash or lingering potions
  • Breath of Ender dragon, beam attacks from guardians and elder guardians, Evokers' fangs, or the sonic boom attack of Warden.
  • TNT lit by a player or Redstone (Bedrock Only)
  • Fall damage and damage caused by the use of Ender pearls

Not to forget any melee attack from the Warden or a mob holding an axe also temporarily disables the shield for 5 seconds. Despite its few limitations, a shield is a must-have for any battle you face in Minecraft. So, let's explore how to make a shield in Minecraft and what materials you'll need for the job.

Materials Needed to Craft a Shield

Making a shield is quite simple in Minecraft and you only need the following items for its recipe:

  • 1 Iron Ingot
  • 7 Wooden Planks (Any)
  • Crafting Table

You can use any type of wood to create planks for your shield including the new bamboo wood. The wood doesn't affect the durability or design of the item. To get planks, you just need to place the log of your favorite wood type in the crafting table and it'll automatically turn into planks.

How to Get Iron Ingot in Minecraft

Follow these steps to easily obtain an iron ingot in the game:

1. First, create a stone pickaxe in Minecraft by combining two sticks and three blocks of cobblestone. You can refer to our linked article to dive deeper into its creation.

2. Then, find and mine iron ore blocks in the caves or underground areas of the overworld. It is quite common in all biomes and usually generates between the world height of Y=-32 and Y=256.

3. The iron ore blocks drop raw iron which can't be used directly. So, you must craft a furnace with 8 pieces of cobblestone to smelt iron.

4. Finally, place the raw iron into the furnace along with fuel like planks or coal to smelt it. Within a few seconds, you will have one piece of the iron ingot.

Crafting Recipe of a Shield

Once you have both of the required ingredients, follow these steps to make a shield in Minecraft:

1. First, place one plank in both corners of the topmost row of the crafting area.

2. Then, fill the second row with planks and place one plank in the middle of the bottommost row.

3. Finally, place your iron ingot in the middle of the topmost row of the crafting area, right between the planks. With that, your shield is ready!

How to Add Banners to Shield in Minecraft Bedrock and Java

A shield, in itself, is quite reliable when it comes to protection and combat. However, since we don't have any material variants of it, we are stuck with a plain wooden look. But, you can create custom banners in the game and apply them to shields for a custom look.

Much like the armor trims, the banners add a flair to your shields without adding any practical benefit. But, unless you want to rely on all the best Minecraft texture packs, this is the easiest way to make your shields look better.

How to Create a Banner

Follow these steps to create a simple banner in Minecraft:

1. First, find and kill sheep to get 6 wool blocks from them. They spawn in all overworld biomes of Minecraft near grass blocks. Not to forget, you can use shear to get wool from them without killing any sheep.

2. Then, place two planks vertically next to each other on the crafting table to turn them into sticks.

3. Finally, combine the 6 wool blocks of the same color with a stick using the following crafting recipe to make a banner. Your crafted banner will also display the same color as the wool blocks you used. However, if you want to get really fancy, you can customize it later with the help of a loom.

How to Make Custom Shields on Java Edition

Once you've crafted your banner, simply place it and your shield anywhere in the crafting area, and the game will do the rest. Your banner will be combined with the shield, appearing right on top of it. Please note that the banner design will be mirrored on the shield, so if your design has any asymmetrical elements, they will appear mirrored on the shield.

Moreover, once you've applied a banner to a shield, it's a permanent combination. So, if you want to try out a new banner pattern, you'll need to craft a brand new shield to add it. Though, you can use it as an excuse to test some new designs for your protection gear.

Add Banners to Shields to Bedrock Edition

Custom shields have been a part of Java edition for almost eight years, and now Bedrock players can finally join in on the fun thanks to the Minecraft 1.20 update. Follow these simple steps to learn how:

1. First, download and install the Minecraft Preview app on your desired device. At the moment, custom shields are only a part of the experimental versions of the next update.

2. Then, create a new world and make sure to turn on the experimental features of the "Trails & Tales" update.

3. Finally, combine your shield with the banner of your choice on the crafting table. Their recipe doesn't have a particular arrangement so you can place both items in any cell.

FAQ: How to Make a Shield in Minecraft

Can you make a Netherite shield?

At the moment, Minecraft only allows you to make wooden shields. However, you upgrade their functionality with the best shield enchantments.

How do you put a banner on a shield in Minecraft?

To put a banner on top of a shield, you simply have to combine the two on a crafting table.

Can you apply banners on shields in Minecraft Bedrock?

Custom shields are available in Minecraft Bedrock edition but only as an experimental feature of the Trails & Tales" update. You will be able to use it without a hitch when Minecraft 1.20 comes out.

Make and Use a Shield in Minecraft Right Now!

Now that you know how to make a shield in Minecraft, it's time to put it to use and dominate all the survival Minecraft servers out there. But before you start aimlessly charging your enemies, make sure your system has a good FPS to support the fight. Oftentimes, it's a player's system performance that causes them to lose a winnable 1v1 match. Luckily, you just have to download OptiFine for Minecraft to give a visual boost to your game. Much like a shield, OptiFine protects Minecraft from any visual issues and performance bugs. With that out of the way, it's time for you to grab your gear and conquer the world!
excerpt: Discover how to craft a shield in Minecraft for added protection. Also, explore custom shields in the Bedrock edition with the Tales & Trails update.

title: How to Make a Furnace in Minecraft: Step-by-Step Guide
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Furnace in Minecraft: Step-by-Step Guide
content:
If you're a Minecraft player, you already know that survival mode can be both challenging and rewarding. But one essential tool that can make it slightly easier is the furnace. It is a utility block that allows players to smelt ores, cook food, and create various items. Whether you're a new player or someone trying to take over the best Minecraft survival servers, it is an unmissable part of your kit. So, let's get started and learn how to make a furnace in Minecraft like a pro!

How to Make a Furnace in Minecraft

Our guide goes over every mechanic of a furnace in Minecraft including crafting, usage, and even fits fuel. Feel free to explore all of them at your convenience.

How to Find Furnaces in Minecraft

If you don't want to get into the crafting process of a furnace, you can find it naturally generating inside the desert, savanna, snowy tundra, and plains villages. The furnace also appears in igloos and ancient cities.

Not to forget, if you are reading this after Minecraft 1.20's release date, you can also find it in trail ruins‌. So, keep an eye out for these locations if you need a furnace for your gameplay. But if the exploration doesn't work out you can always go back to figure out how to make a furnace in Minecraft.

Items Required to Make a Furnace

You only need the following items to craft a furnace in Minecraft:


  • 8 Stone-tie blocks
  • Cobblestone,
  • Blackstone, or
  • Cobbled Deepslate
  • Wood Pickaxe
  • Crafting Table

The crafting recipe for a furnace is quite lenient you have the flexibility to use a variety of materials to do so. You can use cobblestone, blackstone, or cobbled deepslate blocks to craft a furnace, and you don't need to collect blocks of the same type for the recipe. However, we recommend using cobblestone due to its easy availability.

But to get any of these stone blocks, you first have to obtain a pickaxe. You can use our dedicated guide to easily make a pickaxe in Minecraft in no time. Once it's ready, all that's left for you to do is find the required blocks.

How to Find Cobblestone

Naturally, cobblestone blocks generate in the form of stones throughout the overworld of Minecraft. They can be commonly found in caves, underground areas, and also on the sides of various cliffs. You can use our list of best Minecraft mountain seeds to easily find a whole array of stony spots that you can get cobblestones from.

Furthermore, cobblestone blocks also generate as building blocks in various structures of Minecraft including:


  • Dungeons
  • Jungle pyramids
  • Pillager outposts
  • Ocean ruins
  • Strongholds
  • Plains, taiga, and snowy plains villages
  • Woodland mansions
  • Trail ruins (from Minecraft 1.20)

Irrespective of where you find the block, you can use a wooden pickaxe or stronger to break the cobblestone and pick it up.

How to Make a Minecraft Furnace

Once you have all the stone blocks, follow these steps to easily craft a furnace in Minecraft:

1. First, right-click on your crafting table to open it.

2. Then, place fill the topmost and bottommost rows of the crafting area with cobblestone blocks. If you are using other stone-tier blocks, you can freely place them instead of cobblestones.

3. Finally, place two cobblestone blocks in the side cells of the middle row. You should end up with a hollow square in the crafting area with the center cell empty. With that, your furnace is ready for use.

How to Use a Furnace

Now that you have your furnace ready, it's time to put it to use. Simply place the furnace on a solid surface and start utilizing its capabilities. It has a user-friendly two-slot interface. The top slot is where you'll place the item you want to smelt, and the bottom slot is for the fuel source.

You can use the furnace in Minecraft to transform blocks, turn ore blocks into minerals, cook raw food, and even turn wood into charcoal. Leaving the main purpose aside, the furnace also acts as a crafting ingredient for smokers, blast furnaces, and even a minecart with a furnace.

What Counts as Fuel in Minecraft

In order to use a furnace in Minecraft, you'll need to power it with a compatible fuel source. Several different items can be used as fuel, including:

  • Coal, charcoal, and block of coal
  • Lava bucket
  • Dried kelp
  • Blaze rod
  • Raft, boat, and boat with chest
  • All wooden blocks including utility blocks, tools, and bamboo blocks
  • Saplings, bamboo, and azalea
  • Sticks and bowl
  • Wool, carpet, and banners

Make and Use a Furnace in Minecraft

Now that you know how to make a furnace in Minecraft, it's time to take your survival game to the next level. And the first step in doing so is by adding some of the best Minecraft pickaxe enchantments to make the creation of items like stone bricks a bit easy. While you're at it, make sure to use armor trims in Minecraft to improve and ensure that you look your best. The possibilities are always endless in Minecraft, so keep playing and discovering!
excerpt: Don't know how to make a furnace in Minecraft? This guide will walk you through the process, so you can start crafting and smelting like a pro.

title: How to Make a Boat in Minecraft 1.20 - Easy Guide
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Boat in Minecraft 1.20 - Easy Guide
content:
The world of the best Minecraft survival servers is long, vivid, and limitless. You can travel for hours and discover things that you couldn't even imagine. But unfortunately, many players miss out on half of the experience by simply sticking with the land. If you don't want to be one of them, you must learn how to make a boat in Minecraft. It is the only equipment you need to set sail and explore the infinite possibilities of the game's aquatic realm. Are you ready to embark on a journey of a lifetime and explore uncharted territories? Let's dive in!

How to Make a Boat in Minecraft

Note: Some of the mechanics discussed in our guide are based on the Minecraft Snapshot 23w14a. They are subject to change before the final release of the next major update.

Ingredients Required to Craft a Boat

You need to get the following items to build a boat in Minecraft:

  • 5 Wood Planks
  • 1 Shovel (Bedrock only)
  • Crafting Table

Planks are quite easy to obtain in the game. To create planks, all you need to do is place a log or stem block of a particular wood type into a crafting grid. It's worth noting that boats can be crafted using any type of wood from the overworld, so the choice of wood type won't affect the functionality of the boat.

However, each type of wood does have a unique texture and, in some cases, a distinct design for the boat. If you want the freshest-looking boat, then we suggest you obtain the new pink cherry wood from the Cherry Grove biome of Minecraft.

Make a Shovel in Minecraft

If you want to learn how to make a boat in Minecraft Bedrock then you must get a wooden shovel to complete its recipe. As you might imagine, the shovel acts as an oar to row the boat and propel it in any direction you want. However, on the Java edition, the recipe works with only the planks.

Creating a shovel in Minecraft is a straightforward process. Simply combine two sticks and a plank on the crafting table, and you're good to go. You can use any type of wooden plank available in the game to make a shovel. Though you can only use a wooden shovel to craft a boat, using any other material will disrupt the crafting process.

How to Build a Boat in Minecraft

Now that you have all the required items, follow these steps to create a boat in Minecraft:

1. First, open the crafting table by right-clicking or using the secondary action key on it.

2. Then, fill the bottommost row of the crafting grid with three wooden planks.

3. Next, place one plank on either side of the second row of the crafting grid while leaving the middle cell empty. If you are on the Java edition, your boat should be ready at this point.

4. Meanwhile, if you are on the Minecraft Bedrock, you have to place a shovel in the middle cell of the second row to create your boat.

Crafting Recipe of a Raft

Boats have been a part of Minecraft for a long time but now, thanks to Minecraft 1.20, you can even craft rafts in the game. Rafts work similarly to boats but offer a more streamlined appearance with a borderless design. Here's how to make one:

1. First, combine nine pieces of bamboo on a crafting table to turn them into a block of bamboo.

2. Then, place the block of bamboo into the crafting grid to get two bamboo planks. You need a total of 5 planks so it will cost you a total of 27 pieces of bamboo.

3. Finally, to create a raft in Minecraft, you can use the same recipe as boats, but with bamboo planks instead. However, if you're playing on the Bedrock edition, be sure to include a wooden shovel in the crafting recipe as well.

How to Build a Boat with a Chest

A regular boat is great for going on long voyages across the waters of Minecraft by yourself and even with a friend. But long journeys often require a bunch of resources that your inventory might not be large enough to carry.

Luckily, you can combine a boat or a raft with a chest on the crafting table to create a floating vehicle with portable storage. However, keep in mind that once you add the chest, you won't be able to have another mob or player sit in the boat or raft with you.

How to Use a Boat in Minecraft

Now that you know how to make a boat in Minecraft, it's time to take your creation for a spin. Follow these steps to start your boating journey:

1. First, find a body of water whether it is a lake, river, or ocean in the overworld. You can even make a Nether portal and take your boat to the lava ocean of the Nether but it won't survive for long.

2. Then, equip your boat or raft and right-click on the water while holding it. It will automatically get placed on the surface of the water.

3. Then, just right-click on the boat to get into it and use your usual movement keys to move it around.

4. When you reach the shore, you can simply break the boat to pick it up. Unlike tools, boats can be used indefinitely and don't have durability. Though, things like lava, fire, explosions, and mob attacks can still destroy it.

Get a Mob Inside Your Boat or Raft

Boats and rafts are a great means of transportation but not just for the players and their goods. But they can also be used to move mobs from one spot to another too. All you have to do is place the boat next to the mob of your choice and slowly nudge it on top of the vehicles.

However, if you try this mechanic after the release date of Minecraft 1.20, there is an extra restriction to it. In the latest version, boats and rafts can only carry mobs that are smaller than them. So, while a Panda might barely make the cut, the Sniffer will definitely have a hard time fitting onto your vehicle.

Frequently Asked Questions

Can you get a boat in Minecraft?

Boats don't spawn naturally in the game. You have to learn how to make a boat in Minecraft to get your hands on one and our guide will help you in the same.

How do you make a big ship in Minecraft?

There are a bunch of great ship structure designs that you can rely on to create a ship in Minecraft. However, if you are looking for functionality, the boat is your only option.

Is a boat useful in Minecraft?

A boat is quite useful in Minecraft not only in terms of transportation but even dodging fall damage and trapping mobs. You can figure out a bunch of creative ways to use it in the game. The only limitation is your imagination.

Make and Use a Boat in Minecraft

Learning how to make a boat in Minecraft is a truly vital experience in unlocking the core experience of the game. Though, the open blue sea can get pretty boring in no time. So, make sure to download OptiFine to turn some of the best Minecraft shaders in the game. They will not only make your game run better but even unlock much better-looking water and environment for you. And in case you want to explore the depth of the sea, make sure to get turtle scutes in Minecraft to help you breathe longer. Having said that, it's time to grab your boat, sail the high seas, and embark on an adventure of a lifetime. Happy gaming!
excerpt: Learn how to make a boat in Minecraft and explore the aquatic realm! Our guide covers crafting boats, rafts, and even transporting mobs.

title: How to Make a Healing Potion in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Healing Potion in Minecraft: A Step-by-Step Guide
content:
If you are a fan of playing on the best Minecraft Bedwars servers you already know how fatal one unexpected blow can be. Moreover, it takes forever for your health to recover when it's only dependent upon the food which is unreliable in tricky situations. But fear not! You can stop worrying about that by learning how to make a Healing Potion in Minecraft. This simple yet powerful component provides you instant health as soon as you drink it. Moreover, it can also act as a weapon if used smartly. So, let's dive in and figure out everything you need to know about this multi-purpose Healing Potion in Minecraft.

How to Make a Healing Potion in Minecraft

In this comprehensive guide, we'll cover everything you need to know about the Potion of Healing in Minecraft, including its basics, uses, and how to create it. Don't skip any segment, as each one contains valuable information about this powerful item.

What is a Potion of Healing

The Potion of Healing is a very unique potion in Minecraft. Its main purpose is to immediately restore your health and recover your lost hearts. But you can also use it on the undead mobs like zombies to cause damage to them. These double effects make it one of the most useful potions in Minecraft.

Expanding on its properties, the Healing Potion instantly restores your health by 4 points (2 hearts) at level one. You can double the amount by creating a Potion of Healing II that restores 8 HP. But there are only two levels of this potion so you might have to make more than one bottle of the same.

How to Find Healing Potion in Minecraft

While learning how to make a healing potion in Minecraft is quite easy, you still have to get its ingredients to do the job. Luckily, the game allows you to skip all of that by providing two bottles of this potion in the End ships of the End dimension.

You can use our easy guide to find an End City in Minecraft that spawns right next to the ship. Then all that would be left for you to do is visit the spot and collect your rewards. Though, considering the dangerous mobs around the area, you might want to carry a diamond sword for extra protection.

Items Required Make a Potion of Healing in Minecraft

Here's the complete list of items that you must collect to make a Healing Potion in Minecraft:

  • Glistering Melon Slice,
  • Blaze Powder,
  • Nether Warts,
  • Water Bottle (preferably 3),
  • Brewing Stand

To begin any potion-making process, you first need to make a Nether portal in Minecraft and travel to the Nether dimension. There, you have to find a Nether fortress structure and check beneath each staircase until you find Nether warts farms. This special plant is vital to create the base of your potion.

While you are in the fortress, you also need to find the hostile mob, Blaze. Killing a blaze gives you blaze rods that turn into blaze powder when placed in the crafting grid. Moreover, you also need to combine a blaze rod with three cobblestone blocks to create a Brewing Stand.

Make Glistering Melon Slice in Minecraft

Glistering Melon Slices are the main ingredients when it comes to brewing a Potion of Healing. There is a 7% chance of this item spawning inside the chests of ruined portals. But if that doesn't go as planned, here's how to craft them:

1. First, you have to look for melons that spawn in the jungle biome, savanna villages, and woodland mansions. When you break the melon it will drop melon slices.

2. Next, create a pickaxe in Minecraft and use it to mine gold ore blocks. They usually generate between world height Y=-64 and Y=32.

3. Then, create a furnace and use it to smelt the gold ore into gold ingots. You only need one ingot while crafting a healing potion.

4. Then place your gold ingot in the crafting grid to break it down into 9 gold nuggets.

5. Finally, put your melon slice on the crafting table and then surround it with 8 gold nuggets. With that, your Glistering Melon Slice is ready.

How to Get Water Bottles

To use any potion in Minecraft you need to hold it inside a bottle. Follow these simple steps to make one:

1. First, smelt sand or red sand blocks inside a furnace to get glass blocks.

2. Then, combine three glass blocks using the following crafting recipe to create a glass bottle.

3. Once you have a glass bottle, you need to use it on a water source block to fill it up. Water is the essential base element that you add special ingredients to while creating a potion.

How to Make Potion of Healing (Instant Health) in Minecraft

With all the important ingredients in your bag, it's time to figure out how to make a healing potion in Minecraft. Follow these easy steps to get it ready in no time:

1. To begin, open up your Brewing Stand and place the blaze powder in the left-side cell. It will immediately turn into fuel.

2. Then, place the water bottles at the bottom of the stand and one Nether wart in the top cell. The Brewing Stand will slowly turn water into an Awkward potion. This potion in itself is useful but with the right ingredient, it can turn into some of the best potions in Minecraft.

3. Then, while letting the awkward potion stay in the bottle cells, place the Glistering Melon Slice in the top slot of the Brewing Stand. Within seconds, your healing potion will be ready to use.

Brew Potion of Healing (Instant Health II) in Minecraft

As mentioned earlier, the base Potion of Healing I potion only restores two health in your health bar. But you can upgrade it by brewing the potion with glowstone dust. The Potion of Healing II heals four hearts in an instant.

In case you are wondering, glowstone dust is quite easy to obtain. You just need to break glowstone blocks that spawn on the roof of the Nether. Unless you are using a silk-touch enchanted tool, the block will drop as dust instead of dropping itself.

Make Splash Potion of Healing

Now that you know how to make a Healing Potion in Minecraft, it's time to make the most out of it. For that, you must turn it into a throwable splash potion. Here's how:

1. First, find and kill a creeper to get gunpowder. They spawn randomly throughout the overworld.

2. Then, brew the gunpowder with your potion bottle in the Brewing Stand. When the brewing process finishes, the neck of your bottle will bend and your splash potion will be ready.

You can use the splash potion on yourself and your friends to get instant healing. But if you throw it on undead mobs like husks, phantoms, and more, the potion will damage those mobs.

Make and Use a Potion of Healing

You are now ready to start your next adventure with a quick healer and a secret weapon on your side. But this potion isn't the only dual-effect item in the game. If you know how to make a Bed in Minecraft, you can use it to sleep in the overworld and explode enemies in other dimensions. This simple mechanic makes beds as destructive as TNTs that an unsuspecting enemy can never survive. With that, it's time to get out there and start exploring the endless possibilities of Minecraft!
excerpt: Need to heal up in Minecraft? Follow this step-by-step guide to learn how to make a Healing Potion in Minecraft and keep your health bar full!

title: How to Find End City in Minecraft (6 Simple Methods)
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Find End City in Minecraft (4 Simple Methods)
content:
Minecraft's End Cities are a treasure trove of resources and adventure, unlike any other structure in the game. Hidden away until after the final battle, they contain all the amazing loot you need to thrive in the world of Minecraft. And, if you're lucky enough to find the elusive Elytra, you can soar through the skies like a bird. Whether you're looking to stockpile your resources or dominate the best Minecraft Parkour servers, End Cities are the perfect way to achieve your goals. Join us as we discover how to find these mysterious structures and reap the rewards they hold.

How to Find End City in Minecraft

What are End Cities in Minecraft

End Cities are giant fortress-like structures that only spawn in the outer area of the End dimension of Minecraft. They are made up of blocks from the End stone and Purpur family which don't appear anywhere else. These cities consist of various smaller structures including towers, skyscrapers, and small cabins. You can find rare and amazing loot in each of them.

What Is an End Ship in Minecraft

The End Ships is a special structure that spawns right next to the End Citites in Minecraft. They resemble pirate ships and contain the rarest item in the game, Elytra. However, not every End City spawns with a ship right next to it. Fortunately, our guide has an easy solution to counter this unreliable world-generation mechanic. Keep reading to find out!

How to Find End City in Minecraft

From exploration to cheats, there are a bunch of ways to find an End City in Minecraft. You can go through each of them to find the one that suits your playstyle.

Method 1: Exploration

Follow these steps to naturally discover an End City in Minecraft:

1. First, find a stronghold in the overworld and activate its End Portal to travel to the End dimension. You will need 12 Eyes of Ender to activate the portal.

2. When you visit the End for the first time, you have to kill the Ender Dragon to make it safe for exploration. You can create beds in Minecraft and use them during the fight as they explode in the End Dimension.

3. After killing the dragon, you have to look for End gateway portals. These are tiny Bedrock portal-like structures that spawn on the outskirts of the main island.

4. Next, go near the gateway portal and throw an Ender pearl into it. Because the portal is too small, you can't enter it directly. Alternatively, you can enter swimming mode by placing a trapdoor above the portal and enter it while crawling.

5. The pearl will immediately transfer to one of the many End islands in the dimension. There, you have to pick a random direction and explore the floating islands to find the End cities. If you fail to find one in a reasonable time, we also have some additional tricks in the bag.

Method 2: Commands to Find End City in Minecraft

The easiest way to find the End city in Minecraft is with the help of the "locate" command. This is a great method for the cracked Minecraft servers which, at times, allow you to use cheats in the game. You have to travel to the End dimension and then use the following command in the chat box:

/locate structure end_city (on 1.19 & higher)
/locate end_city (on older editions)

Then, the game will locate the closest End City structure and show its coordinates in your chat box. The coordinates are in an "X Y Z" format where X denotes the location on the east-west axis; Y stands for elevation or height and Z denotes the spot on the north-south axis. You can either use the "TP" command to teleport to those coordinates or carefully find your way to them.

Method 3: Seeds with Coordinates

Every Minecraft world including its structures, mobs, biomes, and even the spawn point is determined by a random seed code. If you have the seed and the right information about it, you can easily recreate a world and access all its amazing features.

Building on that idea, here are some of the best Minecraft seeds to find an End City (with a ship):

  • 5082616889404611582 | X: 984, Z: -536
  • -89669090852 | X: 680, Z: -1176
  • -1020507311573777733 | X: 1048, Z: -1160

Use any of these seeds while creating a new Minecraft world and go to the mentioned coordinates to easily find the End City structure in no time. Moreover, if you want more amazing worlds to explore our list of best Minecraft grove seeds is there to help.

Method 4: Minecraft End City Finder

To sum up our list, we have a powerful third-party tool that is the most reliable way to find an End City in Minecraft. Follow these steps to easily find all the End Cities in your Minecraft world:

1. First, you must determine the seed of your world. In the Bedrock edition, you can find the world seed code within the world settings, and in the Java edition, you have to use the following command in the chatbox:

/seed

2.  Next, open the Chunkbase’s End City finder tool in your browser. Then enter the seed code in the "seed" column and your game's version in the "version" dropdown list.

3. The tool will automatically examine the Minecraft world of your seed and locate all the key structures. You can scroll down to find all the End Cities marked by black dots on the world map. Hover over any black dot to reveal its coordinates at the bottom left corner of the map.

Find End City By Exploring

Prepare Before You Go

Finding and looting End cities in Minecraft comes with a lot of risks. But, with a little bit of preparation, you can ensure your safety quite easily. Here's everything you should carry:

  • Potion of Slow Falling: End Cities are loaded with Shulkers that can make you float. But having a potion to reduce fall damage can make life a little safer.
  • Weapon: Another way of dealing with Shulkers is by killing them before they can even hurt you. For that, you need to carry a diamond sword or a crossbow with good aim.
  • Ender Chest: The loot from an End City is truly valuable. So, it would be wise to use an Ender Chest to store it unless you know how to keep inventory upon dying. This mechanic is going to be extremely useful if you plan on avoiding the Ender dragon altogether.

Find End City Without Defeating Ender Dragon (Method 5)

Most players avoid searching for an End City until later in the game. This is because going to the End dimension usually also means fighting the end dragon. But, luckily there is an easy way to skip it. Follow these steps to learn how:

1. First, find an Ender portal within a stronghold and remove the lava pool beneath it.

2. Then, place a piston one block below a portal block with a button or lever above the piston.

3. Next, activate the End portal and stand right next to the piston's face. Make sure to crouch and avoid accidentally entering the portal. It is vital that the piston is next to your legs and not your face.

4. Finally, activate the piston and it will push you into the Ender portal. But, instead of teleporting on the main island, the game will teleport you to a random End island. From there you can find an End City in Minecraft without defeating the dragon.

5. When it's time to get back, you can either defeat the dragon or store your items in an Ender chest and jump into the void.

How Does This Trick Work

When a piston moves a block, entity, or player, it tries just to add one point to your coordinates. For example, if you are standing at the 0,0 coordinates. Then, the piston will push you onto the 1,0 coordinates.

But, if you go to another dimension while the piston is pushing you, Minecraft teleports you to that location in the new dimension. As you might expect, this glitch can also teleport you into the void or beneath the surface. So, it's important to carry Ender pearls and a shovel to quickly escape tricky situations.

Bridge From Main Island

Alternatively, you can also carry 20 stacks of blocks and just build a bridge away from the main island. Other islands usually start appearing once you have crossed the 1000 block mark. The only problem with this method is that it can take a really long time.

End City Finder Mods (Method 6)

If you don't mind some extra help, you can also find an End City using some Minecraft mods. Here are a couple of reliable ones:

  • B.F. End Cities: This mod makes End cities much larger and more common than usual. You can spot them from really long distances which makes the search look like a child's play.
  • Explorer's Compass: A powerful mod that makes it easy to find any structure in the game including End Cities. It also gives you an option to quickly teleport to the found structures.

The only problem with these mods is that you cannot use them on most of the best Minecraft servers. Fortunately, all the other methods on our list have you covered for that. 

Loot of End Cities

Now that you know how to find End City in Minecraft, let’s go over all the amazing loot you can get within it. From exclusive blocks to rare items, here is a list of everything you can find in an End City and End Ship:

  • Elytra*
  • Dragon Head*
  • End Rods*
  • End Stone blocks*
  • Purpur blocks*
  • Spire Armor Trim Smithing Template*
  • Gold, Iron, Emeralds, and Diamonds
  • Saddle
  • Beetroot seeds
  • Enchanted Iron Pickaxe, Shovel, Sword, and Armor
  • Enchanted Diamond Sword, Shovel, Pickaxe, and Armor
  • Iron, Golden, and Diamond Horse Armor
  • Magenta banners and stained glass
  • Brewing Stand
  • Instant Health Potion

*These items and blocks are exclusive to the End structures and you can't find them anywhere in the game.

FAQs: Minecraft End City

How rare is an End city?

The generation of End Cities in Minecraft is rare. If you are on the wrong seed, it might take you hours of exploration to find one.

What is the fastest way to find the End City?

The easiest and fastest way to find an End City in Minecraft is with the help of locate command and the finder tool. You can our guide to learn how to find End City in Minecraft with a variety of simple methods.

Do all End Cities have Elytra?

The Elytra only spawns inside the ships that spawn next to only some End Citites in Minecraft. You can use the seeds in our guide to easily get reach an End ship without skipping a beat.

Explore End City in Minecraft

Finding an End City in Minecraft can be a daunting task, but the rewards are well worth the effort. With its abundance of resources, you can easily navigate through popular servers like QSMP and even locate hidden gems like Cherry Grove with ease. And for those seeking an extra challenge, why not install the new Cobblemon mod for Minecraft? This exciting mod introduces blocky versions of Pokemon to the game, which can be spotted from the air with the help of an Elytra. If you're up for an adventure, grab your gear and get ready to explore!
excerpt: Discover how to find End City in Minecraft and get its valuable loot, including the elusive Elytra. Follow our guide featuring four distinct methods for success.

title: How to Make a Potion of Weakness in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Potion of Weakness in Minecraft
content:
Whether you are trying to top the best Minecraft PvP servers or just trying to make it to the End cities, fights in Minecraft often rely on a single move. One extra heart of damage can send you right back to your bed. Luckily, with a simple potion, you can reduce the damage dealt by your opponent, giving you a fighting chance in even the most challenging of battles. This is possible thanks to the weakness effect that reduces attack damage in the game. So, whether you're a seasoned gamer or a newcomer, it's time to learn how to make Potion of Weakness in Minecraft and use it as your strength! 

How to Make a Potion of Weakness in Minecraft

In this guide, we'll cover everything you need to know about the Potion of Weakness in Minecraft - from the basics to the brewing process. Feel free to jump to the section that interests you the most.

What is a Potion of Weakness in Minecraft

The Potion of Weakness is a common Minecraft potion that allows you to lower the attack damage of your enemies. But this effect only applies to their melee attack and doesn't affect any projectiles. Moreover, this potion doesn't make the target's attack useless but only decreases the inflicted damage.

In the Java edition, it decreases the damage inflicted by 4 points, which equates to 2 hearts. But, in the Bedrock edition, the damage reduction relies on the "base damage*0.3" formula, where the base damage is the typical damage dealt by a weapon. At first glance, the reduction doesn't seem significant enough. But during combat on Minecraft Bedwars servers or with Pillagers, it can make a big difference.

Items Required Make a Weakness Potion in Minecraft

The Potion of Weakness is the only useful potion that you can brew without Nether warts, a key ingredient for all other potion recipes. So, you only the following items to craft it:

  • Fermented Spider Eye
  • Blaze Powder
  • Water Bottle (up to 3)
  • Brewing Stand

First things first, you need to create a Nether portal in Minecraft and travel to the Nether for starting your potion-brewing recipe. There, you have to look for a Nether fortress where Blazes, a hostile mob spawns.

Killing the Blaze will get your Blaze rods that turn into Blaze powders inside the crafting grid. Moreover, you can combine the Blaze rod with three blocks of cobblestone to craft a Brewing stand. It is the vital tool you must get to brew every potion in Minecraft. 

Craft Water Bottle in Minecraft

Before learning how to make a Potion of Weakness in Minecraft, you have to get a container to hold and use it. So, follow these steps to craft a bottle in Minecraft:

1. First, go to the nearest beach in your world and dig up sand or red sand blocks.

2. Then, make a furnace and use it to smelt the sand blocks into glass blocks. You can use coal, wood, and a bunch of other blocks in the game as fuels.

3. Next, place the glass blocks in a v-shape arrangement on the crafting table to turn them into glass bottles.

4. Once you have the bottle, you can head to the nearest water source and collect water by right-clicking with the bottle in your hand. With the base ready, let’s get the main ingredient to learning how to make a potion of weakness in Minecraft.

Make Fermented Spider Eye

All the negative potions in Minecraft are brewed by corrupting a specific item. The weakness potion is no exception. To brew a Potion of Weakness, you'll need to corrupt water with a fermented spider eye. Here's how to get one:

1. To begin, go around your Minecraft world and look for a spider or cave spider to kill. Spiders are generally less dangerous and easier to find, as they can spawn in almost any overworld biome. Killing one will get you a spider eye.

2. Then, continue exploring your world until you find brown mushrooms. They generate in poorly lit areas of the overworld and everywhere in the Nether.

3. Then, explore the water bodies in your world and look for sugarcanes that generate on edge of the water. You can break it with any tool to pick it up.

4. Next, place your collected pieces of sugarcane into the crafting grid to turn them into sugar.

5. In the end, combine your brown mushroom and sugar with the spider eye on a crafting table. With that, your fermented spider eye is ready.

How to Make a Potion of Weakness in Minecraft

Once you have all the ingredients on your side, follow these steps to create your Potion of Weakness in Minecraft:

1. To start, open your brewing stand and place the Blaze powder in the left-side slot. It will immediately turn into fuel that powers the stand.

2. Then, put up to three water bottles in the bottom slots of the brewing stand. The cost of brewing one potion of weakness is the same as brewing three copies of it.

3. Finally, place your fermented spider eye in the top slot of the brewing stand. The brewing process takes a few seconds, but once it's done, you'll have your very own Potion of Weakness ready to use.

How to Use the Potion of Weakness in Minecraft

You can use the Potion of Weakness in Minecraft in the following ways:

  • Cure a Zombie Village: You need to weaken a zombie villager before turning it back into a villager and a Potion of Weakness is a vital part of that process.
  • Weaken Attacks: This potion can help you reduce the amount of damage your enemies can inflict on you. But to do that, you should be able to use the potion o your enemy. Keeping reading to find out how.

Make Splash Potion of Weakness

In Minecraft, the default way to use a potion is by drinking it. Unfortunately, in the case of a weakness potion, drinking it will only cause you harm. So, you have to create a splash Potion of Weakness to turn it into a throwable weapon that weakens the attacks of its targets. Here's how:

1. First, look for a Creeper in your world and kill it to get gunpowder. But, be sure to kill it quickly with a weapon like a diamond sword before it unleashes an explosion comparable to the TNT.

2. Then, simply place the gunpowder and the Potion of Weakness into the brewing stand and wait for the brewing process to finish. Once it's done, the neck of the potion bottle will bend, indicating that it's now throwable.

3. You can then use right-click or your secondary action key to throw the potion and weaken your targets. All neutral and hostile mobs (except boss mobs) get affected by the "weakness" effect.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do you make a weakness potion 2?

While you can extend the duration of this potion by adding Redstone to it, there is no way to level it up. However, you can use our guide to learn how to make a Potion of Weakness in Minecraft and get multiple copies of it.

Does the Potion of Weakness do damage?

The weakness potion doesn't do any damage to the players or mobs.

How much does weakness do in Minecraft?

The weakness effect reduces the damage caused by the melee attack of the affected player or mob.

Make and Use Potion of Weakness in Minecraft

Now that you know how to make a Potion of Weakness in Minecraft, you can take any battle with confidence. And while you are on a brewing streak, you can also make a Potion of Night Vision for visual clarity. Later, you can turn this potion into a Potion of Invisibility in Minecraft. As the name suggests, the latter allows you to turn invisible so even mobs like Cobblemon cannot see you. With that out of the gate, it’s time for you to start testing potions and conquer all the fights in Minecraft. Good luck and happy brewing!
excerpt: Learn how to make and use a Potion of Weakness in Minecraft with a simple step-by-step guide covering its ingredients, tutorial and more.

title: How to Get Elytra in Minecraft (4 Easy Methods)
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Get Elytra in Minecraft (4 Easy Methods)
content:
Have you ever felt like you're just not seeing enough of your Minecraft world? Like it has a vast open world but the traveling takes too long to be worth it. Well, fear not, because, with Elytra, you can soar high above the clouds and travel like a breeze. This elusive item is perfect for exploring hill-top biomes like Cherry Grove. And it is also a must-have for new players mastering the best Minecraft parkour servers. So, spread your wings and join us as we learn how to get Elytra in Minecraft and fly!

How to Get Elytra in Minecraft

Our comprehensive guide covers all aspects of the Elytra, including its spawning, repair, and usage. Each section is dedicated to exploring these topics in-depth, so be sure to check out each one to gain a complete understanding.

What is Elytra in Minecraft

Elytra is an extremely rare wearable item in Minecraft that allows players to glide through the air without falling. In terms of appearance, the Elytra looks similar to the wings of an insect and it even opens up while you're flying. So, not only is the experience exhilarating, but it also looks majestic.

However, Elytra isn't complete without its certain restrictions. When equipped, Elytra replaces your chest plate armor, leaving you vulnerable to certain attacks. Moreover, contrary to popular belief, Elytra doesn't let you fly at will. Instead, players need to give it a slight push before gliding through the air. Luckily, if you know how to use it tactically, none of these restrictions can cut your wings.

How to Get Elytra in Minecraft

As per the plot, Elytra is an end-game item in Minecraft as it only spawns in the structures of the End dimension. But reaching that spot isn't the only way to obtain it. From long exploration to special tricks, there are a bunch of unique ways to get an Elytra in Minecraft. Let's go over each of them to help you find the option that suits your style.

Exploration (Method 1)

If you want to learn how to get Elytra in Minecraft with the intended method then exploration is your only option. It is perfect for Minecraft survival servers and for players who want to speed-run the game. Here's how to do it right:

1. First, find and activate an End portal in the stronghold structure to travel to the End dimension. You will need 12 Eyes of Ender to activate the portal.

2. Then, you have to kill the Ender dragon to unlock the entirety of the End dimensions. Using beds, which explode in the End, might help you speed up the process.

3. When the dragon dies an End Gateway portal near the border of the main island. Unfortunately, this portal is too small for you to walk into it. But, you can throw an End pearl into it to use it quite easily.

4. The portal will teleport you to one of the many floating End islands in that dimension. Now you have to find an End city in Minecraft and hope that it has a ship spawning alongside it.

5. Once you find an End ship, you need to enter it and find the Elytra. It always spawns on top of an item frame in the ship's main room. You can walk up to the frame and click on the Elytra to pick it up.

Command to Get Elytra (Method 2)

If you don't want to do any work while trying to get an Elytra, the commands in Minecraft are there to help. Do keep in mind that using commands is technically cheating so most of the best Minecraft servers might not allow it.

Having said that, you can use the following command in your chatbox to get all the Eytras you need:

/give @s minecraft:elytra 1

You can replace the "1" in the command to get as many copies of this special item as you want. Not to forget, for this command to work, your Minecraft world must have cheats enabled. The option for the same is available within the LAN settings of Java edition and the world settings of Minecraft Bedrock.

How to Get Elytra in Minecraft Creative Mode (Method 3)

Whether you want to learn how to get Elytra in Minecraft or any other item, the creative inventory is your best friend. It allows you to grab and obtain any item you want in no time. Follow these steps to learn how to make the most out of it:

1. First, create a new Minecraft world but make sure that your game mode is set to "creative". The option appears within the world settings for both editions.

2. If you want to get Elytra in your existing world, you can use the following command to change your game mode:

/gamemode creative

Though, do make sure that you have cheats enabled in your world before executing this command.

3. Once you are in the creative mode, press your inventory key (E) and open the creative inventory.

4. Then, use the search bar and look for "Elytra". After finding it, simply pick it up and place it in your inventory.

5. Then, you can either continue using the Elytra in the creative mode or use the following command to go into survival mode and continue your game:

/gamemode survival

Unlock Upgraded Elytra (Method 4)

The regular Elytra is amazing for gliding and cutting travel time in your Minecraft world. However, with the best Minecraft modpacks, you can take your Elytra to the next level.

There are a bunch of great Minecraft Elytra mods out there, but for a seamless experience, we recommend the following:

  • Netherite Elytra
  • Elytra Slot
  • Customizable Elytra

However, before you can use any of these mods, you'll need to download Forge for Minecraft. Forge is a mod engine that simplifies the management and use of mods within the game.

How to Use Elytra in Minecraft to Fly

Now that you know how to get Elytra in Minecraft, it's time to use it and conquer the skies of Minecraft. So, follow these simple steps and learn how to use this one-of-a-kind item:

1. Before you can use an Elytra, you need to equip it. For that, first, open up your inventory and then place it in the chest plate armor slot.

2. Then, find and climb a high place in your world. If you are struggling with that, our list of the best Minecraft mountain seeds might help.

3. Next, you have to jump and hold your jump key to glide in the air. But, keep in mind that unlike flying, gliding doesn't go on indefinitely. So, you will also need fireworks rockets to maintain your flight and propel you.

Ways to Activate Elytra

As you just noticed, Elytra doesn't work like a flying machine in Minecraft. Instead, you have to give it a little push to touch the skies. So, here are all the ways in which you can activate your Elytra:

  • Jumping: When you jump from a high place, the Elytra allows you to glide and float in the air. But, this method doesn't allow you to go higher than where you jumped from.
  • Firework Rocket: The rockets allow you to propel yourself from the ground and mid-flight, in any direction you want. If you use them while looking upwards, the fireworks will take you higher toward the sky.
  • Trident: You can use the Riptide enchantment on the trident to fling yourself in the sky. The effect will be similar to how MCU's Thor uses his hammer to hurl himself.

How to Repair an Elytra

Much like all the other tools and armor in Minecraft, even the Elytra has limited durability. Once it runs out, the Elytra breaks and disappears forever. Luckily, you can repair it with the help of these easy steps:

1. First, spend at least 3 nights without sleeping in Minecraft so that on the fourth night, a Phantom can spawn.

2. Then, use a weapon like the diamond sword to kill the phantoms and obtain the phantom membrane.

3. Finally, combine the membrane with your damaged Elytra on an anvil to repair it. Each membrane restores 25% of Elytra's total durability.

4. Alternatively, you can also combine two damaged Elytras in a crafting table to restore their durability.

Elytra Enchantments in Minecraft

There are only four enchantments for Elytras in Minecraft:

  • Unbreaking: Increases the durability of the Elytra by reducing its chance of taking damage during usage.
  • Mending: Reapairs the Elytra whenever the player collects experience orbs
  • Curse of Vanishing: Makes the item disappear as soon as the player dies. This enchantment is useful to safeguard your Elytra in Minecraft PvP servers.
  • Curse of Binding: Prevents you from removing the item from your armor slot.

FAQs: Elytra in Minecraft

How to craft an Elytra in Minecraft?

Unfortunately, there is no smelting crafting recipe for Elytra in Minecraft. So, naturally, there is no way to craft it manually.

Why is Elytra called Elytra?

The Elytra in Minecraft gets its name from the real-world beetles whose two front wings are known as "Eytra". Furthermore, the true origin of this name is from a Greek word, "elytron" which means cover.

Do Elytras ever break?

When the durability of an Elytra runs out, it breaks and disappears. But you can use our guide to easily learn how to repair an Elytra to make it last longer.

Can you fly without Elytra?

You first have to set your game mode to creative and then double-press the "jump" key to turn on flight mode. After that, you can freely fly around your world even without any special item.

Find and Use Elytra in Minecraft

Now that you are equipped with the knowledge of how to get Elytra in Minecraft, it's time to explore new horizons. But, since this item reduces your protection by replacing your armor, you must make a shield in Minecraft to keep yourself safe. Meanwhile, if you are a new Minecraft player, the controls of Elytra can feel a bit daunting. But worry not, the best Minecraft parkour maps will help you practice and master this tool in no time. Having said that, what new areas are you planning to discover? Share your ideas on our Discord server.
excerpt: Learn how to get Elytra in Minecraft with a step-by-step tutorial covering four quick and easy methods with pictures.

title: How to Make Flower Pot in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: Minecraft: How to Make Flower Pot
content:
Are you playing the best Minecraft survival servers and looking to spruce up your base? Or do you want to showcase all the amazing plants you collect throughout the world? Flower pots are a great way to do just that! Whether you want to take home a bit of Cherry Grove or start your own garden, flower pots are the perfect addition to your world. So, let's dive in and discover how to make a flower pot in Minecraft and use it to decorate your base in style.

How to Make a Flower Pot in Minecraft

Our guide goes over everything you need to know about flower pots in Minecraft. You can explore all the sections that interest you at your convenience to make the most out of them.

How to Find a Flower Pot in Minecraft

Much like most other decorative items in the game, you don't have to craft a flower pot to get one. Instead, you can easily find one naturally in the following spots as well:

  • Witch Huts
  • Igloos
  • Woodland Mansions
  • Village Houses: plains, savanna, desert, and taiga

In each of these locations, the flower pots spawn with a unique plant. You can break the flower pot to make the pot as well as the plan it's containing to drop as an item. Doing so doesn't require any special tool like a pickaxe or even enchantments.

Items Required to Make a Flower Pot

You only need the following items to make a flower pot in Minecraft:

  • 3 Clay balls
  • Furnace
  • Crafting Table

Creating a crafting table is quite easy, all you need to do is combine four planks in your inventory's crafting grid to make one. You can use any type of wood in this recipe including the new bamboo wood of Minecraft. Meanwhile, our linked guide will help you get your furnace up and running.

How to Get Clay Balls

The easiest way to obtain clay balls is by breaking clay blocks that generate underwater in the following spots:

  • Swamps and Mangrove Swamps
  • Beaches
  • Oceans
  • Rivers

You have to go to the waterbed and break the clay block in each of these spots. Irrespective of what you use to break it, every clay block drops four clay balls. Alternatively, you can also check the mason's chests and house chests (deserts only) in villages to obtain clay balls.

Moreover, if you are on Minecraft 1.20, the new trail ruins structure also has clay balls inside the suspicious sand or gravel blocks. A brush will help you uncover them to obtain the desired item.

Crafting Recipe of a Flower Pot in Minecraft

After collecting all the required items, follow these steps to create a flower pot in Minecraft:

1. To begin, open a furnace and put clay balls in its top slot with fuel in the bottom one. You can use planks as fuel to make things easier. Within a few seconds, the clay balls will smelt and turn into bricks. But please don't confuse them with stone bricks which are a reliable building block in the game.

2. Then, place the bricks in a v-shaped arrangement on the crafting table to craft your flower pots in Minecraft.

How to Use a Flower Pot

Once your flower pot is ready, it's time to use it to decorate your base and potentially the entire world. Follow these steps to learn how:

1. First, equip the flower pot and then use right-click or secondary action key to place it down. In the Java edition, you can place it on top of any block. But on the Bedrock edition, the pots can be only placed on top of full blocks, fences, stone walls, and hoppers.

2. Then, you can just have to equip a plant in your hand and use it on the flower pot to place it inside it. The pot supports all plants that are one block tall including flowers, ferns, dead bushes, cacti, bamboo, saplings, azaleas, mangrove propagule, and roots.

Make and Use Flower Pots in Minecraft

But why stop there? Take it a step further with armor trims and unlock new designs for your armor to show off in style. But why stop there? We suggest you also get armor trims in Minecraft to unlock new designs for your armor. On the other hand, you can get a Sniffer in Minecraft to discover some additional plants for your new garden. Though, at the moment, they are too large to fit into the flower pots. But, who knows, the developers might change that before the release date of Minecraft 1.20 comes around. With that said, what are you growing in your flower pot? Share your ideas on the Discord server!
excerpt: Learn how to make a flower pot in Minecraft with a simple and easy pictorial tutorial with crafting recipe, steps, uses and more.

title: How to Make Paper in Minecraft (Easy Method)
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make Paper in Minecraft in 2023 (Easy Method)
content:
• Crafting Paper requires a furnace in Minecraft. 
  • To make Paper in Minecraft, you will need 3 pieces of Sugar Cane. 
  • Instead of searching for Sugar Cane plants, you can also find Paper in chests in different locations.  

Are you looking for a versatile item that can open up a world of crafting possibilities in Minecraft? Look no further than Paper! It may sound like a basic item, but it can actually earn you a lot of emeralds. As you progress in the game, the Paper will be a must-have material for books, enchantments, maps, banners, and more. 

Our in-depth guide covers various aspects of Paper in Minecraft, including obtaining, crafting, and using it. So, keep reading to find out everything you need to know about Paper in Minecraft.

How to Make Paper in Minecraft

While Paper is not as flashy as an armor trim, it’s an essential ingredient for crafting a wide variety of useful items. You can even use it to customize a shield in Minecraft. But exactly how to make Paper in Minecraft? Let's find out!

Making Paper with a Crafting Recipe

Follow these steps to easily craft Paper in Minecraft:

1. First, go to the nearest river, ocean, or lake in Minecraft. There, you need to look for Sugar Cane plants.

🌊 You can find Sugar Cane beside water. The plant closely resembles bamboo. 

2. You need to break the Sugar Cane to make it drop as an item. The crafting recipe of Paper only requires three pieces of Sugar Cane.

3. Finally, place the three pieces of Sugar Cane next to each other in any row of the crafting table. With that, your piece of Paper is ready.

How to Make Paper without Ingredients

If you don't want to go into the process of crafting Paper, you can also obtain it naturally within the chests of the following locations in both Java and Bedrock editions:

Java Edition - Paper Availability

1. Shipwreck:

  • Supply Chest contains 1–12 Paper with a 46.4% chance.
  • Map Chest contains 1–10 Paper with an 89.4% chance.

2. Stronghold:

  • Library Chest contains 2–7 Paper with an 89.2% chance.


3. Village:

  • Cartographer's Chest contains 1–5 Paper with a 61.2% chance.


Bedrock Edition - Paper Availability

1. Shipwreck:

  • Supply Chest contains 1–12 Paper with a 46.4% chance.
  • Map Chest contains 1–10 Paper with an 89.4% chance.

2. Stronghold:

  • Library Chest contains 2–7 Paper with an 89.2% chance.


3. Village:

  • Cartographer's Chest contains 1–5 Paper with a 61.2% chance.


Out of these, the shipwrecks have the chance of spawning the highest quantity (up to 12) of Paper inside a single chest. However, if chest hunting doesn't go as planned, you can also get Paper from cartographer villagers. But they only give it occasionally after you defeat a raid in their village.

Though, if you want to try your luck, our list of the best village seeds will give you the best shot. Even if things don't turn out right, you can always go back to figuring out how to make Paper in Minecraft.

How to Use Paper in Minecraft

Paper, in itself, doesn't have a practical purpose in the game. But you can use it as a crafting ingredient to make these items in Minecraft:

  • Custom Banners: Combine Paper with bricks, Creeper head, oxeye daisy, vines, Wither skeleton skull, or enchanted golden apple.
  • Books: Put three pieces of Paper with leather.
  • Cartography Table: Combine Paper with 4 pieces of planks made out of any wood type (including the new bamboo wood).
  • Empty Locator Map: Surround a compass with eight pieces of Paper or combine nine pieces of Paper.
  • Empty Map: Combine nine pieces of Paper (Bedrock only).
  • Expanded Map: Add Paper to a map on the cartography table to expand the map.
  • Firework Rocket: Combine gunpowder with Paper (useful in powering an Elytra).
  • Firework Rocket with Effects: Combine firework star and gunpowder with Paper.

FAQ: Making Paper in Minecraft

Which villager sells Paper?

Unfortunately, no villager in Minecraft sells Paper. But you can trade Paper with librarians and cartographer villagers to get emeralds.

Can you get Paper in the Nether?

There is no way to obtain Paper once you have entered the Nether portal. You have to bring it to the Nether dimension yourself.

What is the use of Paper in Minecraft?

Paper is useful to craft a bunch of amazing items including books, maps, and even rockets. You can also trade Paper with villagers to obtain emeralds.

Can you make Paper in Minecraft without Sugar Cane?

No, there is no other plant you can use to make Paper in Minecraft. However, you locate it in the chest in locations of Shipwreck, Stronghold, and Village. Occasionally, cartographer villagers sell Paper, too. 

Can you write on Paper in Minecraft?

Absolutely! You can craft a Book and Quill from a Book, a Feather, and an Ink Sac. Then, you can make notes in your personal notebook. 

Make and Use Paper in Minecraft

Now that you have access to one of the best crafting ingredients in the game, you can make the most of your time in the best survival servers in Minecraft. 

But one thing that Paper can't help you with is making your world safer. For that, you need to get a diamond sword in Minecraft or a Potion of Invisibility to open up your toolkit exponentially. 

With that said, how are you going to use Paper in Minecraft? Share your ideas on our Discord!
excerpt: Discover how to make paper in Minecraft with a simple step-by-step guide. Also learn its crafting recipe, ingredients, and uses.

title: How to Make a Sign in Minecraft 1.20
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Sign in Minecraft 1.20 - Easy Guide (2023)
content:
Whether you consider all the amazing armor trim combinations players are coming up with or structures on CityBuild servers, Minecraft is all about self-expression. But one of the most versatile tools for self-expression in Minecraft is the sign. They allow you to display text, label spots, and even communicate with other players. So, let's put an end to the wait and explore how to make a sign in Minecraft and unleash your creativity!

How to Make a Sign in Minecraft

Our guide covers everything you need to know about signs in Minecraft. You can explore all of its segments to understand their crafting, usage, and other mechanics.

What is a Sign in Minecraft

Signs are decorative items in Minecraft that you can attach to blocks and use to display text on top of them. They are perfect for marking locations, items, and bases. But, many players also use them to exchange messages, feelings, and stories on the best Minecraft servers.

Types of Signs

On the basic wood they are made of, there are 11 types of signs in Minecraft:

  • Acacia
  • Bamboo
  • Birch
  • Cherry
  • Crimson
  • Dark Oak
  • Jungle
  • Mangrove
  • Oak
  • Spruce
  • Warped

All the types of signs in Minecraft serve the same practical purpose but they visually look different. You can choose the one that fits best with your build's theme. Though, if you want to stay up-to-date, we suggest you go with the cherry wood that spawns in the Cherry Grove biome.

Items Required to Make a Sign

Signs are usually considered an early-game item and you only need the following items to craft one:

  • 6 Planks (any)
  • 1 Stick

Considering the overall ingredients, you need two wood stem/log blocks to get a sign in Minecraft. To get planks, all you need to do is place the log or stem block of that wood on the crafting table. Though, in the case of bamboo wood, you will have to use a block of bamboo to get planks.

Once you have the planks, you need to place two of them vertically next to each other in the crafting grid to turn them into sticks. Moreover, while you need to ensure that all six planks in the recipe are of the same type of wood, there is no such restriction on the sticks.

Steps to Make a Sign in Minecraft

Once you have all the required items, follow these simple steps to craft a sign in Minecraft:

1. First, right-click or use the secondary action key on a crafting table to open it.

2. Then, completely fill up the top two rows of the crafting grid with 6 wooden planks.

3. Finally, place one stick in the middle cell of the bottommost row of the crafting grid. With that, your sign is ready.

How to Use Signs in Minecraft

Now that you know how to make a sign in Minecraft, it's time to put it to use. Here's how:

1. First, walk up to the block where you want to place your sign in Minecraft. It can only be on top of another block or on the side of it.

2. Then, right-click while looking at the face of the block to place the sign on it.

3. Once you attach the sign to the block, the game will ask for the text you want to display on it. Press the "Done" button after entering your desired text.

4. The text will show up on the front side of the sign and it will be visible to all the players in your world.

Where Can I Place a Sign

When it comes to using signs, there are three main placement options that you get within Minecraft:

  • On Top of Blocks: When you place a sign on top of a block, it shows up as a placard with a stick supporting it from beneath.
  • Side of Blocks: If you place a sign on the side of another block, it attacks itself to the block's face and appears like a board.
  • Next to Another Sign: When a sign is placed next to another sign it acts like it's on the side of a solid block. But visually, the sign looks like a floating item.

How to Edit a Sign

In the earlier versions of Minecraft, once a sign was placed, there was no way to edit the text on it. But, with the new Minecraft 1.20 update, you can easily modify the text on a sign by right-clicking on it.

However, this also means that anyone on the best Minecraft 1.20 servers can easily edit your signs too. To prevent such a situation, you need to affix the text by waxing with the help of a honeycomb. Although you can still change the color of the text on the sign using different dyes.

FAQ: How to Make a Sign in Minecraft

What is a hanging sign in Minecraft?

Hanging signs are a brand new variant of signs that you can place on the side of and below other blocks. You can use our dedicated guide to learn how to make a hanging sign and make the most out of it.

What is a waxed sign?

A waxed sign is a new type of sign introduced in the Minecraft 1.20 update. Once you wax a sign, the text on it becomes completely uneditable.

How do I put a sign on a chest in Minecraft?

Putting a sign on top of the chest is possible but not advisable. As soon as you open the chest, the sign will break and drop itself.

Make and Use a Sign in Minecraft

With that, you know how to make a sign in Minecraft, it's time to unleash a bunch of creative changes to your base. But, self-expression isn't the only way to use this amazing item. You can rely on them to create a bunch of amazing Minecraft parkour maps to upgrade yourself. Or you can rely on them to give a more realistic look to your furniture items including a bunk bed in Minecraft. Your imagination is the only limitation. So, how are you going to use signs in your world? Share your concepts on our Discord server!
excerpt: Explore our step-by-step guide to learn how to make a sign in Minecraft 1.20. Also learn how the new update is going to change signs forever.

title: How to Make Hanging Signs in Minecraft 1.20
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make Hanging Signs in Minecraft 1.20 (Easy Guide)
content:
As the release date of Minecraft 1.20 is coming close, this update is establishing how vital self-express is to its team. From armor trims to the new skins in Minecraft, there is a lot to look forward to. But nothing stands out as much as hanging signs. They are not only a great way to add some visual interest to your builds, but they also allow you to express yourself in creative ways. So buckle up and get ready to learn how to make hanging signs in Minecraft and make the most out of them.

How to Make Hanging Signs in Minecraft (2023)

From crafting to usage, our guide covers everything you need to know about hanging signs in Minecraft. Practically, they aren't much different from regular signs but they can truly take your builds to the next level. 

What Are Hanging Sings in Minecraft

Hanging signs are wooden boards in Minecraft that you can place on the side of and beneath other blocks. They dangle with iron chains and display any text that you put on them. Hanging signs are a unique type of block in Minecraft that consists of wooden boards dangling from iron chains.

Types of Hanging Signs

Much like most wooden items in the game, the texture and color of hanging signs represent the wood that it is made up of. Keeping that in mind, we have types of hanging signs in Minecraft:

  • Acacia
  • Bamboo
  • Birch
  • Cherry
  • Crimson
  • Dark Oak
  • Jungle
  • Mangrove
  • Oak
  • Spruce
  • Warped

Out of all these types, cherry wood is the newest type of wood that only spawns in the Cherry Grove biome. So, even if you have all the other wood already in the bag, you will go the extra mile to get all types of hanging signs in Minecraft. But you can use our list of the best Cherry Grove seeds to save some time.

Where Do Hanging Signs Spawn

You can find bamboo hanging signs inside the chests of Trail Chambers in Minecraft 1.21. They spawn in a group of up to 4 signs inside a single chest. Other hanging signs don't spawn naturally inside your world and you have to craft them from scratch. 

Are Hanging Signs Better Than Regular Signs

While hanging signs look like a significant upgrade from regular Minecraft signs, they do have some drawbacks too. Let's go over various aspects that separate the two:

  • Limit: You can write up to 15 characters in one row on a regular sign but the hanging signs only support 10 characters per row. Though, the font sign is much bigger on the hanging signs.
  • Size: Hanging signs are much larger and thicker than regular signs. You can even walk on top of them.
  • Types: In terms of textures, both signs have 11 variants. But, you get more visually distinct ways to place the hanging signs.
  • Cost: You often have to work harder while collecting the ingredients for a hanging sign which makes them a bit expensive.

If you have access to limited blocks and want something that can hold long text then signs are a better option. But for anyone who's looking for a visual upgrade, the hanging signs are a clear choice.

Items Required to Make a Hanging Sign

With the basics out of the way, here's everything you need to collect to make a hanging sign in Minecraft:

  • Two iron chains
  • Six stripped log/stem blocks (any)

To obtain stripped logs from any type of wood, you can take a log and use an axe to strip it. Typically, players do this by directly stripping the logs of trees that spawn throughout Minecraft.

However, bamboo wood in Minecraft doesn't have any logs or trees. Instead, you have to strip a "block of bamboo" with an axe to turn it into a stripped bamboo block. Though, keep in mind that irrespective of what wood type you use, hanging signs are functionally the same.

How to Make a Chain in Minecraft

Follow these steps to create iron chains in Minecraft:

1. First, look for iron ore blocks in your world that most commonly spawn around the world height of Y=16. Then, use a stone pickaxe or stronger to mine the ore block to obtain raw iron.

2. Next, make a furnace in Minecraft and use it to smelt the raw iron into iron ingots. You can use additional wooden planks as fuel for the same.

3. Then, place your iron ingot on the crafting table to turn it into nine iron nuggets.

4. Finally, place your iron ingot in the middle of the crafting grid with one iron nugget above and below it. Doing so will give an iron chain.

Crafting Recipe for Hanging Signs in Minecraft

With the stripped wood and chains on your side, follow these steps to make hanging signs in Minecraft:

1. First, fill up the bottom two rows of your crafting grid with stripped log blocks. All of these blocks should be made of the same type of wood.

2. Then, place one iron chain in each corner of the topmost row of the crafting grid. With that, your hanging signs are ready. Each recipe produces six hanging signs at once, and since hanging signs can be reused, this may be more than enough for most players.

How to Use Hanging Signs in Minecraft

Follow these steps to learn how to use hanging signs in Minecraft:

1. First, equip and hold the hanging sign in your hand. Next, stand next to the spot where you want to place your hanging sign. Please keep in mind that you can only place it on top of or on the side of another block.

2. Then, while looking at the block you want to connect it with, right-click or use the secondary action key to place it. Minecraft will then request you to write your desired text for the sign. Click on the "Done" button after writing.

3. Once you are done, the hanging sign will look similar to the image below. Keep in mind that breaking the block it's connected to will also break the hanging sign.

Where Can I Put a Hanging Sign

In terms of placement, you get three options for using a hanging sign and each one of them significantly changes how it looks.

  • Below a Block: When placed beneath another block, the hanging sign suspends itself with two chains.
