Due to its defense mechanism, this mob inflates in size and inflicts damage whenever someone gets too close to it. Though, with careful attacks and a shield, you can kill the pufferfish to pick it up as an item.

Method 2: Guardians and Elder Guardians

If you're having a hard time looking for a pufferfish, one way to obtain it is by killing Guardians and Elder Guardians. These mobs can only be found in the ocean monument structures and can be challenging to take down.

However, with a diamond sword and smart combat tactic, it shouldn't be an issue. But, do keep in mind that the drop rate for pufferfish from these mobs is extremely low. So, our next method might be the best option for your quest if you don't plan on wasting a lot of time.

Method 3: Fishing

If fighting a mob feels like a big risk, you can also use fishing to catch this mob without putting yourself at risk. In the Java edition, you have around a 13% chance to catch a pufferfish in any water source.

But, in the Bedrock edition, this mob only appears in the waters of the jungle biome and its variants. So, Bedrock players can rely on our best Minecraft jungle seeds to improve their chances of catching this fish.

How to Make a Potion of Water Breathing in Minecraft (3:00)

Once you have all the brewing ingredients, follow these simple steps to make a water-breathing potion in Minecraft:

1. First, open your brewing stand and place the Blaze powder in the left-side fuel cell.

2. Then, put Nether warts on the top of the stand and three water bottles at its bottom. Within a few seconds, you will end up with an awkward potion that acts as a base for the powerful potion.

3. Finally, place the pufferfish in the top cell and brew it into the awkward potion. With that, your Potion of Water Breathing (3:00) is ready.

Extended Potion of Water Breathing + (8:00)

The regular Potion of Water Breathing may only last for three minutes in Minecraft. This duration might not be enough time to explore the depths of the ocean or deal with oceanic mobs. Moreover, if you are planning to get oceanic armor trims, this duration is nothing less than a joke on you.

Luckily, you can easily extend the duration of this by simply brewing Redstone into it. The extended potion will last for a total of eight minutes which is more than enough for most adventures. But don't forget to check out our comprehensive guide to Minecraft's ore distribution to find all the Redstone you need.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is there a water-breathing enchantment in Minecraft?

The respiration helmet enchantment works similarly to the Potion of Water Breathing in Minecraft. But it only extends your breath by a mere 15 seconds.

Is there a way to breathe underwater forever in Minecraft?

Using a Conduit is the most reliable option to breathe underwater. It is a powerful device that gives you a bunch of water-based abilities in Minecraft including unlimited oxygen.

Can you make a water-breathing II potion in Minecraft?

There is no practical purpose or method to upgrade the Potion of Water Breathing in Minecraft. However, you can increase its duration by brewing it with Redstone dust.

Make & Use Potion of Water Breathing in Minecraft

With that, the oceans of Minecraft are ready for you to explore. But this isn’t the only potion that makes the water more welcoming. You can also create a Potion of Night Vision in Minecraft which eliminates darkness and allows you to see clearly even under the water. Though, once you can see through the water, you can also get an Elytra and fly over the ocean. This will let you explore the entire sea without even entering it. But if you want to take the traditional route, a boat in Minecraft will be your best friend. So what are you waiting for? Dive into the Minecraft oceans and see what treasures await!
excerpt: Explore the oceans of Minecraft by learning how to make a Potion of Water Breathing and avoid drowning.

title: How to Make a Potion of Strength in Minecraft - Easy Guide
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Potion of Strength in Minecraft - Step By Step Guide
content:
In Minecraft, one of the most important aspects of combat is the strength of your attack. It can make or break the battles you take on the best Minecraft survival servers. And one of the easiest ways to improve the power of your attacks is with a Potion of Strength. This powerful potion helps you take down enemies with fewer hits, and at a much faster rate than ever before. So, join us as we discover how to make a Potion of Strength in Minecraft and explore its uses, variants, and more.

How to Make a Potion of Strength in Minecraft

In this guide, we are covering everything you need to know about the Potion of Strength in Minecraft, including its basics, uses, and variants. Please explore each section thoroughly to learn everything you need to know.

What Does Strength Potion Do in Minecraft

The strength potion allows you to increase the power of your melee attacks. This allows you to kill enemies with fewer attacks and much more quickly. With strength active, your attack will deal 3 points (1.5 hearts) worth of additional damage in the Java edition. Moreover, the damage becomes 6 points on the second and maximum level of this potion.

But the true advantage of this potion lies with Bedrock users, as the strength boost scales with the base damage of your weapon. So, if you are using a diamond sword instead of just your hands, the increase in power will be significantly higher. You can refer to the formula on Minecraft Wiki (here) to calculate the true values of each weapon.

Items Required Make a Strength Potion in Minecraft

You have to collect the following items to brew a Potion of Strength in Minecraft:


  • Brewing Stand (crafted with 1 Blaze Rod and 3 Cobblestones)
  • Blaze Powder (crafted with 1 Blaze Rod)
  • Nether wart
  • Water Bottle (up to 3)

As you might notice, Blaze rods are an essential element of your potion-brewing journey. You can obtain them by killing Blazes that spawn inside the Nether dimension of Minecraft.

How to Get Netherwart

Nether warts are a unique type of fungus in Minecraft that only spawns inside the Nether dimension. So, you have to create a Nether portal in Minecraft to obtain it. However, keep in mind that the Nether warts crops only generate inside the Bastion remnant and Nether fortress structures.

Since you anyways have to visit the fortress to find Blazes, they are the ideal choice for obtaining the Nether warts as well. Keep an eye out for fungus farms located beneath the staircases in the fortress, and you'll be able to gather Nether warts in no time.

Crafting Recipe of a Bottle

Bottles are a reliable storage option and an irreplaceable part of the brewing process in Minecraft. So, follow these steps to easily create a glass bottle:

1. First, create a furnace in Minecraft and use it to smelt sand or red sand blocks. Doing so will turn them into glass blocks.

2. Then, place three glass blocks in a V-shaped pattern in the crafting grid to turn them into bottles.

3. Finally, use these glass bottles on any water source blocks to fill them up. The water bottles are the base for all potions in Minecraft.

How to Make a Potion of Strength in Minecraft (3:00)

The Potion of Strength is one of the simplest potions in Minecraft. Follow these simple steps to brew it in your world:

1. First, place the Blaze powder in the fuel cell (left side) of the brewing stand. It will immediately power the stand.

2. Then, put up to three water bottles at the bottom of the stand. It takes the same amount of ingredients to brew three potions as it does to brew one.

3. Then, place Nether warts in the top cell of the brewing stand and wait for a potion to brew. Within seconds, an awkward potion will be ready.

4. Finally, place Blaze powder in the main cell and brew it into the awkward potions.

5. Then, wait for the brewing process to complete and you will have a Potion of Strength in Minecraft.


Make Potion of Strength + (8:00)

Now that you know how to make a Potion of Strength in Minecraft, it’s time to put it to use. But the regular strength potion only lasts for three minutes in the game. This time is enough for you to deal with a smaller group of enemies but can be limiting during boss fights and battles on Bedwars servers.

So, follow these steps to easily extend the duration of your potion:

1. First, look for Redstone ores that spawn within the caves of the overworld. Our Minecraft 1.20 ore distribution guide will help you make the search easier.

2. Then, use a pickaxe to mine the ore and collect Redstone dust.

3. Finally, use the brew the Redstone dust with your Potions of Strength to extend its duration to eight minutes.


How to Make a Potion of Strength II

The Potion of Strength is perfect for getting a temporary boost to defeat weaker enemies. But beware, as your enemies get tougher, your potion may need to pack an even bigger punch to ensure your victory. Here's how:

1. First, go to the Nether dimension and look for glowstone blocks. They usually generate on the roof of the Nether.

2. Then, break the glowstone blocks to collect glowstone dust. You can use any tool to mine these blocks.

3. Finally, brew the glowstone dust into the Potion of Strength with a Brewing Stand to level it up.


Frequently Asked Questions

How do you make a strength 2 potion?

You can add glowstone dust to the Potion of Strength to level it up and improve its effects.

What is the best strength potion in Minecraft?

Potion of Strength II (8:00) is the best variant of this potion. You can use our guide to learn how to make a Potion of Strength in Minecraft and even how to extend and level it up.

Can you make a Potion of Strength III?

Unfortunately, there are only two levels of the Potion of Strength in survival mode. But, you can use Minecraft modpacks and commands to improve it exponentially without putting in much effort.


Make and Use Strength Potion in Minecraft

With the knowledge of how to make a Potion of Strength in Minecraft, you are ready to dominate the Minecraft PvP servers. But, keep in mind that, improving your strength isn't the only way to defeat an enemy. You can also use a Potion of Weakness or make a shield in Minecraft to counter your opponent's attacks. But if direct combat isn't your best skill, a well-timed TNT can also help you turn the tables on any battle. Having said that, it's time to get practicing and carve your way to becoming a true Minecraft combat master.
excerpt: It's time to level up your hits and take down the enemies. Learn how to make a Potion of Strength in Minecraft and win every combat you enter

title: How to Breed Villagers in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Breed Villagers in Minecraft - Easy Guide
content:
Villagers are the perfect go-to mobs in Minecraft. They are the unsung heroes that make your journey more exciting and simpler. You can use their huts as homes, chests as loot, and job sites as utility blocks. Furthermore, each new type of villager you encounter will unlock an entire set of trades to level you up. But, to fully benefit from these advantages, it's crucial to have a sufficient number of villagers in your village. So, let's dive into the mechanics and learn how to breed villagers in Minecraft!

How to Breed Villagers in Minecraft

Our guide goes over the basics of villagers and their necessities before diving into the breeding process. If you are already familiar with all the villager mechanics, please feel free to skip ahead.

What are Villagers in Minecraft

Villagers are passive mobs that spawn inside the villages of Minecraft. They are one of the smartest mobs in the game that can work, breed, and interact with each other and mobs. You can even trade with these villagers to buy a variety of items in exchange for emeralds.

In terms of variants, you can find witches, wandering traders, and even zombie villagers within your world. But, if breeding villagers do not go as planned, you can even cure zombie villagers to repopulate your villages in tough times.

Types of Villagers

In terms of the biome they spawn in, there are 7 types of villagers in Minecraft:

  • Plains
  • Desert
  • Savanna
  • Taiga
  • Snow
  • Jungle
  • Swamp

Interestingly, the jungle and swamp villagers don't have a dedicated village for them. So, they have a hard time spawning inside the world of Minecraft. But, you can rely on our list of best Minecraft villager seeds to find them naturally.

Baby Villagers

Much like most passive mobs in the game, villagers also have their baby variants which only spawn when two villagers breed with each other. Baby villagers behave similarly to their adult counterparts but roam around freely, jump on beds, and give poppy flowers to Iron Golems.

Once twenty minutes have passed since their spawning, the babies grow up into adult villagers. In their adult state, the same villagers can take up jobs and start trading with players.

Why Should You Breed Villagers

Breeding villagers in Minecraft allows you to exponentially increase their population. But, doing so also comes with the following additional benefits:

  • If you have a bunch of farmers in the group, they can help you make an automated food/crop farm.
  • The villagers take up the appearance of the biome they spawn in. So, you can use breeding to unlock the rare jungle and swamp villagers in Minecraft.
  • Having a variety of villagers with distinct jobs will let you trade between them to get the best deals.

Items Required to Breed Villagers

Contrary to animal mobs, villagers have some special requirements when it comes to breeding. You must satisfy their needs in order to make a baby villager spawn.

Find Two Villagers

The first step to breed any mob in Minecraft is getting two copies of that mob and villagers are no exception. So, you have to find a village in Minecraft and get two villagers close to one another.

Breeding Area with Bed

Once you have found both of the villagers, you need to create a dedicated area to keep them. Fortunately, such an area is quite easy to construct. All you have to do is create a 5x5 block area and place three new beds in it. Moreover, it's best to leave an empty space of two blocks on top of the bed to prevent any obstruction in the spawn of baby villagers.

If creating a dedicated space feels like too much work, you can even use the existing huts for the purpose. Though, creating such a space outside the village can end up improving the spawn chances of babies. As for the actual structure, we highly suggest using stone bricks for better protection.

Food Items to Improve Willingness

Similar to the concept of consent in the real world, the Minecraft villagers have to showcase willingness in order to breed. For villagers to breed, they must have access to adequate food and shelter. So, once your villagers are in a safe space, you have to keep giving them food until they breed.

Each villager can pick up a maximum of 3 bread, 12 carrots, 12 potatoes, and 12 beetroots. You just need to give them enough quantity of one of these food items to make them breed. Fortunately, each Minecraft village usually has enough resources to produce the required amount of food.

How to Breed Villagers in Minecraft

Now that you know all the basic requirements of breeding this amazing mob, follow these step-by-step to easily breed villagers in Minecraft:

1. First, you have to get two villagers to a safe breeding area. The easiest way to do so is by pushing them into a boat in Minecraft and rowing them to the spot.

2. Next, you have to close all the openings to the villager breeding area. This will protect villagers from hostile monsters and also prevent them from escaping. Also, don’t forget to add some torches to prevent hostile mobs from spawning inside the structure. 

3. Finally, place three beds around the villagers and give them their desired food. Once their willingness is satisfied, you just have to wait for a few minutes and a baby villager will spawn.

Why Do My Villagers Fail to Breed?

If following all the steps in our guide on how to breed villagers in Minecraft doesn't work for you, it might be because of the following reasons:

  • Zero Unclaimed Beds: Once a villager sleeps on a bed in Minecraft it attaches itself to the furniture. But, for the breeding process to work, you must have three unclaimed beds including one for the baby.
  • Lack of Food: As you might have noticed, food is an essential item when it comes to breeding. So, you must satisfy the food needs of both villagers to make them breed.
  • Population Cap: If you are on the Bedrock edition, Minecraft only allows you a certain number of villagers to exist in a given area. So, you might have to take your breeding duo to a new area for a baby villager to spawn.
  • Night: Villagers in Minecraft only breed during the daytime as they prefer to sleep during the nighttime. While you can give them food at night, there is no way to force them to show willingness.

Breeding Villagers in Minecraft: FAQ

How Long Does it Take to Grow a Villager?

It usually takes 20 real minutes or a complete Minecraft day cycle for a baby villager to turn into an adult.

How Many Times Can 2 Villagers Breed?

The villagers of Minecraft have a short 5-minute cooldown period before they can be bred again. However, there is no limit over how many times you can breed two villagers with one another.

Where is the Best Location to Make a Villager Breeder?

To prevent overcrowding, it's best to breed villagers away from their home village. If you are lucky, you can even find a zombie village and repopulate it with the breeding process.

Can 2 villagers with jobs breed Minecraft?

Jobs don't affect the breeding process in Minecraft. You can breed any two villagers with one another irrespective of their base biome or job.

Easiest Way to Breed Villagers in Minecraft

Now that you are ready to create your own army of villagers in Minecraft, it's also your responsibility to keep them safe. To keep hostile mobs at bay, you'll need to craft a shield and a diamond sword. Though, you can also use our ore distribution guide to acquire iron blocks and create a group of Iron Golems to guard the village. While your golems are keeping watch, you can take up the task of decorating the village with flower pots. With that said, it's time to grab your pickaxe and search for your next village. Happy crafting!
excerpt: Learn how to breed villagers in Minecraft to spawn rare baby villagers, get better trades, and more.

title: How to Find a Village in Minecraft (4 Easy Methods)
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Find a Village in Minecraft - 4 Methods
content:
Whether you are just a beginner or a veteran in Minecraft, villages are the bread and butter if you want to succeed in the game. Most players can't even imagine playing on the best Minecraft survival servers without them. From food like bread to utility blocks like Smithing Table, you can get everything you need in one place. But, locating these amazing and uncommon structures can be a bit challenging. So, we are here to help you learn how to find a village in Minecraft with four different methods. Each method caters to an entirely unique set of gameplay. With that, let's get started!

Ways to Find a Village in Minecraft 

Each method in our list deals with a different scenario to find a village in Minecraft. We suggest you explore all of them to find the method that fits your needs.

How to Find a Village in Minecraft (Method 1)

Whether you are looking for a regular village or an entire End City, exploration is always the most interesting way to find anything in Minecraft. However, due to complex spawn mechanics, finding a village isn't as simple as running around. But, you can use the following tips to make the search simpler:

  • The villages of Minecraft only spawn in the desert, plains, meadow, savanna, snowy plains, and taiga biomes. So, you should look for these biomes which searching for a village.
  • Since all the villages are lit up with torches, you can see them more clearly at night. Moreover, the best Minecraft shaders can make them easier to spot even from a long distance.
  • If you are looking for villages at night, you are bound to come across hostile mobs too. So, make sure to keep a diamond sword or a better weapon handy to protect yourself and the villagers.

Best Village Seeds (Method 2)

If roaming around your world and looking for a village doesn't feel reliable, a Minecraft seed might be a good alternative. Its world can spawn you right inside truly unique villages, the likes of you which are hard to find on your own. So, if you choose the right seed, you won't have to worry about figuring out how to find a village in Minecraft altogether.

Luckily, we already have a bunch of reliable best Minecraft village seeds and you can use them while creating a new world. Our dedicated guide list also contains key coordinates to some rare spots including a village in Cherry Grove.

Command to Locate Villages (Method 3)

The easiest and most effective way to find a seed inside any world is with the help of in-game commands. To use one, just turn on cheats in your world and use the following command to find a village:

/locate structure minecraft:village_plains

Executing the command will show you the coordinates of the village that's closest to you. Moreover, you can change the term "plains" in the command to any other variant of the village. Depending upon your spawn point, some types of villages will be further away than others.

Though, keep in mind that this method is considered cheating so you won't be able to use it on the best survival SMP servers.

Use Seed Map to Find a Village in Minecraft (Method 4)

Another reliable way to find a village in Minecraft is by analyzing the seed of the world you are in. This method allows you to uncover every single village in Minecraft at once. Here's how:

1. First, use the following command in the chatbox to find out the seed of your world on Java edition:

/seed 

Meanwhile, Bedrock players can find the seed code in the pause menu within the world settings.

2. Then, go to Chunkbase's seed map tool and enter your seed code in the "seed" section. Also, make sure to select the correct version and edition of your Minecraft.

3. Finally, scroll down and find all the villages in your world, marked by a villager's face icon. You can click on the icon to get the coordinates to that village.

Bonus: How to Spawn a Village

Even when you know how to find a village in Minecraft, it can still be a challenging and time-consuming task. It often requires traveling far away from your spawn point, which can be a hassle when you need to collect key resources. Unless you have an Elytra, the journey can be time-consuming and tedious.

Thankfully, there's a way to avoid all that hassle. As long as you don't mind a little trickery, Minecraft allows you to spawn a custom village anywhere you want. All you have to do is use the following command in an ideal location:

/place structure village_plains

By using this command, you can spawn an entire village complete with buildings, villagers, animals, and even an Iron Golem. Moreover, you can also replace the type of village to generate a variety of villages at your desired location. But, keep in mind that this command only works in the Java edition and with only version 1.19 and later.

Best Tips to Find a Village in Minecraft

Just like that, you are now ready to find any village in Minecraft with ease. But, finding the village is the easy part, taking care of it is what takes real effort. So, make sure to learn how to cure a zombie village to ensure that you can save them even if things go south. Moreover, if you end up finding a desert village, you can also get a camel in Minecraft as a bonus. This unique mob is exclusive to the desert villages and you can even ride it with the help of a saddle. But is it enough to make these your favorite village? Or do you like another type of village? Drop your choice on our Discord server!
excerpt: Let's figure out how to find a village in Minecraft with the four easiest methods. Also, figure out how to spawn your desired village anywhere you want.

title: How to Get Honeycomb in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Get Honeycomb in Minecraft (2023)
content:
Honeycomb in Minecraft is more than just a product of our fuzzy bee friends. This versatile resource is essential for crafting blocks, candles and modifying block states. 

While getting it can be tricky, especially on the best Minecraft survival servers where players compete for resources, our guide will show you all the tricks to grab that sweet honeycomb fast

Follow our complete guide to master everything about getting honeycombs in Minecraft - from finding them to using them. Each section has tips and tricks you won't want to miss!"

What You'll Learn 🐝

  • How to locate and harvest honey in Minecraft
  • Essential tools needed for your Minecraft bee farm
  • Obtain honeycomb safely without getting stung
  • Crafting recipes using honeycomb blocks
  • Best Minecraft biomes for finding bee nests

What is Honeycomb in Minecraft

Honeycombs are a special item in Minecraft that is a great crafting ingredient and a tool for transforming some blocks. It doesn't drop as a mob loot. You have to harvest honeycombs from beehives or bee nests making it almost as rare as all the ancient plants of the Sniffer.

Where Do Honeycomb Spawn

You can only find honeycombs within the Trial Chambers in Minecraft 1.21. They spawn inside the intersection and corridor chests of the structure. At times, you can also find them inside the barrels within the same. 

Items Required to Collect Honeycomb

 To collect honeycomb in Minecraft, you'll need:

  • Shears - Craft these with 2 iron ingots placed diagonally on your crafting table
  • Campfire - Combine 3 sticks, 3 logs, and 1 coal (any wood type works, even bamboo wood)
  • A bee nest with active bees nearby
  • At least one bee to make the honey

Bees will gradually increase the nest's honey level over time - you'll know it's at maximum when honey drips from the sides. But don't try grabbing that honeycomb without a campfire! Place it under the nest, and the smoke will keep the bees inside calm while you harvest.

💡Pro tip: Use our ore distribution guide to learn how to find iron ore to craft your shears. Smelt the raw iron inside a furnace to turn it into an iron ingot.

Finding Bee Nests in Minecraft

Bee nests spawn naturally in these biomes:

  • Cherry Grove (100% spawn rate)
  • Meadow (100% spawn rate)
  • Birch Forest
  • Flower Forest
  • Mangrove Swamp
  • Plains
  • Sunflower Plains

💡Pro tip: Head to Cherry Grove or Meadow biomes for guaranteed nest spawns! Check out our list of the best Minecraft Cherry Grove seeds to find these biomes quickly.

🐝Fun fact: While bees can use both nests and beehives, you'll only find nests in the wild. Ironically, you'll need honeycomb to craft a beehive in the first place!

How to Get Honeycomb in Minecraft

Once you have collected all the important items, follow these steps to learn how to get honeycomb in Minecraft:

1. Look for a filled bee nest leaking honey from its holes. If the nest isn't filled, wait for the bees to finish filling it up.

2. Place the campfire on the ground right beneath the bee nest. The smoke from the campfire will start going through the bee nest, preventing bees from turning hostile.

3. Right-click or press your secondary action key to use shears on the smoked bee nest and collect your honeycomb. You don't have to worry about the bees' attack as long as you don't break their home.

Uses of a Honeycomb in Minecraft

The honeycomb is the ultimate transformation and crafting ingredient in the game. Once you collect it, you can use the honeycomb in the following ways:

  • Beehives: Six wooden planks + three honeycombs
  • Candles: String + honeycomb
  • Honeycomb Block: four honeycombs
  • Waxing signs and hanging signs to prevent anyone from making changes to them (Minecraft 1.20 or later).
  • To wax copper blocks to stop them from oxidation.

💡 Top Tip: Since honeycomb disappears after one use, build a bee farm to keep your supply stocked! Whether you're crafting or waxing blocks, you'll need more than you think.

Honeycomb in Minecraft FAQs

How do you keep honeycomb in Minecraft?

You must use the silk touch enchantment to pick up, keep, and move the nest while keeping the honeycomb in it.

Do honeycomb blocks attract bees?

Honeycomb doesn't attract bees. But you can place empty beehives or bee nests to invite bees to create a home inside them.

What do Minecraft bees eat?

Bees don't particularly eat anything in Minecraft. Though you can use flowers to attract them, heal them, and even breed them.

Get and Use Honeycomb in Minecraft

Collecting honeycomb can be an adventure, but don't worry about those angry bees! You can create a shield in Minecraft for protection from getting stung. Alternatively, create a saddle for a quick getaway if things get buzzy.

 Once you've mastered the art of honeycomb harvesting, you'll unlock a world of possibilities - from wax copper blocks to decorative candles.

 Have some creative ideas for using honeycomb? Join the conversation on our Discord server, and let's figure out how to use Honeycomb creatively together!
excerpt: Figure out how to get honeycomb in Minecraft with the safest and easiest method. Also learn the best tips to protect yourself from bees of Minecraft.

title: How to Make an Iron Golem in Minecraft (2023 Guide)
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make an Iron Golem in Minecraft (2023 Easy Guide)
content:
In the world of Minecraft, danger lurks around every corner in the form of hostile mobs. And unless you are playing on the top Minecraft survival servers, you have to deal with them on your own. But what if you had a powerful friend by your side, acting as your bodyguard? That's exactly what an Iron Golem in Minecraft can do for you. This amazing mob fights and takes care of hostile mobs for you while you can go around collecting loot in your bundles. But before you can enjoy the benefits of having an Iron Golem by your side, you'll need to learn how to get one. So, let's stop beating around the bush and learn how to make an Iron Golem in Minecraft.

How to Make an Iron Golem in Minecraft

Our guide covers all the important aspects of spawning, creating, and interacting with an Iron Golem in Minecraft. Make sure to go through all the sections thoroughly to befriend this powerful mob.

What is an Iron Golem in Minecraft

Iron Golems are some of the strongest neutral mobs in Minecraft whose main aim is to protect villagers by killing monsters. So, whenever they see a hostile mob they start attacking them. Moreover, if you attack a villager in front of a natural Iron Golem it won't hesitate to hunt you down as well.

However, crafted Iron Golems are different from their naturally spawned counterparts. However, crafted Iron Golems are different from their naturally spawned counterparts. You can even go ahead and attack a crafted golem but it won't hurt you back.

Where Do Iron Golems Spawn

Naturally, you can find an Iron Golem only in the following locations:

  • Villages (all types)
  • Pillager Outpost (inside cages)

The villagers and Iron Golems have a deeply connected life. If one location has three or more villagers panicking about a hostile mob, Minecraft automatically spawns an Iron Golem. You can rely on this mechanic and breed villagers to spawn this mob anywhere you want. But, if you don't want to take that route, it's time to learn how to make an Iron Golem in Minecraft easily.

What Do You Need to Build an Iron Golem

You only need the following items to build an Iron Golem in Minecraft:

  • 4 Iron Blocks (requires 36 iron ingots to craft)
  • 1 Carved Pumpkin or Jack o’Lantern

As you can guess from its name, the most important element of an Iron Golem is its iron body. For that, you first have to use our ore distribution guide to find iron ore in your world. Then, you need to mine the ore with a pickaxe and smelt the raw iron in a furnace.

Once you have 9 iron ingots, they can be combined to create an iron block. To make an Iron Golem in Minecraft, you need a total of four such iron blocks. So, even though the overall process is simple, it can be somewhat time-consuming.

How to Get Carved Pumpkin

Follow these steps to get a carved pumpkin, the head of an Iron Golem:

1. First, look for a taiga village or grassland to find pumpkins growing there. You can use our list of the best Minecraft village seeds to speed up the process.

2. Next, combine two iron ingots in a diagonal to craft shears.

3. Then, use the shears on the pumpkin you found to turn it into a carved pumpkin. Finally, break the carved pumpkin with the help of any tool or your hands to pick it up.

4. Additionally, you can even combine a carved pumpkin with a torch to turn it into a jack o’lantern. Minecraft allows you to use either a carved pumpkin or a jack-o’lantern to build an Iron Golem.

Steps to Build an Iron Golem

After collecting all the required items, it's time to build an Iron Golem in Minecraft. Follow these easy steps to learn how:

1. First, create a short tower by placing two iron blocks on top of one another.

2. Then, place two iron blocks on either side of the iron block that's on top of the tower. While you create it, make sure you are in an open area so other blocks don't block the golem's spawning.

3. Finally, place a carved pumpkin or jack o’lantern on top of the T-shaped structure to finish it. As soon as you place the pumpkin, the entire structure will break and an Iron Golem will spawn in its place.

Note: Players on the Bedrock edition can even use a regular pumpkin to complete the structure.

How to Heal an Iron Golem

Keeping up with their reputation as a protector, the Iron Golems are great fighters but they are not indestructible. Every time they take serious damage, cracks start showing up on their body and once they take a total damage of 100 points, they die.

Unfortunately, unlike mobs like the Sniffer, Iron Golems can't heal themselves. So, it's up to you to protect their lives by healing them with the help of iron ingots. Every iron ingot you use on a golem restores its health by 25 points.

Iron Golems: FAQs

Why is my iron golem not spawning?

There must be at least one block space next to the bottommost block of the structure to spawn an Iron Golem. If there is no space Minecraft automatically cancels the spawning.

How do you tame an iron golem?

Unless you are using the best Minecraft mods, there is no way to tame an Iron Golem. However, you can still use a piece of lead to guide it anywhere you want.

How do you make a stone golem?

At the moment, Iron Golems and Snow Golems are the only official golem variants in Minecraft. But, you can easily expand your options by installing one of the best Minecraft modpacks.

Does killing Iron Golems anger Villagers?

In terms of intended behavior, killing an Iron Golem should anger the villagers. However, due to a known bug (track here), they don't react to the death of their savior.

Can an Iron Golem be killed?

Since an Iron Golem has 100 health points, it will take you around 15 hits from a diamond sword to kill it. Once it dies, the golem drops 3 to 5 iron ingots and up to 2 poppies.

Easy Guide to Spawn an Iron Golem in Minecraft

Now that you know how to make an Iron Golem in Minecraft, your adventures are going to be much easier. But to make the most out of your next quest, you'll need to upgrade the rest of your kit as well. For a combat-friendly ride, we suggest you get a camel in Minecraft and equip it with a saddle. And since every good explorer needs strong armor to keep themselves safe, you should also get Netherite or diamond gear as soon as possible. Though, don't forget to add some armor trims to your gear for an extra touch of style. So gear up and get ready to explore everything this amazing game has to offer!
excerpt: Learn how to make an Iron Golem in Minecraft using our simple step-by-step guide featuring images, recipes and more.

title: How to Make Snow Golems in Minecraft - Easy Guide
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make Snow Golems in Minecraft - Easy Guide
tags: Minecraft Basics, Snow Golem, Minecraft Mobs
content:
Slow golems are one of the most amazing passive mobs in Minecraft that not only decorate your bases but also protect them. One of the most unique features of Snow Golems is that they leave a trail of snow behind while walking. This turns them into a perfect resource to add a touch of winter and Christmas to your bases on the best Minecraft survival servers. But meeting them is no easy feat since they can't be found naturally like other mobs. So, let's explore how to make Snow Golems in Minecraft and unleash an army of snowmen to guard your territory.

How to Make Snow Golems in Minecraft (2023)

We will first cover the behavior and mechanics of Snow Golems in your blocky world. If you are already familiar with them, please feel free to skip ahead to their construction.

What are Snow Golems in Minecraft

Snow golems are defensive mobs in Minecraft that players can create to fight hostile mobs and protect their bases. They are passive mobs that fire snowballs at monsters but don't interact with players. In addition to their defensive capabilities, they also leave a trail of snow behind them as they walk around in cold or temperate biomes.

Meanwhile, in hot biomes like a desert or mesa, the Snow Golems take damage, melt and despawn. Moreover, players, hostile mobs, and environmental causes can also reduce the health of this mob. When a Snow Golem dies, it leaves 0 to 15 snowballs behind that you can pick up and use.

Where Do Snow Golems Spawn

Unlike an iron golem, Snow Golems don't spawn naturally in the world of Minecraft. However, there is a rare chance that Endermen may accidentally place a pumpkin on top of two snow blocks, creating a Snow Golem.

This unusual event can sometimes occur in the Bedrock edition of the game, but it is not a reliable way to obtain this mob. The best option for you is to learn how to make Snow Golems in Minecraft and keep it safe.

Items You Need to Make Snow Golems

You need to collect the following items to build a Snow Golem in Minecraft:

  • Two snow blocks
  • One pumpkin‌, a carved pumpkin, or a jack o'lantern

As you might expect, you must travel to Minecraft's highest peaks to collect snow. You have to use a shovel with the silk touch enchantment to pick up a snow block. If your shovel isn't enchanted then the block only drops snowballs.

But, if you find two snow blocks naturally on top of one another, you can use them as it is. There is no need to pick or move them. Keep reading to find out how. As for finding the snow, you can use our best Minecraft mountain seeds to reach them in no time.

How to Get a Carved Pumpkin in Minecraft

Once you have your snow blocks to create the body of Snow Golem, it's time to find the perfect carved pumpkin for its head. Here's how:

1. First, find a taiga village in Minecraft or look around grassy biomes till you find a pumpkin. Then, break the pumpkin with any tool to pick it up.

2. If you want to create a carved pumpkin, you have to use shears on it before picking it up.

3. Later, you can combine the carved pumpkin with a torch to turn it into a jack-o'lantern.

Note: If you're playing the Java edition, you can use either a carved pumpkin or a jack-o'lantern to create your Snow Golem. But on the Bedrock edition, even a simple pumpkin is enough to get the job done.

How to Make Snow Golems in Minecraft: Step-by-Step Guide

Now that you have everything you need, follow these simple steps to build a Snow Golem in Minecraft:

1. First, create a tower of snow blocks by placing one on top of the other.

2. Then, place a carved pumpkin or jack-o'lantern (or a pumpkin in Bedrock) on top of the snow blocks.

3. As soon as you place its pumpkin, the structure will disappear and a Snow Golem will spawn at its spot.

Remove the Head of a Snow Golem

By default, a Snow Golem uses a carved pumpkin as its face which fits quite well with Halloween-themed worlds. But, you can use shears on the Snow Golem to get rid of the pumpkin and make its face look like an actual snowman.

Doing so doesn't affect the functionality or mechanics of the golems and only changes their appearance. Though, you can even pick up the dropped pumpkin and use it to create more Snow Golems or for other Halloween decorations.

Snow Golem: FAQ

Who Do Snow Golems Attack?

Much like an iron golem, Snow Golems also attack all monster mobs, except ghasts, by firing snowballs at them.

Do Snow Golems cause damage?

The snowballs fired by Snow Golems only deal damage to Blazes and wolves. But getting hit by the snowballs can knock back players and prevent them from getting closer to any spot.

What kills a Snow Golem?

Similar to snow in the real world, the Snow Golems melt in hot biomes including deserts, and even the Nether.

Do Snow Golems hurt villagers?

Unless they get caught in the crossfire, the Snow Golems never hurt villagers, players, or any passive mob including the new Sniffer.

Build and Meet Snow Golems in Minecraft

Now that you have a snow layering friend in Minecraft, it might be a good time to redecorate your entire base. For the exterior of the building, you can use modern blocks like a smooth stone that fit well with the snow. Meanwhile, for the interior, furniture options like a bunk bed might be a good fit. But to make the base really pop, we suggest you also make some hanging signs and flower pots to take the renovation to a new level. But of course, all of this can wait for later. For now, it's time to create your snowman and start a new adventure!
excerpt: Learn how to find, make and use a Snow Golem in Minecraft using our simple step-by-step pictorial guide.

title: 22 Best Minecraft 1.19.4 and 1.20 Survival Seeds You Can't Miss in 2023
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: 22 Best Minecraft 1.20 Survival Seeds You Can't Miss in 2023
content:
Minecraft is a game with endless possibilities, but even the most seasoned players can find themselves in a rut. Then, you might find yourself repeating the same pattern of collecting loot and trying to find an End city and other key structures. But why settle when you can mix things up with some of the best Minecraft survival seeds? Each one of them generates a truly unique opportunity to explore, create and survive. There is something for everyone. So, let's dive in and find the perfect seed to suit your playstyle!

Best Minecraft Survival Seeds

You can find each Minecraft survival seed along with key coordinates and compatible editions at the end of every description. Be sure to enter these codes accurately to generate the world you desire.

1. Best Nether Seed in Minecraft

Most of the best Minecraft survival seeds only focus on the overworld and its various structures. But this seed is the exception. The place where you spawn in the overworld is survivable at best. But if you make a Nether portal in that same spot it will take you right inside a Nether fortress.

Additionally, the fortress is located right next to a bastion remnant and a second fortress. You cannot get a better entrance than this into the Nether, making this seed perfect for speedrunning.

  • Seed: 2900
  • Edition: Java
  • Second Fortress Coordinates:
  • Bastion Remnant Coordinates:

2. Zombie Doctor

As you might expect, villagers and zombies have a very sour relationship in Minecraft. If a zombie bites a villager it turns into a zombie villager which isn't good for either you or the other villagers. But, if you know how to cure that zombie villager then you can unlock a bunch of amazing trades in the game.

This mechanic is so prevalent that the igloos have a dedicated basement for this process. In fact, we even have a dedicated seed for it. Upon spawning into it, you'll find yourself next to an igloo that's located within a village. Then, you can make your way to the basement and get to work curing those zombie villagers.

  • Seed: 12052608
  • Edition: Java

3. Spawn in Zombie Village Near Minecraft Jungle

Now that you are familiar with zombie villagers, it's time to take that skill to the next level by curing an entire village. That's right, this best Minecraft survival seed spawns you right inside a zombie village. It's home to various hostile mobs that are waiting to be redeemed.

But, before you unleash an attack, make sure to visit a nearby jungle temple for some resources. If you get lucky, you can even get resources to make a diamond sword in Minecraft to easily take over the village.

  • Seed: 998770145
  • Edition: Java
  • Jungle Temple Coordinates:

4. Time for Swimming Lessons

If you're looking for some exciting best Minecraft survival seeds that are truly challenging then look no further. This one spawns you right inside the ocean with no piece of land to hold on to. Now, you have to figure out how to ensure your survival while the water tries to bring you down.

Swimming for too long will cause your character to starve, but staying still will result in drowning. Your only hope is to search for land, but it seems like it's all just endless water as far as the eye can see. Can you find a way to survive? There's only one way to find out!

  • Seed: 32733
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock

5. A World of Bamboo

With the new Minecraft 1.20 update, bamboo is becoming increasingly popular among players. This versatile plant can be used to create a variety of new bamboo wood blocks, unlocking a whole new set of building possibilities. However, finding bamboo can still be a challenge.

But, with this best Minecraft survival seed, you won't have to search for bamboo ever again. It spawns you in the middle of the biggest bamboo jungle biome of all time. As far as you can see, there's nothing but bamboo and pandas. Getting out of this spot is nothing less than solving a maze, but once you do, you will have an abundance of bamboo resources.

  • Seed: 4660
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock

6. Boating in the Mangrove

Players have been dreaming about living and boating in the mangrove swamps ever since they made it into Minecraft. However, this biome often spawns too far away or is too short for exploration. But, you can change that by loading this Minecraft seed.

Made up of a network of rivers and a huge mangrove swamp biome, it's the perfect spot to explore the water. All you need is a boat and a will to explore the world. Though, if you want to improve the experience further, you can rely on the best Minecraft shaders to make the biome look even better.

  • Seed: 3900
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock

7. Village Survival Island

Whether you are a veteran or a novice in the world of Minecraft, it's easy to agree that survival islands are the best way to experience the game. You spawn on a remote island with limited resources and nothing but water all around you. Then, you have to make your way to the rest of the world and explore everything it has to offer.

This seed takes the survival island concept to a new level by generating a village on the same island. With the presence of villagers, you won't have to worry about basic resources like food. This is like a bonus survival island that you can even turn into a base.

  • Seed: 153632703
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock

8. Largest Windswept Area

The windswept biomes of Minecraft are as unique as their name. They are made up of shattered terrain, a bunch of cave openings, and post-apocalyptic mountains. In other words, they are the best spot to test the ore distribution in Minecraft and find every mineral you need.

Meanwhile, when it comes to finding this amazing biome, all you need is this best Minecraft survival seed. It drops you right in the middle of one of the largest windswept areas of all time. Though, keep in mind that this biome isn't reliable for food. So, make sure to hunt some meat and cook it in a furnace to quench your hunger.

  • Seed: 762
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock

9. Hollow Dripstone Mountain

Caves, under normal circumstances, only spawn beneath the ground in Minecraft. But, there's nothing normal about this survival seed that generates a cave right inside a mountain. Moreover, it doesn't even bother to cover it up.

So, you get a perfectly exposed dripstone cave that you can walk right in. This unique terrain isn't only good news for collecting ores but is also perfect for making a truly unique base. But, make sure to grab a shield to keep it secure from hostile mobs that are common around caves.

  • Seed: 486881
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock

10. Four Ancient Cities

Home to the dangerous Warden and probably the best overworld loot, Ancient Cities are a truly fascinating structure. But, they are rewarding only for the ones that can fight the most powerful mob in the game. So, if you consider yourself one talented combatant then, make sure to try this best Minecraft survival seed.

It generates four ancient cities right beneath your spawn point. You can simply walk from one city to another and get all the loot you need throughout the game. Though, we strongly suggest you keep a Potion of Healing handy to counter the Warden. Otherwise, survival on this seed might be a lost cause.

  • Seed: 255574
  • Edition: Java

11. Anti Speedrun Seed

Whether it is a village or one of the various temples, the structures of Minecraft are the only support a player can rely upon for survival. But, what if your world had no friendly structures in it? As scary as it sounds, this is the reality of this Minecraft seed. At least, for the first couple of thousand blocks.

So, you have to travel long and far to find anything useful. Though, you can take the shorter route and rely on the Nether as well. But to even do that, you will first have to make a diamond pickaxe which is a challenge in itself.

  • Seed: 1452
  • Edition: Java

12. Double Oceanic Villages

A village spawning on top of the ocean surface feels like a world. But two villages spawning on the ocean surface right next to each other is nothing less than a miracle. This unbelievable situation takes place right next to your spawn in this seed.

You get two complete plains villages floating right next to each other. These villages have all their features, mobs and loot in-tact. But, you might have to make some adjustments to it to prevent villagers from falling into the ocean. If you want to take an aesthetic route then stone bricks might be a good choice for the country.

  • Seed: -2860103479678833022
  • Edition: Bedrock

13. Best and Worst Spot to Spawn

The resourcefulness of this best Minecraft survival seed totally depends upon your skillset and combat abilities. Upon spawning, you'll find yourself on the roof of a woodland mansion, which is filled with deadly Pillagers and valuable loot.

It's up to you to fight your way through the mansion and claim all the treasure or find a way to escape unharmed. This location offers a thrilling challenge for experienced Minecraft players who want to test their combat skills and resourcefulness.

  • Seed: 92269280
  • Edition: Java

14. Stuck in Ice

The snowy biomes in Minecraft are nothing less than death traps for the players. They consist of steep spots, quicksand-like snow, and a total lack of food. If you are on the Bedrock edition, that's exactly what you get on this best Minecraft survival seed.

However, it goes a little easy on the Java players by generating a large village near their spawn point. But, even the village only takes you so far, as the huge frozen ocean surrounding the spot isn't easy to cross. You will have to budget resources, plan a route and use a saddle to make the journey safer.

  • Seed: 9675869
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock

15. Pink Crater With Ruined Portal

As its title hints, this best Minecraft survival seed is dedicated to the new Cherry Grove biome. It generates a small group of cherry trees nestled in the lap of a snowy mountain. With pink petals being highlighted next to white snow, the scene looks like something out of a painting.

But this spot isn't just for aesthetics. You will also find a bunch of cave openings and a ruined portal in the area, offering a plethora of basic resources to gather while enjoying the beautiful surroundings. However, if this variant of the pink biome doesn't fit your needs, our list of the best Cherry Grove seeds in Minecraft can offer some good alternatives.

  • Seed: 4424490
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock
  • Ruined Portal Coordinates: 8, 119, 5 (Java)

16. A Bad Bad World

This Minecraft survival seed generates thousands of blocks of the Badlands biome, one of the most unique and striking biomes in the game. With three distinct variants, each offering its own desolate landscape, the Badlands biome provides a perfect setting for challenging survival gameplay.

While the biome is scarce in passive mobs, water, and other food sources, it is rich in Mineshafts, gold ore, and various building blocks. This contradiction in resources ensures that you get a challenging survival experience that rewards you heavily for exploring.

  • Seed: 868
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock

17. Sinkhole with Lava Village

If you're only going to try one seed from our list of the best Minecraft survival seeds, we highly suggest this one. It generates a sinkhole in the middle of a large lake, with water flowing into it from all sides. At the bottom of the sinkhole sits a large lava pool, creating a striking contrast with the water.

If you're only going to try one seed from our list of the best Minecraft survival seeds, we highly suggest this one. It generates a sinkhole in the middle of a large lake, with water flowing into it from all sides. At the bottom of the sinkhole sits a large lava pool, creating a striking contrast with the water.

  • Seed: 712262452098460
  • Edition: Java
  • Sinkhole Coordinates: -1100, 70, 950
  • Source: u/stofix_

18. Large Mushroom Island

If you're searching for a secure and peaceful spot to establish your base in Minecraft, this seed is the perfect choice. It generates a massive mushroom field island quite close to your spawn point. This is the only biome in the entire game that doesn't spawn any hostile mobs even at night.

Due to this game-changing mechanic, the island acts as a great spot for building bases, farms, and storage areas. Nonetheless, carrying blocks to this location can be challenging, but using an Elytra in Minecraft can significantly simplify the process.

  • Seed: 26398
  • Edition: Java/Bedrock
  • Island Coordinates:

19. Camel, Pyramid, and More

This top Minecraft survival seed brings together the best of desert biomes, offering a variety of exciting elements for players to explore. You spawn right inside a desert village that has a temple built within it.

Plus, thanks to the Trails & Tales update, this is also the spot where you find a camel in Minecraft, a reliable companion for the harsh desert terrain. Not only will you have access to good loot, and an opportunity to trade but you'll also have a reliable ride.

  • Seed: 22003990
  • Edition: Java

20. Savanna Village Island

In the vast world of Minecraft, the savanna biome is known for its hot and arid environment, a stark contrast to the lush green areas and water bodies. However, in this exceptional seed, you'll discover a savanna village situated in the middle of the ocean.

Such an ironic and rare spot is almost impossible to come across during exploration. This island acts like a great starting point for explorers and the thematic differences make it a great spot for building a base. However, even with a village, the food in the savanna is as scarce as ever. So, relying on fishing might be your only option.

  • Seed: 7218158
  • Edition: Java

21. A Deep Chasm

If you want to improve your movement skills and master the best Minecraft parkour servers, then this seed has the perfect spot. It generates a shattered chasm in the middle of a dense forest. You can find several towering stone structures in it that are perfectly spaced for jumping from one to the next.

With a bit of tweaking, you can even turn this seed into a custom Minecraft parkour map for you and your friends to enjoy. Though, we suggest you try a few basic jumps first before inviting your friends to the chasm.

  • Seed: -5410362387458472998
  • Coordinates: -12, 130, 41
  • Edition: Java
  • Source: u/JonesMinecraft

22. Three Monuments Within 500 Blocks

To sum up our list of best Minecraft survival seeds, we have this amazingly unique option. It creates three instances of ocean monuments within 500 blocks of your spawn point. Normally, the monuments spawn on extremely rare spots and are quite hard to find.

Thanks to this seed, finding them is no longer an issue. However, it's crucial to approach these monuments with caution as they are incredibly dangerous and require thorough preparation. So, make sure to get a Potion of Water Breathing and at least a diamond sword before approaching a monument.

  • Seed: 26609848
  • Edition: Java


Explore the Best Minecraft Survival Seeds

Whether you are new to the game or have been playing it for years, these best Minecraft survival seeds are sure to unlock an exciting experience. But most of them put your survival skills to the ultimate test. However, if you prefer more relaxed gameplay, you might want to check out the best Minecraft village seeds instead. Though, if you are on the Bedrock edition, you can even use the Minecraft editor mode to easily transform any of the survival seeds. Having said that, do you know any good Minecraft seeds? Don't forget to share your collection on our Discord server!
excerpt: Here are our picks for the best Minecraft survival seeds that offer amazing challenges, unique spawns and rare structures.

title: How to Make an Anvil in Minecraft - Easy Guide
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make an Anvil in Minecraft - Easy Guide
content:
When it comes to a typical day in Minecraft, players often find themselves on a never-ending cycle of hunting for resources to craft tools or using their current tools to obtain the items they need.

But this cycle can become tiresome when those tools inevitably lose their durability. Luckily, an anvil may be just the solution you need.

With an anvil, players can repair their tools, prolong their lifespan, and even add personalized names or enchantments to them. It's a must-have for players who want to maximize their efficiency on the best Minecraft prison servers. So, let's jump right in and learn how to make an anvil in Minecraft!

What You'll Learn

  • Simple step-by-step instructions to craft an anvil using iron blocks and ingots
  • Where to find naturally generated anvils in Minecraft
  • A complete breakdown of anvil durability states and lifespan
  • Five essential uses of anvils
  • How to maintain your anvil and prevent damage
  • Common troubleshooting tips

💡 Pro Tip: Bookmark this guide for future reference - anvils are one of Minecraft's most versatile tools, and you'll likely refer back to these mechanics as you progress through the game.

What is an Anvil in Minecraft

The anvil is a unique and versatile utility block in Minecraft. It enables players to rename blocks, merge enchantments, and repair equipment. This multitude of functionalities makes it more powerful than most other utility blocks that often only have one ability.

However, what makes the anvil truly unique are its weaknesses. Unlike most blocks, anvils are gravity-affected and fall down when there's no supporting block beneath them. 

Furthermore, each anvil has limited durability, just like tools. Overusing or damaging the anvil can cause it to disappear, but we'll discuss this in more detail later on.

Where to Find Anvils

Naturally, anvils only spawn in the forge rooms of the Woodland Mansions of Minecraft. You can't find them in villages, chest loot, or even through mob loot. So, the best option for you is to learn how to make an anvil in Minecraft and create a bunch of its copies.

Items Required to Make an Anvil

Here are all the items you need to craft an anvil in Minecraft:

  • 3 Blocks of Iron
  • 4 Iron Ingots
  • Crafting Table

As you can notice, iron is a major element when it comes to the creation of an anvil. So, you first have to use our Minecraft ore distribution guide to find a bunch of iron ores in your world. Once you find the ore, you have to use a stone pickaxe or stronger to break the ore and obtain raw iron.

Later, you will even have to smelt the raw iron within a furnace and turn it into an iron ingot. Crafting an anvil requires only 4 iron ingots, but you need a total of 31 iron ingots to make the three iron blocks required.

Explanation:

  • An anvil requires 3 iron blocks and 4 iron ingots. 
  • Each iron block is made from 9 iron ingots, hence 3 blocks * 9 ingots/block = 27 ingots for the blocks.
  • Add the 4 additional ingots, and you need a total of 31 iron ingots to make an anvil.

How to Make an Anvil in Minecraft (Crafting Recipe)

Once you have collected all the required ingredients, follow these simple steps to create an anvil in Minecraft:

1. To begin, right-click or use your secondary action key to open a crafting table in Minecraft.

2. Then, completely fill up the first row of the crafting grid by placing three blocks of iron in it.

3. Next, place three iron ingots in the bottommost row of the crafting grid.

4. Finally, put one iron ingot in the middle slot of the second row of the crafting table. With that, your anvil is ready to use.

5. Once you have placed the materials correctly, the anvil icon will appear in the output slot. Drag it into your inventory.

🎉 Congratulations! Your anvil is now ready to use.

Uses of Anvils

Now that you know how to make an anvil in Minecraft, let's put this item to the test. Here are all the ways you can use an anvil in the game:

  • 🔧 Repairing: The anvil allows players to repair any damaged tool or armor piece quite easily. You just have to combine the damaged item with the material that it's made of or a damaged copy of itself.
  • 🏷️ Naming: You can use an anvil to give a custom name to any item in the game. Furthermore, with the help of a name tag, you can even use it to give a name to any mob within Minecraft.
  • 📖 Enchanting: If you combine an enchanted book with an item on an anvil, the enchantment from the book is transferred to the item.
  • 🗺️ Map Editing: The anvil allows players to expand and edit a map.
  • 💀 Attacking: Since the anvil is affected by gravity, it is also capable of falling on top of other blocks. The weight of the iron-based block means that any mob or item underneath it will take heavy damage.

How to Use an Anvil in Minecraft

The anvil has a very simple two-slot UI which is all you need to combine, repair, and modify items. To modify an item, you need to place it in the left-side slot, while the material you want to use for repair goes in the right-side slot. If you place an enchanted book in the middle slot, it will transfer the enchantment to the item.

There is also a title slot at the top part of the anvil in Minecraft where you can put the name you want to give to that item. This feature works on all items in the game, including tools like Elytra, and you can even use it when the middle slot is empty.

Cost of Using an Anvil in Minecraft

If you had the option to use an anvil whenever an item in your kit took damage, it would completely eliminate the need to create new items. While it sounds convenient, such a mechanic would be overpowered and game-bringing. The developers recognize this, which is why every action you perform on an anvil comes with an "enchantment cost."

This cost is paid for by your in-game experience or XP level. and it increases exponentially with each new action.

Keep in mind that XP costs rise every time you modify an item. Once the cost exceeds level 40, the anvil will display the message "Too Expensive!" preventing further repairs or enchantments.

💡 Pro Tip: To minimize XP costs, always add your highest-level enchantments first, then work down to the lower-level ones. This strategy reduces cumulative XP costs and helps you get more enchantments on your item before hitting the dreaded "Too Expensive!" limit.

Damaged Anvil in Minecraft

Unlike most blocks in the world of Minecraft, the anvil comes with limited durability. As you use it more and more, its durability decreases, which is visually represented by the anvil's appearance. 

In addition to that, the anvil also takes fall damage from certain heights, which decreases its durability. And once an anvil runs out of durability, it breaks and disappears.

But you don't have to worry a lot as, on average, one anvil lasts through 25 actions, and that's more than enough for most players. Just make sure not to drop it from a high place. Not only that, now that you know how to make an anvil in Minecraft, you can replace the damaged ones in no time.

💡 Pro Tip: Consider building an "anvil room" with a low ceiling to prevent fall damage. 

Minecraft Anvil Frequently Asked Questions

Can the anvil be broken?

✅ Yes. Anvils can break from overuse or from fall damage if dropped from a height of 5 blocks or more. 

How many times can you use an anvil before it breaks?

⏳ On average, an anvil lasts for ~25 uses before breaking. Each time you use it, there’s a 12% chance that it will take durability damage, moving from:

new → slightly damaged anvil → very damaged anvil

And then eventually disappearing.

Can you heal an anvil?

❌ No. Unlike tools and armor, there is no way to repair an anvil in Minecraft. When it breaks, you’ll need to craft a new one using iron. You can always follow our guide to quickly make another anvil when needed.

Do damaged anvils work?

✅ Yes. An anvil’s damage level does not affect its functionality. Whether it is new, slightly damaged, or very damaged, it still performs all functions—repairing, renaming, and enchanting items—normally. The only difference is its visual appearance and its likelihood of breaking after repeated use.

What happens if a falling anvil lands on a player or mob?

⚠️ A falling anvil deals damage when it lands on a player or mob. The amount of damage depends on the fall height:

  • 1 block fall: Minor damage (~2 hearts).
  • 5+ block fall: Significant damage (~10 hearts).
  • 20+ blocks: Can instantly kill a player or mob.

You can use this mechanic to set up traps or an automated anvil-based mob farm.

Make and Use an Anvil in Minecraft

Just like that, you now know everything there is to know about how to make an anvil in Minecraft. It will make your armor and weapons, like a diamond sword, last way longer than usual.

However, you will still need to get a bunch of experience orbs to get the job done. One of the simplest ways to do so is by breeding villagers or other similar mobs. 

Alternatively, you can also grab a Potion of Strength and hunt a bunch of mobs to make them drop XP orbs. With that out of the gate, do you think the anvil is an overpowered item, or does its cost level it down? Share your opinion on our Discord server!
excerpt: Follow our easy step-by-step guide to learn how to make and use an anvil in Minecraft. It covers all the basic mechanics including crafting, repairing, enchantments, and more.

title: How to Make a Fletching Table in Minecraft (2023) - Easy Guide
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Fletching Table in Minecraft (2023) - Easy Guide
tags: Crafting Recipe, Fletching Table, Minecraft Basics
content:
When it comes to trading in Minecraft, all your success depends on the villager you're trading with. And that's where a Fletching Table comes in handy. This block turns a villager into a fletcher, a mob that offers the best trades in the game. Throw in a cured zombie villager, and you can be the richest person on the Minecraft survival servers in no time. But all of that's only possible if you know how to make a Fletching Table in Minecraft. So, let's dive in and unlock one of the most popular job-site blocks in the game!

Fletching Table in Minecraft (2023)

Our guide goes over all aspects of a Fletching Table in Minecraft in separate sections. You can explore each of them thoroughly to learn everything you need to know.

What is a Fletching Table in Minecraft

A Fletching Table is a job-site block in Minecraft that allows villagers to turn into a fletcher. As Fletcher, they offer you a variety of trades around archery including arrows, bows, crossbows, and more. However, if you want to obtain emeralds, this villager provides the best trade by offering emeralds in exchange for sticks.

Naturally, this block only spawns in every fletcher's hut. You can use our list of the best Minecraft village seeds and get this block without crafting. If that doesn't go as planned, keep reading to learn how to make a Fletching Table in Minecraft.

Uses of a Fletching Table

In Minecraft, job-site blocks serve a dual purpose, making them highly versatile and valuable. For example, the Smithing Table allows you to use Netherite and armor trims while also serving as a job block for armorers. However, this doesn't apply to Fletching Table which only acts as a job-site block.

But, all hope isn't lost yet. The arrow-based textures on this block indicate that it was supposed to help you make and edit arrows. So, if the developers release the highly postponed combat update, the Fletching Table might unlock its functional side.

Items You Need to Make a Fletching Table

You need to gather the following items to craft a Fletching Table in Minecraft:


  • 2 Flints
  • 4 Planks (any)

You can use any kind of wood to create planks in the crafting recipe of a Fletching Table including the new bamboo wood. Moreover, the planks don't even have to be of the same wood type.

How to Get Flint

Follow these simple steps to obtain flint in Minecraft:

1. First, look for gravel blocks that spawn near rivers and on the side of mountains of the overworld. You can use our best Minecraft mountain seeds to speed up the process.

2. Then, break the gravel block to obtain flint. But, keep in mind that gravel drops flint only 10% of the time. So, you might have to break the gravel block and replace it multiple times before getting the desired loot.

Crafting Recipe for Fletching Table

Now that you have all the required ingredients, follow these steps carefully to make a Fletching Table in Minecraft:

1. First, open a crafting table by right-clicking or using the secondary action key on it.

2. Then, put two pieces of flint in the left and middle slots of the first row of the crafting area.

3. Finally, fill the slots below the flints with any wooden planks. They don't have to be made of the same type of wood. Moreover, you can also create the recipe in the second and third columns of the crafting table.

Frequently Asked Questions

What do fletchers do in Minecraft?

Fletchers sell archery-based items to players including arrows, bows, and more.

What does a Fletching Table do?

The Fletching Table in Minecraft allows you to turn unemployed villagers into fletchers. If you don't have any unemployed villagers in your world, you can breed villagers in Minecraft and wait for the babies to grow up.

Can mobs spawn on the Fletching Table?

Hostile mobs can easily spawn on top of this block when it's in a low-light area.

When will the Fletching Table get updated in Minecraft?

As of Minecraft 1.20, there is no official news about the upcoming functionality of the Fletching Table. But, considering how developers are focusing on bringing combat parity in both editions, a fletching update must be close.


Make & Use a Fletching Table in Minecraft

Now that you know how to make a Fletching Table in Minecraft, it's time to put it to use and get some amazing trades. But to do so, you first need to use our Minecraft ore distribution guide and find emeralds. Though, finding them isn't enough if you don't have a reliable pickaxe to mine them. Moreover, once you have enough emeralds, you can even trade with other villagers. Our guide on how to find a village in Minecraft will directly lead to these traders. With that said, what kind of new features do you want for a Fletching Table in Minecraft? Share your ideas on our Discord server!
excerpt: Learn how to craft a Fletching Table in Minecraft and use it to unlock the best villagers' trades in the game.

title: How to Get and Use Name Tags in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Get and Use Name Tags in Minecraft - Easy Guide
content:
If there's one item that has drastically changed how the world of Minecraft works that's a name tag. This powerful item lets you give custom names to all the creatures in the game and even prevent them from despawning. In a way, it's the ultimate solution to keep your pets safe even when you log off from the best Minecraft survival servers. Then, as if all of this isn't enough, you can even unlock some amazing easter eggs with this item. But how can you get name tags in Minecraft and use them in exciting ways? Let's find out!

Name Tags in Minecraft (2023)

We are first discussing the basics of a name tag followed by its spawning and usage. Please feel free to skip ahead if you are already familiar with this item.

What is a Name Tag in Minecraft

The name tags are functional items in Minecraft that allow you to name almost any mob in the game. Once you use a name tag a mob, its name appears as a title floating over its body. Moreover, naming a mob also prevents it from despawning and changes how the game identifies it.

This simple mechanic allows you to easily identify mobs and even control their roles more effectively in various in-game farms. Furthermore, there are even some fun easter eggs around name tags in Minecraft. But, more on them later. For now, let's figure out how to obtain this powerful item.

How to Get a Name Tag in Minecraft

At the moment, there is no crafting recipe for name tags in Minecraft. You can't even obtain it by killing a mob or defeating a boss. Instead, you have to explore your world and obtain this rare item naturally. So, let's go over several methods to improve your chances of getting a name tag.

Method 1: Chest Loot

The easiest way to get name tags in Minecraft is by looting them from chests in the following structures:

  • Ancient City
  • Dungeon
  • Mineshaft
  • Woodland Mansion

Out of these, the Mineshafts have the best chance of generating a chest containing name tags. Moreover, if you are playing on the Bedrock Edition, a name tag can also spawn inside the buried treasure chests. Just don't forget to take a boat with you when you leave.

Method 2: Fishing

If finding structures and looting them doesn't go as planned, you can also try your luck at fishing. Being a "treasure item", the name tags have a less than 1% chance of getting caught in a fishing rod. But, you can use the Luck of the Sea enchantment to improve your chances. Nevertheless, unless you have ample spare time, we recommend skipping this method.

Method 3: Trading

The most reliable way of getting name tags in Minecraft survival mode is by trading with villagers. You can obtain buy one name tag for only 20 emeralds from a librarian villager. But you will first have to trade with it multiple times to make it reach the master level for unlocking this trade.

Moreover, finding emeralds is another challenge. Though, you can use our Minecraft ore distribution guide to make your search a bit simpler. Alternatively, you can also bring down the cost of this trade by curing a zombie villager in Minecraft.

Method 4: Command to Get Name Tags

For the players that are on a cracked Minecraft server or have cheats activated, some creative help shouldn't be a problem. So, just use the following command in your chatbox and get all the name tags you need:

/give @s name_tags 1

As soon as the command gets executed, you will get a single name tag in your inventory. But if you want more, you can replace the "1" in the command with your desired amount of name tags.

How to Use Name Tags in Minecraft

Now that you know how to get a name tag in Minecraft, it's time to use it properly. So, follow these steps to use a name tag on any mob:

1. To begin, combine four iron ingots with three blocks of iron to create an anvil. You will need a furnace to smelt raw iron or have to kill a bunch of Iron Golems ingredients.

2. Then, place the anvil on a solid surface and open it by right-clicking on it.

3. Next, place your name tag in the left-side slot and enter your desired name in the top section. Then, pick up the name tag and place it in your inventory.

4. Once you have a ready-to-use name tag, equip it and hold it in your hand.

5. Then, stand next to the mob you want to name and right-click on it. The name tag will get consumed and the selected name will appear as a title above that mob.

Note: You must have at least one level of experience to use an anvil while naming a name tag. Activities like breeding and killing mobs can help you gain experience in no time.

Name Tag is Not Working: Common Issues

The name tags in Minecraft have the following restrictions that can prevent them from working:

  • You can't use name tags on other players or the Ender Dragon. The latter can be bypassed with commands.
  • Since an armor stand is an entity, you can use a name tag on it. But doing so doesn't give any name to the stand and still consumes your name tag.
  • Using a name tag on mobs prevents them from spawning, except in the case of Wandering Traders. They despawn automatically after a few minutes with or without a name.
  • If you change your world's difficulty to "peaceful", Minecraft will despawn all hostile mobs including the ones that have names.
  • Once you use a name tag on a mob, there is no way to remove or change the given name.
  • When a silverfish enters a block, it technically despawns and loses its name.

Easter Eggs of Name Tags

Once you are familiar with the name tags in Minecraft, the next step is to unlock their true potential. So, here are all the easter eggs that you can unlock with the correct name tag:

Dinnerbone or Grumm

You can name any mob "Dinnerbone" or "Grumm" to turn it upside down. Doing so doesn't affect the properties of that mob but makes it move upside down which is quite hysterical. This easter egg is a direct tribute to Nathan Adams, a technical director at Mojang Studios who uses the username "Dinnerbone".

Johnny

As a major treat for horror fans, naming a Vindicator "Johnny" makes it attack all mobs in Minecraft except Illagers and Ghasts. In the Java edition, Jhonny also targets Ravagers. The name "Jhonny" is a direct reference to the villain of “The Shining", a popular psychological horror novel by Stephen King.

Jeb

Continuing the spree of tributes, this easter egg is based on Jens Bergensten, Minecraft’s lead designer who is popularly known as "Jeb". When you name a sheep "jeb_" its wool goes through a cycle of colors and produces a rainbow-like effect. But if you kill or rear that sheep, it will only drop wool of its original color.

Toast

Probably, the cutest easter egg in Minecraft, the name "Toast" gives rabbits an adorable black and white skin. This look is directly inspired by the real-world missing rabbit of user xyzen420’s girlfriend. You can explore the entire tragic story and this skin's origin on its Reddit post (here).
