Get and Use a Name Tag in Minecraft

With that, you are ready to name your camels, wolves, and all other mobs in Minecraft. But, before you meet your favorite mob, you have to travel through the vast wilderness of this sandbox game. Fortunately, if you have an Elytra, the journey can get much safer and faster. Though, if exploration isn't on your checklist, you can also use a name tag to save your friendly Sniffer from despawning. But what name will suit this adorable creature? Drop your suggestions on the Discord server!
excerpt: Learn where to find name tags in Minecraft and use them to give names to all mobs in the game.

title: How to Make a Brewing Stand in Minecraft (Easy 2023 Guide)
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Brewing Stand in Minecraft (Easy 2023 Guide)
content:
When looked closely, the world of Minecraft is nothing less than a magical kingdom. You can fly with an Elytra, control mobs with a saddle, and even store huge items in a bundle. However, these powers are often limited to the weapons you use - at least, until you get your hands on a potion. Potions in Minecraft offer temporary superpowers that can completely transform how you play the game. But to unlock them, you'll need to learn how to make a Brewing Stand in Minecraft and brew these special liquids. So, whether you want to conquer the best Minecraft Bedwars servers or your survival world, let's dive in and unlock the world of brewing.

How to Make a Brewing Stand in Minecraft (2023)

We are first going over the purpose and spawning of Brewing Stands before moving to their crafting and use. You can explore all sections thoroughly to understand this powerful item in-depth.

What is a Brewing Stand in Minecraft

The Brewing Stand is a powerful utility block in Minecraft that you can use to brew potions and unlock special effects. From healing and regeneration to invisibility and strength, each potion provides unique benefits or potential harm to its consumer. Moreover, the stand can even turn the brewed potions into projectile weapons capable of taking down powerful enemies.

But the usefulness of the Brewing Stand doesn't stop there. It also serves as a job-site block for cleric villagers, who offer a variety of valuable trades including Ender pearls and a range of brewing and enchanting ingredients.

Where Does a Brewing Stand Spawn

You can find a Brewing Stand in the following structures of Minecraft:

  • End Ships (that spawn near End Cities)
  • Igloos (in basements)
  • Village (in churches)

If the circumstances are right, you can easily find this utility block within any of the above-mentioned structures. But reaching these spots is a tedious task in itself which requires a lot of time, luck, and effort. So, it's best to learn how to make a Brewing Stand in Minecraft to ensure you have a backup even if exploration doesn't go right.

Items Required to Make a Brewing Stand

You need to collect the following items to craft a Brewing Stand in Minecraft:

  • 3 Cobblestone Blocks (or variants)
  • 1 Blaze Rod

Stone is one of the most abundant resources in Minecraft, which can be found throughout the overworld. It generates more commonly in caves and around mountains of Minecraft, where they form a major part of the environment.

When you break a stone block with a pickaxe (without silk touch), it ends up dropping cobblestone blocks. You can pick them up and use them to create structures, tools, and even a Brewing Stand. Moreover, you can also use variants of this block including Blackstone and cobbled deepslate in the recipe but they are often harder to find.

How to Get Blaze Rods?

Follow these simple steps to obtain Blaze rods in Minecraft:

1. First, create a Nether portal in Minecraft and use it to travel to the Nether dimension.

2. Then, search for a Nether fortress, which is a massive fort-like structure that generates at random spots in the Nether.

3. Once you find a fortress, you need to explore it till you come across an area that has Blaze hostile mobs in it. Such a spot usually appears in open areas and has a mob spawner in the middle of it.

4. Then, simply kill the Blazes to make them drop Blaze rods. You only need one rod to make a Brewing Stand in Minecraft.

5. As you might already know, the Brewing Stands require fuel to function. So, you also need to put a Blaze rod on the crafting table to turn it into Blaze power for powering your stand.

Crafting Recipe of Brewing Stand in Minecraft

Once you have all the required ingredients, it's time to follow these steps to craft a Brewing Stand in Minecraft:

1. First, right-click or use the secondary action key on a crafting table to open it.

2. Then, place the Blaze rod in the middle slot of the first row of the crafting area.

3. Finally, fill up the entire second row of the crafting grid with cobblestone or its variants. You can even use a combination of cobblestone variants for the recipe. Then, pick up the Brewing Stand from the right-side slot and place it in your inventory.

How to Use a Brewing Stand

Now that you know how to make a Brewing Stand in Minecraft, it's time to put it to use. Its UI consists of several sections. At the left of the stand, you'll find the fuel column, where you can insert Blaze powder to power the brewing. Once you add Blaze powder, it will immediately be converted into fuel and show up in the tube-like section beneath the bubbles.

On the top, you have an ingredient slot where all the key item that brews a potion goes. This item changes based on the type of potion you are trying to create. Lastly, at the bottom of a Brewing Stand, you will find three slots where you can place water bottles and brewed potions. When you fill-up all the slots, the bubbles start bursting and the arrow (on the right) starts indicating the progress.

Frequently Asked Questions

What can power a Brewing Stand in Minecraft?

You can only use a Blaze powder to fuel and power a Brewing Stand in Minecraft.

How many potions can you make in a Brewing Stand?

A player can brew up to three potions using a single ingredient in the Brewing Stand of Minecraft.

Can villagers work on a Brewing Stand?

While a villager can't interact directly with a Brewing Stand, this item acts like a job-site block that can turn them into a cleric. Then, you can trade with the villager to get various potion ingredients and more. Though, if the trades a cleric offers seem a bit expensive, you can cure a zombie villager in their village to lower the prices.

Make and Use a Brewing Stand in Minecraft

With that, you know everything there is to know about how to make a Brewing Stand in Minecraft. Now, it's time to create your first potion in the game. There are a lot of options to choose from but we suggest you try your hands at a Potion of Night Vision as it is fairly easy to make. But, do keep a diamond sword or similar weapon handy to kill hostile mobs that might try to disrupt your quest. So put on your robe, grab your materials, and get ready to brew!
excerpt: Learn how to make a brewing stand in Minecraft and use it to easily brew some of the best potions in the game.

title: How to Find Emeralds in Minecraft (7 Methods)
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Find Emeralds in Minecraft (7 Easy Methods)
content:
When it comes to resource collection in Minecraft, players have a wide range of options to choose from, whether they're playing solo or on the best Minecraft survival servers. However, one often overlooked aspect of the game is trading, which can be a highly reliable way to get rare items. Moreover, if you do it right, trading can also be much faster than exploration. But, in order to trade, players need to collect emeralds, the in-game currency. So, we're here to take a deep dive into everything you need to know about emeralds in Minecraft. From finding, trading, and using them, we got it all covered. Let's dive in!

Emeralds in Minecraft (2023)

From spawning to uses, you can find out everything you need to know about emeralds in Minecraft within our guide. Just make sure to explore all the segments thoroughly and you will have no unresolved queries.

What are Emeralds in Minecraft

The emeralds are one of the rarest mineral items in Minecraft that act as the unofficial but primary currency in the game. They are green in color and have a distinct oval shape that resembles a cut ruby. However, unlike other valuable minerals such as diamonds or gold, emeralds cannot be used to craft tools or armor.

When it comes to obtaining them, as per Minecraft 1.20 ore distribution, emeralds are even rarer than diamonds. So, you might have a hard time finding and mining them naturally. Luckily, there are several reliable ways to get your hands on this coveted item. Keep reading to find out more.

How to Get Emeralds in Minecraft

There are seven main ways to get emeralds in Minecraft:

  • Ore Mining
  • Mob Loot
  • Chests
  • Villager Trading
  • Wandering Trader Sale
  • Archaeology
  • Defeating Trials

Let's go over each of them in detail to find a method that suits your needs.

Emerald Ores

The traditional method of getting emeralds in Minecraft is by mining emerald ores. You can find them generating between the world heights of Y=-16 and Y=256. The maximum spawn rate of emerald ores is at Y=224, often at mountain peaks. You can use our best Minecraft mountain seeds to speed up the progress.

Fortunately, once you find an emerald ore, you just have to mine it using an iron pickaxe or better to get your reward. The great thing about emeralds is that, unlike other minerals such as iron or gold, they don't need to be smelted in a furnace. This makes them quite simple and straightforward to obtain. At least, as long as you can find them.

Killing Mobs

If looking for the ore blocks doesn't sound enticing to you, then a combat test might be a better pick. You can get emeralds by killing Vindicators and Evokers, which commonly spawn in the Woodland Mansion structure. But, make sure to keep a diamond sword handy because these mobs are extremely dangerous.

Not to forget, if you are lucky, you can also find a fox spawning with an emerald in its mouth. You can kill the fox or give it berries to obtain the emerald. This option is a safer alternative to facing off against dangerous mobs just for a single item.

Chest Loot

For players who enjoy exploring their world to loot structures, emeralds can be an easy bonus. This gem spawns in the chest of the following spots:

  • Buried Treasure
  • Desert Temple
  • End City
  • Igloo
  • Stronghold
  • Jungle Temple
  • Shipwreck
  • Underwater Ruins
  • Village
  • Trial Chamber

Please remember that Stronghold chests with an emerald only spawn in the Bedrock edition, while buried treasures contain emeralds only in the Java edition. Moreover, in either editing, the shipwrecks have the highest rate of generating chests with emeralds.

Villager Trading

It is common knowledge that you can buy various items from villagers with the help of emeralds. But, due to the dual nature of the currency, you can also get emeralds by selling them some items. Each villager type offers a unique set of trades, so it's worth experimenting to find the most profitable options. Though, if you can't find them then, some of the best Minecraft village seeds might help.

Expanding on the strategy side, many speedrunners prefer trading with archer villagers who sell emeralds for mere sticks. If your village doesn't have any archers, you can create a Fletching Table and use it to turn a regular villager into an archer.

Suspicious Blocks

If you are reading this guide after the release of Minecraft 1.20 or on a new snapshot, then there is one extra way to obtain emeralds. All you have to do is locate suspicious sand and gravel blocks and use a brush to uncover emeralds from them.

These blocks commonly spawn in desert wells, desert temples, cold ocean ruins, and even trail ruins. Although not every suspicious block has an emerald, you will have much better luck in archaeology than searching for ores. So, make sure you try this trick on the best Minecraft 1.20 servers to stay ahead of your peers. 

Wandering Trader

Thanks to Minecraft 1.20.2 update, you can now sell a variety of items to the Wandering Traders in exchange for emeralds. The list of items includes:

  • Water bottle for 1 emerald
  • Water bucket for 2 emeralds
  • 4 baked potatoes for 1 emerald
  • Milk bucket for 2 emeralds
  • Fermented spider eye for 3 emeralds
  • Hay bale for 1 emerald

Out of these, baked potatoes are quite easy to farm and get you a bunch of emeralds in no time.

Defeating Trial

In Minecraft 1.21, you can take on waves of enemies within the Trial Chamber structure. On defeating all the mobs, the Trial Spawner block rewards you with various items including emeralds and even diamonds. Since you restart a wave after 30 minutes of cooldown, this is one of the most reliable ways to get emeralds. 

Uses of Emeralds in Minecraft

There are a variety of ways in which you can use an emerald in Minecraft. These include the following:

  • Trading: You can use emeralds to trade for a bunch of unique items with villagers and wandering traders.
  • Block of Emerald: Combining 9 emeralds together turns them into emerald blocks. These blocks can be used for decoration or even to create a pyramid to activate beacons.
  • Beacon Powers: Putting an emerald into an activated beacon unlocks certain powers.
  • Smithing: You can use armor trims in Minecraft to decorate your armor with green emerald patterns. Though, you will also have to create a Smithing Table in Minecraft to get the task done.

Best Villager Trades for Emeralds

Unless you are using the best Minecraft villager mods, it can be a bit tricky to get the best price for your items. Fortunately, there are some trades that, if used smartly, can get you infinite emeralds in Minecraft. Let's explore two of them:

  • Glass to Glasspanes: When you trade with a cartographer, they sell 3 glass panes for one emerald. You can use these emeralds to buy 4 glass blocks from librarians. Since 6 pieces of glass give you 16 glass panes, this loop can get you infinite emeralds in Minecraft.
  • Bookshelf Loophole: If you trade with a cured librarian, they sell you one bookshelf for one emerald. But, when you break that bookshelf it gives out three books. You can then sell these books to the same librarian for one emerald each. This method gives you one less villager job to worry about.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best Y level for emeralds?

Emerald ores generate most commonly at the world height of Y=224.

How rare are 2 veins of emerald ore?

Most emerald ores in Minecraft only generate one block at a time. But in some rare seeds, you can find an extremely rare 2-vein emerald ore too.

What is the purpose of emerald in Minecraft?

The main purpose of emeralds is to trade with villagers and wandering traders. But, you can also use them for a bunch of other purposes including smithing, crafting, and more.

What are rubies in Minecraft?

When the emeralds were first announced for Minecraft, they were known as rubies and were red in color. But with the 1.14 update, the developers replaced them with the green emeralds we know and love.

Find, Collect, and Use Emeralds in Minecraft

Now that you have access to emeralds in Minecraft, it's time to use them and trade with some villagers. The first step in the process is finding a village in Minecraft and talking to the residents. Later, you can breed villagers to increase their population and improve your chances of more profitable trades. Though, if you have a hard time bargaining, curing a zombie villager in Minecraft can be a quick hack to get the prices down. With that said, which method are you going to rely upon to find emeralds in your world? Share your opinion on our Discord server!
excerpt: Explore five easy methods to obtain emeralds in Minecraft. Learn about its spawn height, loot locations and a lot more.

title: How to Make Charcoal in Minecraft - Easy Guide (2023)
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make Charcoal in Minecraft - Easy Guide (2023)
content:
In the vast and dynamic world of Minecraft, efficiency and progression are the keys to success. The less time you spend collecting items, food, or fuel, the more time you can spend on activities that actually matter. This is especially true in the Minecraft prison server where wasted time can throw you off the leaderboard. That's why it's essential that you learn how to make charcoal in Minecraft and get one of the easiest and most reliable fuels in the game. Furthermore, on the Minecraft survival seeds, this item makes the difference between surviving the night and dying to zombies. With such high stakes in mind, let's light up our torches and jump right in!

How to Make Charcoal in Minecraft (2023)

We are first going over the mechanics and basics of charcoal in Minecraft followed by its crafting process. Feel free to skip over to its recipe if you are already familiar with this item.

What is Charcoal in Minecraft

Charcoal stands out as an exceptionally efficient fuel source in the world of Minecraft, serving as an ideal alternative to coal. It has a simple crafting process, extended power time, and can even be used to craft various other items. You can use a single charcoal to smelt up to 8 items at once making it quite reliable for cooking food, melting metals, and transforming items.

Coal Vs Charcoal: Which is Better?

In most scenarios within Minecraft, coal and charcoal can be used interchangeably without causing any issues. They even offer an equivalent burn time as fuel. Still, there are some fundamental differences between the two:

  • Source: To get coal, you have to find and mine its ores that commonly spawn in the caves of the overworld. Our Minecraft 1.20 ore distribution guide will help you reach it in no time. Meanwhile, the charcoal has to be crafted manually, which might sound tiring but is often much faster.
  • Trading: The cleric villagers trade coal as a currency for various items or enchantments. But, charcoal isn't tradeable anywhere in the game.
  • Block: You can combine 9 pieces of coal and turn them into a block of coal, which is a great storage option as well as a unique building block. However, the same isn't possible with charcoal.

How to Get Charcoal Without Crafting

Unlike coal, charcoal doesn't spawn naturally in the world of Minecraft and it isn't even available as a trade item with villagers. However, if you break a campfire, which spawns in taiga villages, it drops two pieces of charcoal.

Unless you are using Minecraft mods, this is the only reliable method to get charcoal without crafting it. Nevertheless, the chances of finding a taiga village are quite low, so it's better to learn how to make charcoal in Minecraft than to hunt for a village.

Materials Required to Make Charcoal

You only need the following items to create charcoal in Minecraft:

  • Furnace
  • Log or Stripped Log or Wood (any)
  • Fuel (any)

How to Craft a Furnace

You can use our dedicated guide to learn how to make a furnace in Minecraft. Though, the process is quite straightforward. All you have to do is place 8 pieces of cobblestone in a hollow square on a crafting grid to turn them into the furnace. However, keep in mind that you will need a wooden pickaxe to mine the cobblestone blocks.

How to Obtain Wood and Fuel

Whether it's the real world or Minecraft, the base ingredient for creating charcoal is wood. You can use any pick any type of wood, including the new bamboo wood, and turn it into charcoal. There is only one condition, that the block you choose should be a log, wood, or stripped log block.

The easiest way to obtain one is by simply walking up to a tree and breaking its wood. You don't even need any tool for the same. Moreover, if you collect extra wood blocks, you can place them on a crafting table to get planks which are a common fuel for the furnace.

How to Make Charcoal in Minecraft

Follow these simple steps to learn how to make charcoal in Minecraft:

1. First, right-click or use the secondary action key on a placed furnace to open it.

2. Then, place the piece of wood or log in the top cell of the furnace. As mentioned earlier, you can use any type of log, wood, or stripped log for this process.

3. Finally, add any fuel (preferably planks) in the bottom cell of the furnace. Then, the furnace will get activated and slowly turn the wood into charcoal. You get exactly one piece of charcoal for every wooden block.

Tips for Efficient Charcoal Production

Whether you want to save some time or effectively get the most charcoal on the best Minecraft survival servers, the following tips might come in handy:

  • Wood is the most important element in generating charcoal. So, make sure to plant as many saplings as possible in your world. Though, if your world is based on the best Minecraft jungle seeds, getting wood won't be an issue.
  • When it comes to breaking the wood, your best option is to use TNT, which can bring down several trees at once.
  • Once you have enough wood, you can consider setting up multiple furnaces to increase production speed, consider setting up multiple furnaces.
  • If you have an automated wood-cutting system in place, implementing a setup with hoppers and chests can transform charcoal production into a leisurely task.

Uses of Charcoal in Minecraft

You can use charcoal for these purposes in Minecraft:

  • As an effective fuel for furnaces
  • To craft torches and soul torches
  • For creating a fire charge, an item that can light items on fire and activate the Nether portal
  • To craft campfire
  • In the Minecraft Education edition, charcoal can also be used to create a heat block

Expanding on usage as fuel, charcoal, and coal are the only fuels that furnace minecarts accept. So, if you are planning to create furnace-based farms, learning how to make charcoal in Minecraft is a must.

Craft and Use Charcoal in Minecraft Today

Now that you know how to make charcoal in Minecraft, your days of worrying about powering a furnace as long gone. However, while charcoal is a reliable source, it falls short when it comes to powering certain blocks like the Brewing Stand. So, once you've obtained a stockpile of charcoal, it's time to equip yourself with a diamond sword and embark on a quest to hunt Blazes. That hostile mob leads to the second extraordinary blaze powder which lets you brew amazing Minecraft potions. Once they are in your hand, it's time to unleash your full potential and conquer the virtual realm like never before.
excerpt: Fulfill all of your fuel requirements and learn how to make charcoal in Minecraft. This easy-to-get item is the perfect replacement for coal.

title: How to Make a Campfire in Minecraft (2023)
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Campfire in Minecraft (2023)
content:
Picture this: cooking delicious food, fending off menacing mobs, and immersing yourself in a breathtakingly aesthetic night sky, all thanks to one incredible item—the campfire. It is a multi-purpose item that can improve your in-game life all by itself. Moreover, if you have some great Minecraft shaders installed, it can even turn your night truly aesthetic. So, grab your tools, invite your friends to the best Minecraft survival servers, and let's learn how to make a campfire in Minecraft.

How to Make a Campfire in Minecraft (2023)

Our guide goes over crafting, usage, and all the other mechanics of campfire in Minecraft. Explore all the segments thoroughly to learn everything you need to know about this item.

What is a Campfire in Minecraft

Campfires are fire-holder blocks in Minecraft that act as a stove, a light sources, a weapon, and more. In terms of appearance, campfires look similar to a stack of chopped wood that has a fire burning on top of them.

But, unlike regular fire in Minecraft, the campfire doesn't spread and burn its surroundings. Moreover, they don't require any fuel to keep themselves burning. This turns campfires into an infinite light and cooking source in Minecraft.

Types of Campfire

There are two types of campfires in Minecraft:

  • Regular Campfire: A simple campfire with bright light and the ability to melt ice blocks.
  • Soul Campfire: A low-light variant of the campfire with turquoise-colored fire that does double damage and also keeps Piglins away. It cannot melt ice blocks.

Where Do Campfire Spawn

Naturally, campfires only generate in taiga villages and the Ancient Cities of Minecraft. In the Bedrock edition, you can also find them in snowy taiga villages. Our list of the best Minecraft village seeds will lead you to one in no time.

To pick a campfire up, you have to break it with the help of a silk touch enchanted tool. Without it, the campfire will break its core elements. Moreover, all of these locations only spawn a regular variety of this item. So, you must learn how to make a campfire in Minecraft manually to get your hands on a soul campfire.

Materials Required to Make a Campfire in Minecraft

You have to collect the following items to craft a campfire in Minecraft:

  • 3 logs/stems/stripped logs (any)
  • 3 sticks
  • 1 charcoal or coal
  • A soul soil or soul sand block (for a soul campfire)

Obtaining logs in Minecraft is a straightforward task. All you have to do is break down a tree and collect as many logs as you want. The type of wood you use doesn't affect the campfire in any way. So, you can freely utilize any available wood type, including the new bamboo wood.

However, it's important to ensure that the log blocks you collect are all of the same type of wood. Once you have enough logs, you can place the additional ones into planks by placing them on a crafting table. These planks, when placed one beneath the other, turn into sticks which are another essential item for crafting a campfire.

How to Get Charcoal or Coal

You can use either charcoal or coal to craft a campfire in Minecraft. Both charcoal and coal are equivalent in terms of their functionality, so the choice of fuel doesn't impact the resulting campfire. However, getting charcoal in Minecraft is relatively easier. You can craft it by smelting wood blocks inside a furnace.

On the other hand, coal spawns naturally as an ore in the overworld. You can refer to an ore distribution guide to easily locate a bunch of coal within no time. Once you find coal ore, you can mine it with a pickaxe to obtain coal. Feel free to use the coal or charcoal at your convenience.

How to Find Soul Soil or Sand in Minecraft

If you want to craft the blue soul campfire in Minecraft then you must get a block of soul soil. Follow these steps to learn how:

1. First, create a Nether portal in Minecraft and travel to the Nether dimension. Our dedicated guide will help you with the same.

2. Then, look for soul sand valleys to get soul sand blocks or find Nether wastes for collecting soul soil blocks.

3. Alternatively, you can also find soul sand in Ancient cities. This is the only spot where the soul blocks can spawn outside the Nether.

How to Make a Campfire in Minecraft

Once you have collected all the ingredients, follow these easy steps to craft a campfire in Minecraft:

1. First, open a crafting table by right-clicking or using the secondary action key on it.

2. Next, fill up the bottommost row of the crafting grid with three logs. You can use any type of wood for the purpose but make sure that all three logs are identical.

3. Then, place two sticks on the side cells of the second row and one in the middle of the topmost row.

4. Finally, put a piece of coal or charcoal in the middle of the crafting grid. With that, your campfire is ready.

5. Not to forget, if you place a soul sand or soul soil block instead of coal. Doing so will create a soul campfire instead of a regular one.

Uses of Campfire in Minecraft

Now that you know how to make a campfire in Minecraft, let's go over its uses to get the most out of this block:

  • Cooking: Expanding the item limitation of a furnace, the campfire allows you to cook up to four items at once. You don't even need any fuel to cook the food.
  • Weapon: Since both fire and soul fire causes heavy damage to mobs and players, you can creatively use them as effective killing machines. They are also quite reliable for creating mob XP farms in Minecraft.
  • Honey Harvesting: The campfire, while burning, releases smoke particles which are a great way to calm down bees in the game. This makes campfires a key item to obtaining honeycomb in Minecraft.
  • Light: Unsurprisingly, you can use the campfire to light us your base aesthetically. Their presence can also decrease the spawn rate of hostile mobs.
  • Smoke Signals: What makes campfire unique from most other forms of fire in the game is the ability to release smoke. This allows players to use this amazing item as a way to communicate on Minecraft SMP servers.
  • Mob Distancing: When lit, soul campfires in Minecraft have a distinct ability to repel all Piglins. This turns them into a shield-like item within the Nether.

Frequently Asked Questions

Do soul campfires burn items?

Even with a dimmed flame, the soul campfires are much more powerful than regular campfires. They can be used to harm all types of mobs and players in Minecraft.

How to convert soul sand into soul soil?

You can use the soul sand to craft a campfire in Minecraft. But when you break it (without silk touch) the campfire will drop soul soil blocks. This simple hack can help you get the rare soul soil blocks without any searching.

Is soul fire stronger than fire?

The soul fire does almost twice as much damage as regular fire and it doesn't spread naturally.

Which is faster: a campfire or a furnace?

It takes only 10 seconds to cook food on a furnace in Minecraft. But, a campfire takes a total of 30 seconds to cook the same food. However, the lack of fuel consumption makes campfire a much more efficient option.

Make and Use Campfires in Minecraft

With that, you know everything there is to know about how to make a campfire in Minecraft. But to create a complete camping experience, you will have to do a few extra steps. Firstly, embark on an exciting quest to find a cherry grove biome, as it will enhance your forest adventure. Then, create a small structure with smooth stone or something similar to create a pleasing contrast with the environment. Finally, to complete the immersive experience, craft a cozy bunk bed in Minecraft. With these elements in place, you'll have a fully-realized camping experience complete with a cozy campfire.
excerpt: Explore our simple guide to learn how to make a campfire in Minecraft and use it as an infinite power and light source.

title: How to Make a Lantern in Minecraft - Easy Guide
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Lantern in Minecraft (Easy 2023 Guide)
content:
Once you have slain all main mobs, collected vital resources, and explored rare biomes like the cherry grove in Minecraft, it's time to settle down. And to craft a sanctuary that radiates beauty day and night, we invite you to discover the art of lanterns in Minecraft. Our guide will walk you through the steps on how to make a lantern in Minecraft and transform your basic house into an aesthetically pleasing masterpiece. Whether you're playing Minecraft Realms and aiming to impress your friends or simply seeking to enhance your own visual delight, it's time to shed some light. With that, let's jump right in!

How to Make a Lantern in Minecraft (2023)

In this guide, we are covering everything you need to know about lanterns in Minecraft, including their types, crafting recipes, and even uses. Please explore each section thoroughly to learn everything you need to know.

What is a Lantern in Minecraft

Lanterns are one of the best-look light-based blocks in Minecraft. They are a part of the brightest light sources in the game, right alongside lava, beacons, and Froglights. In terms of design, the lanterns look like small lamps and don't take up much space. This turns them into one of the best options to decorate your bases aesthetically. So, if you don’t learn how to make a lantern in Minecraft, it’s equivalent to giving up on a free resource. 

Types of Lanterns in Minecraft

There are mainly two types of lanterns in Minecraft:

  • Regular Lantern: This variant is orange and yellow in color. It has a light level of 15 making it a part of the brightest light sources in the game.
  • Soul Lantern: If you want a dim light source then this variant is ideal for you. It is blue in color and only has a light level of 10.

Fortunately, learning how to make a lantern in Minecraft allows you to create both variants by replacing one ingredient in its recipe. So, it all comes down to you picking the option you want to decorate your base with.

Where to Find Lanterns in Minecraft

Naturally, lanterns only spawn inside snowy tundra villages, Bastion Remnants, and Ancient cities. You can visit any of these structures and break the lanterns with a pickaxe (any) to pick them up. Though, keeping the spawn rates in mind, your best chance is trying to find a village in Minecraft. Our linked guide will help speed up the process.

Get Lanterns by Trading

More often than not, whenever you visit a village in Minecraft, it will have a torch instead of a lantern as its light source. However, all hope isn't lost. You can trade with apprentice-level librarian villagers to purchase regular lanterns for a few emeralds. Though, there is no such trade for soul lanterns.

Items Required to Make a Lantern

To craft a lantern in Minecraft, you only need the following items:

  • 8 Iron Nuggets
  • A Torch (for Regular Lantern)
  • A Soul Torch (for Soul Lantern)

Collecting ingredients for a lantern begins with finding iron ore in the game and mining it with a pickaxe. You can rely on our Minecraft ore distribution guide to find it in no time. When you mine the iron ore, it will drop pieces of raw iron.

Smelthing raw iron inside a furnace turns it into iron ingots. You can then place that iron ingot on a crafting table to break it down into nine iron nuggets. Crafting a lantern only requires 8 nuggets.

How to Make Torches in Minecraft

Iron is enough for constructing the frame of a lantern in Minecraft. But, you still need a light source to illuminate it and this is where torches come into play. You can create a standard torch by combining a stick with a piece of coal or charcoal on the crafting table. Using it in the recipe for a lantern will lead to its orange variant.

However, if you add soul soil or soul sand into the recipe of a regular torch, it will turn into a soul torch. Using the soul torch will help you create a blue dim variant of the lantern in Minecraft. Not to forget, since both torches have a simple vertical recipe, you can create it in any column of the crafting grid.

How to Make a Lantern in Minecraft

Once you have collected the required ingredients, follow these simple steps to make a lantern in Minecraft:

1. First, open the crafting table by right-clicking or using the secondary action key on it.

2. Then, place the torch or soul torch in the middle cell of the second row in the crafting grid.

3. Finally, fill up the rest of the crafting grid with iron nuggets. With that, your lantern is ready. You can click, drag and drop it into your inventory and start using it.

Uses of a Lantern in Minecraft

Here are all the ways in which you can use a lantern in Minecraft:

  • The most common way players use lanterns is by decorating their bases and houses on the Minecraft SMP servers.
  • Placing a regular lantern in your base, thanks to its brightness, will prevent hostile mobs from spawning.
  • Much like torches, lanterns melt snow over time when placed directly next to or on top of it.
  • Thanks to the power of soul fire, soul lanterns have a special ability to repel Piglins. This makes them a must-have item on your list while traveling through a Nether portal in Minecraft.

How to Place a Lantern

After crafting a lantern in Minecraft, you need to equip and hold it in your hand. Once equipped, you can place the lantern on top of or beneath any other block. When placed, the lantern takes on a lamp-like appearance with a handle on top of them.

However, while a lantern is hanging it has a small chain-like hook on top of it. This mechanic is similar to how hanging signs in Minecraft work. But, the best part is that you don't even need to manually light it up. Lanterns automatically get activated as soon as you place them.

Use Chains with Lanterns

Lanterns and chains have a closely intertwined relationship in Minecraft. By hanging a lantern beneath a chain, the top part of the lantern automatically attaches itself to the end of the chain, creating a visually appealing connection. To craft a chain, you need to combine two iron nuggets with one iron ingot.

Make and Use Lanterns in Minecraft Right Now!

While creating the best-looking light sources in Minecraft is a great deal, it's not worth it if they are not looking their best. So, make sure to install the best Minecraft shaders to upgrade the in-game lighting and make lanterns look their best. For players on consoles or mobile devices, the Bedrocks shaders will be the best bet. Furthermore, as you upgrade your lighting system, consider incorporating a campfire into your Minecraft experience. This versatile utility block serves as both a practical tool and a captivating light source, adding further depth to your gameplay. With that, it's time to elevate your Minecraft world with captivating visuals!
excerpt: Learn how to make a lantern in Minecraft and light up your entire world with this simple and aesthetic block.

title: How to Make a Brush in Minecraft 1.20
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Brush in Minecraft 1.20
content:
Minecraft's archaeology features are finally here and brushes are leading the way. These tiny items have the power to unlock extreme items and help you get your hands on armor trims, minerals, and a lot more. But unlike tools like a sword, getting your hands on and using a brush is quite tricky. So, prepare to dive into a comprehensive guide and discover everything you need to know about how to make a brush in Minecraft.

How to Make a Brush in Minecraft (2023)

Our guide relies on the brush mechanics of Minecraft Pre-Release 2. This tool's functionality and texture are subject to change before the release date of the Minecraft 1.20 update.

What is a Brush in Minecraft

The brush is a brand-new tool in Minecraft. With the brush in hand, you possess the power to uncover suspicious blocks scattered throughout your world. These blocks hold long-forgotten artifacts and precious loot waiting to be discovered. It is a key item upon which the entire archaeology system stands.

Items Required to Make a Brush

You only need to collect the following three items and a crafting table to craft a brush in Minecraft:

  • 1 Feather
  • 1 Stick
  • 1 Copper Ingot

The easiest item to collect in this list is the stick. To create one, you just have to place two wooden planks vertically next to each other on the crafting grid. The best part is that you can use any type of wood including the new bamboo wood to create sticks.

Collect Feathers

The easiest way to collect feathers is by killing chickens which commonly spawn in the plains and other grass-based biomes. Each chicken drops 2 feathers on dying. But alternatively, you can also obtain feathers from chest loot, gifts from cats, and even by killing parrots.

How to Get Copper Ingot in Minecraft

The copper naturally only spawns as an ore block in the caves of Minecraft. It usually generates between the world height of Y=112 and above Y=-16. You can use our ore Minecraft distribution guide to make the search easier.

When you find the ore block, you have to mine it with a pickaxe to obtain raw copper. Later, this raw copper can be smelted inside a furnace to get copper ingots. As for the fuel of the furnace, items like a piece of charcoal or even leftover planks.

Crafting Recipe of a Brush in Minecraft

After collecting all the required ingredients, follow these simple steps to craft a brush in Minecraft:

1. First, open your crafting table and place the feather in the middle slot of the topmost row.

2. Then, put one copper ingot right beneath the feather in the second row of the crafting grid.

3. Finally, finish the crafting recipe by placing a stick in the middle cell of the bottommost row. Not to forget, since it's a single-line recipe, you can make it in any column of the crafting table.

How to Use a Brush in Minecraft

Brushes only have one purpose in Minecraft and that's uncovering suspicious blocks to get you some rare loot. So, follow these simple steps to learn how to use a brush in Minecraft:

1. First, look for suspicious sand or gravel blocks that have a distinct grainy texture. You can find them in ocean ruins, desert temples, desert wells, and the Trail Ruins structures. The sure-shot way to find a suspicious block is by looking at the floor of a desert well.

2. Then, get rid of all the unwanted blocks around the suspicious block to make it easier to deal with.

3. Finally, equip a brush and use it by right-clicking on the suspicious block while standing next to it. The block will slowly break down and reveal the item it contains. However, if you break the block directly it ends up dropping nothing.

Get a Brush in Minecraft Archaeology Right Now

With the powerful brush by your side, it's time to uncover a bunch of amazing stuff in Minecraft in suspicious blocks. The most common item you are going to find will be pottery sherds. These tiny crafting ingredients allow you to create decorated pots in Minecraft which are perfect for revamping your base. But if you get lucky, you can also obtain an egg to spawn a Sniffer in Minecraft from the same suspicious blocks. So, grab your brush, get out there, and start exploring. You never know what you might discover.
excerpt: Learn how to make a brush in Minecraft with a simple step-by-step crafting guide including pictures, recipe and more.

title: How to Make a Potion of Fire Resistance in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Potion of Fire Resistance in Minecraft (2023)
content:
From blazing bases in intense Minecraft Bedwars servers to the fiery depths of the Nether, fire can pose a serious threat to your survival in Minecraft. However, you can easily protect yourself with a Potion of Fire Resistance. With this powerful potion, you can explore even the most dangerous areas without fear of burning to a crisp. Want to swim in the Nether's lava oceans or walk on magma? No problem! Just learn how to make a Potion of Fire Resistance in Minecraft, and all your fiery problems will be extinguished.

Potion of Fire Resistance in Minecraft

We are going over the basics, ingredients, and the brewing process of the Potion of Fire Resistance in separate sections. You can go through them as per your interest.

What is a Potion of Fire Resistance in Minecraft

As its name suggests, the Potion of Fire Resistance provides complete protection from all fire-based damage in Minecraft. With its effects, you can avoid damage from fire, soul fire, magma blocks, fire charges, fireballs, and even lava. It is the ultimate potion to explore the Nether dimension without worrying about its fire-based dangers.

Furthermore, as a secondary benefit, this potion also allows you to see more clearly under lava. This effect isn't as good as what the Potion of Night Vision provides but is definitely a welcoming benefit.

Limitations of Fire Resistance

While the fire resistance effects might seem fail-safe, they cannot protect you from the following:

  • Ghast fireball attacks
  • Touch of Blaze mobs
  • Items like TNT that are triggered by a fire

Furthermore, even though you are resistant to damage from fire, your body can still catch fire while under this effect. So, if you are unable to put the fire out before the potion's effects run out, your inflamed body will take damage.

Items Required to Make Potion of Fire Resistance

You need to obtain the following items to brew a Potion of Fire Resistance in Minecraft:

  • Magma Cream
  • Awkward Potion
  • Brewing Stand

The Brewing Stand is the main functional block that you must get to brew any potion in the game. You can use our linked guide to create one in no time. Moreover, in the process, you will also collect Blaze rods by killing Blazes in the Nether. These rods can be turned into Blaze powder with a crafting table and the powder can be used to power the stand.

Not to forget, while you are in the Nether fortress, don't forget to look for Nether warts farms. You need this fungus to create a potion for Potion of Fire Resistance in Minecraft.

How to Get Magma Cream

The magma cream, if you haven't guessed already, is the main ingredient that gives power to a Potion of Fire Resistance in Minecraft. So, follow these simple steps to obtain it in no time:

1. First, look around the Nether until you find magma cubes, which are hostile mobs exclusive to that dimension.

2. Then, kill the magma cubes to make them drop magma cream. Keep in mind that only the smallest magma cubes drop any loot. The larger ones only keep on separating themselves into smaller parts. So, you will have to keep slaying them. Though, a diamond sword might speed up the process.

3. Alternatively, you can also combine Blaze powder with slime balls to turn them into magma cream. But, for that, you will have to kill slimes first which are much harder to find than magma cubes.

How to Make Potion of Fire Resistance in Minecraft (3:00)

After collecting all the vital ingredients, follow these simple steps to brew a Fire Resistance Potion in Minecraft:

1. First, open your brewing stand by right-clicking or using the secondary action key on it.

2. Then, place the Blaze powder in the left-side fuel cell to power the stand.

3. Next, put Nether warts in the top slot of the stand and water bottles in the bottom slots. The Brewing Stand will slowly create an Awkward potion.

4. Finally, place the magma cream in the top slot and let it turn the awkward potion into a Potion of Fire Resistance.

Make Extended Fire Resistance Potion (8:00)

The regular Potion of Fire Resistance only last for a mere 3 minutes. That duration might be enough to avoid death due to accidental fire but it's not reliable to avoid lava or planned attacks. Fortunately, it's quite easy to extend its duration with the following steps:

1. First, look for Redstone ores that spawn in the caves of the overworld. You can use our Minecraft ore distribution guide to easily find this ore in a few minutes.

2. Then, use a pickaxe in Minecraft to mine the ore and obtain Redstone dust.

3. Next, brew the collected Redstone dust into the Potion of Fire Resistance using a Brewing Stand to extend its duration. The new potion will last for a total of 8 minutes. Such a duration is more than enough to even swim through an ocean of lava unharmed.

Easy Method to Make a Potion of Fire Resistance in Minecraft

You are now ready to explore the world of Minecraft without worrying about any flames engulfing you. However, the Potion of Fire Resistance in Minecraft can't protect you from any other damage so you should also keep a shield handy. Though, if you are riding a camel with the help of a saddle, most of the hostile mobs won't even be able to touch you. And if any mobs do manage to harm your ride, a Potion of Healing can help you quickly restore its health. Now that you are well-prepared, it's time to embark on your Minecraft adventure!
excerpt: Get rid of all the fire damage by learning how to make a Potion of Fire Resistance in Minecraft with our easy step-by-step tutorial.

title: How to Make a Chiseled Bookshelf in Minecraft 1.20
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Chiseled Bookshelf in Minecraft 1.20
content:
The books in Minecraft finally have a home of their own and it's going to change how you play the game. Up until Minecraft 1.20, the bookshelves in the game were purely decorative and occasionally helps in enchantments. But now, thanks to chiseled bookshelves, you can store your bookish items on shelves, and interact with them more freely. Moreover, while doing so, you can also upgrade a bunch of other in-game mechanics in a unique way. But before all of that, let's jump in and learn how to make a chiseled bookshelf in Minecraft 1.20!

How to Make a Chiseled Bookshelf in Minecraft

Our guide covers everything you need to know about a Chiseled Bookshelf in Minecraft. You can explore all of its segments to understand its crafting and other mechanics.

What is a Chiseled Bookshelf

The chiseled bookshelves are a brand-new storage block in Minecraft. These exquisite shelves are designed specifically for bookish items, providing a stylish and functional solution for your library. With a sleek design, they are a perfect addition to bases of all kinds.

Unlike bundles and chests, they don't have a dedicated UI. Instead, they redefine convenience and immersion by allowing people to directly place and pick books onto the shelves.

How Is It Different from a Regular Bookshelf

While both bookshelves look quite similar, they are fundamentally very contrasting to one another. Here are the major differences between the two:

  • Storage: Only the chiseled bookshelves can store bookish items in themselves.
  • Enchanting: The regular bookshelves help you level up the Enchanting Table in Minecraft and unlock a bunch of high-level enchantments. However, the chiseled bookshelves have no such effect.
  • Redstone: Thanks to their storage capabilities, the chiseled bookshelves can send Redstone signals based on their capacity.

Items Required to Make a Chiseled Bookshelf

You only need the following basic items to craft a chiseled bookshelf in Minecraft:

  • 9 Wood Planks (including 3 to make slabs)
  • 3 Wood Slabs

You can use any type of wooden plank to create a chiseled bookshelf. But to get the planks, you first need to get a stem, wood, or log block of that wood type and place it inside the crafting grid. This also applies to the new bamboo wood in Minecraft, which requires you to use a block of bamboo to get planks.

How to Make Slabs in Minecraft

Once you have obtained planks, you can easily turn them into slabs for your requirements. To do so, you just have to fill up an entire row of the crafting grid by placing three planks right next to each other. Doing so will result in six slabs and you only need 3 of them to make a chiseled bookshelf in Minecraft.

Crafting Recipe of Chiseled Bookshelf in Minecraft

After collecting all the key ingredients, follow these simple steps to create a chiseled bookshelf in Minecraft:

1. To begin, right-click on a crafting table to open it.

2. Then, place three slabs and completely fill up the second row of the crafting grid.

3. Finally, fill up the remaining slots of the crafting grid with wooden planks. You can use any planks in the recipe and they don't even have to be made of the same wood. As soon as you place the last plank, you will have a chiseled bookshelf in Minecraft.

Uses of Chiseled Bookshelf

The chiseled bookshelves can be used for the following purposes in Minecraft:

  • Storage: A chiseled bookshelf can store up to six books, books and quills, and/or enchanted books. You can just walk up to the bookshelf while holding the item and place it right on the shelf.
  • Redstone Signals: As you fill up the chiseled bookshelf, it releases Redstone signals that can be detected by a comparator and power Redstone blocks.
  • Hopper/Dropper Interaction: The chiseled bookshelves in Minecraft can naturally interact with hoppers and droppers for moving items. This allows you to position the bookshelf in automatic doors and Redstone machines.
  • Decoration: Much-like regular bookshelves in Minecraft, you can use this new item to decorate your base. Thanks to their unique tiled texture, many players even use chiseled bookshelves to create the floor or roof of their house.

Frequently Asked Questions

Does chiseled bookshelf work with Enchanting Tables?

Only the regular bookshelves help the Enchanting Tables in leveling up.

What does a chiseled bookshelf do?

The chiseled bookshelf helps you store bookish items in Minecraft. Each block can hold up to six books at one time.

Can you make a chiseled bookshelf using cherry wood?

You can visit the cherry grove in Minecraft and use the exclusive cherry wood to craft regular and chiseled bookshelves.

Make and Use Chiseled Bookshelves in Minecraft

With that, you are now ready to upgrade your bases and storage systems in the best Minecraft survival servers. And remember, chiseled bookshelves are just the tip of the iceberg in this incredible update. Alongside the beautiful bookshelves, you can also unlock ancient plants with the help of Sniffer in Minecraft to beautify your base. But in the end, it all comes down to your creative choices. We invite you to share your ideas and inspiration on our vibrant Discord server. Join the community, exchange thoughts, and let your imagination run wild!
excerpt: Learn how to make a chiseled bookshelf in Minecraft and use it to store books, trigger Redstone machines, and even make hidden doors.

title: How to Use Ride Command in Minecraft 1.20 to Ride Any Mob
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Use Ride Command in Minecraft 1.20 to Ride Any Mob
content:
Minecraft is famous for giving its players creative freedom and a huge world to explore. But, when it comes to actually exploring, the game can be pretty limiting. You either have to use an Elytra to glide around or gallop around with a horse. But the next major update is going to change all of that with the Ride command. It allows you to ride any mob in the game, whether it’s the Ender dragon or a little bee. So, if you are planning to explore the best Minecraft 1.20 servers, let’s make sure that you make an entry on the coolest ride. 

Ride Command in Minecraft 1.20 (2023)

Note: All the mechanics of the Ride command in our guide are based on the Minecraft Pre-Release 2. But they are subject to change in the final release. So, please keep an eye out to avoid any issues. 

What is the Ride Command?

The Ride command is a brand new command in Minecraft 1.20 that allows players to ride any mob in the game. Normally, only players can ride mobs like horses, camels, mules, etc. And, in some very rare scenarios, mobs like zombies can ride other mobs like the chicken.  

But with this powerful command, any player or mob can ride almost every other entity in the game. This opens up a ton of creative possibilities for players including mob stacking, rideable towers, unique speedrun challenges, and a lot more.

Syntax of Ride Command in Minecraft

Before we jump into the mechanics of the Ride command, please make sure that:

  • You are running the latest version of Minecraft (Pre-release 2).
  • Your worlds have cheats enabled in them. If not, you can turn them on using the "Cheats" toggle in the LAN settings in the pause menu.

After ensuring that your world is compatible with this command, let's dive in and learn how to make the most out of it. If you want to make one mob ride another mob, you have to use the command Ride command syntax:

/ride <rider> mount <vehicle>

As you can guess, the "rider" in the command is the mob that's on top of the "vehicle", whom they are riding. For example, if an Iron Golem is riding a Sniffer in Minecraft, then, the Sniffer is the vehicle and the Iron Golem is the rider.

How to Dismount

To dismount and remove an entity from riding a vehicle, use the following syntax with the Ride command:

/ride <rider> dismount

Since a mob can't ride multiple entities at the same time, you don't have to specify the vehicle in this syntax. However, it's important to note that for this command to work, your target rider must already be riding another mob.

What Counts as a Rider and a Vehicle

In Minecraft, commands are used to interact with specific entities. An entity refers to all the moving parts of the game, such as mobs (animals), players, projectiles, armor stands, and vehicles like boats, rafts, and minecarts. Each entity in the Minecraft world has its own unique alphanumeric identity. For instance, if there's a cow with the entity ID "xyz123," that ID is exclusive to that specific cow.

Similarly, when it comes to the Ride command, it's important to understand that both "rider" and "vehicle" refer to specific entities. To properly use the ride command, you need to know the entity ID of your targets or find another way to target them accurately. However, there's a simpler method to achieve this. Continue reading to discover it.

How To Use Ride Command in Minecraft

Follow these simple steps to easily use the Ride command in Minecraft:

1. First, find two mobs in your world, on whom you want to use this command. There is no limitation on which mob you can choose. We are going to make a pig ride a Snow Golem.

2. Next, aim at the first mob (pig), then open the chatbox without looking away and type "/ride". Minecraft will automatically display the entity ID of the mob in front of your crosshair in the chat. Press the "Tab" key to insert it into the command. 

3. Then, type the "mount" part of the command and copy the entire command string. It should look like this:

/ride [rider_id] mount

4. Then, aim at the second mob, paste the command string, and press the "Tab" key to grab the second mob's ID. The complete command should look like this:

/ride [rider_id] mount [vehicle_id]

5. Finally, press the "Enter" key to execute the command. The chosen mobs will now start riding each other.

Use Ride Command as a Player

If you want to ride any mob as a player, you have to use the following Ride command syntax in Minecraft:

/ride @s mount [vehicle_id]

Here, the "@s" represents "self," which refers to you, the player. If you're playing on multiplayer Minecraft servers, you can also replace "@s" with the usernames of your friends.

But, please note that riding a mob doesn't grant you control over it. Only certain mobs like horses and others that can be equipped with a saddle can be controlled by the player.

How to Stack Mobs in Minecraft

Now that you know the basics of the Ride command in Minecraft, it's time to push it to the next level. So, follow these steps to stack up mobs in the game:

1. To begin, make two mobs ride one another using the steps mentioned earlier.

2. Then, copy the entity ID of the "vehicle" from the pair and identify the next mob you to join the ride. Keep in mind that you can only add mobs to the top of the stack and not below it.

3. Next, change your command's syntax to the following:

/ride [original_vehicle] mount

Here, the "original_vehicle" with the entity ID of the vehicle in the original pair. Make the change and copy this command.

4. Then, use the new command while looking at your next target and press the "Tab" key to include it in your syntax. Once you are done, press the "Enter" key to execute it. From then on, you can continue using the command and adding mobs to the stack.

Limitations of Ride Command

While the Ride command might sound overpowered at first, it still has a bunch of restrictions. These include the following:

  • Any entity including mobs, dynamic items, and players can be vehicles. in the Ride command in Minecraft. Example: You can have a phantom riding on top of you.
  • If you want to make an entity ride another entity, you need to make that it isn't already riding some entity.
  • As you can guess, an entity can't ride itself. So, the vehicle and the rider can't be the same mob.
  • While you can force mobs to be a part of a stacked tower, you can't change their behavior. So, in certain situations, you can have mobs attacking one another while being part of a stack.

Use Ride Command in Minecraft 1.20 Today

Now that you know everything about the new Ride command in Minecraft, it’s time to take it out for a spin. The best way to do so would be to jump into the best Minecraft survival seeds and explore all the mobs they have. Though, as the number of mobs starts increasing, you have to identify them and also prevent them from despawning. That’s where name tags in Minecraft come into the picture. With that out of the way, what are you waiting for? It’s time to grab your tools and explore the world on your new vehicles!
excerpt: Dive in and learn how to ride any mob in Minecraft 1.20 with the help of the Ride command. Also, figure out how to stack mobs to create a tower

title: Minecraft 1.20 Potions: Complete List
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: Minecraft 1.20 Potions: Complete List (2023)
content:
In the world of Minecraft, there's an extensive list of items that players must master to succeed. While some items are straightforward to craft, potions are a different story altogether. That's why we are here with a comprehensive guide consisting of all the potions in Minecraft 1.20 and their brewing mechanics. This guide will teach you how to create, use, and modify all potions in the game. There is a to cover. From base potions to modifiers, there's a lot to cover, so let's dive right in without any delay!

Minecraft Potions: A Detailed Guide (2023)

Our guide goes over everything you need to know about the potions of Minecraft. From brewing to making the most out of these magical liquids, you will find all you need right here.

What is a Potion in Minecraft

Potions in Minecraft are liquid items that can provide a range of special effects to players, from empowering to neutral or even harmful. Each potion has a unique purpose in a player's toolkit and it can be brewed through a very specific set of ingredients.

But don't feel overwhelmed. As we go over every single potion of Minecraft in our guide, you will develop a deep understanding of the entire brewing process. Then, it will all come down to how well you can apply your knowledge to gameplay.

Types of Potions

There are three main types of potions in Minecraft:

  • Regular Potions: The ones that players directly consume to receive their effects.
  • Splash Potions: Throwable variants of potions that leave their effects on the target they hit.
  • Lingering Potions: Made out of dragon's breath, these potions release a colorful cloud that gives the potion's effect to everyone who touches it.

Furthermore, potions can also be categorized into base, positive, and negative potions based on their effects. For the purpose of this article, we will be using effect-based classification as we explore all the potions in Minecraft.

How to Make Potions in Minecraft

The journey of potion brewing in Minecraft begins with a simple water bottle. By adding ingredients to this liquid container, players can imbue the water with special properties and create a wide variety of potions with unique effects.

To do so, you'll need to use the utility block known as a Brewing Stand. Powered by Blaze powder, the Brewing Stand allows players to craft and modify up to three potion bottles simultaneously. Though, it isn't the only source of potions in the game.

Other Ways to Obtain Potions

Naturally, the potions only spawn within the chests or brewing stands in the following locations:

  • End City
  • Ancient City
  • Igloo (with basements)
  • Buried Treasure
  • Trial Chamber

But, you can also obtain potions by fishing, bartering with Piglins in the Nether, and killing witches and wandering traders. However, these methods only offer a limited selection of potions from the wide range of options available in the game. So, keep reading to find out the effects of each potion and also how to obtain them.

Trial Chamber - Best Structure to Find Potions

You can find a variety of potions inside the new Trial Chamber structure in Minecraft 1.21. They don't only spawn as loot inside chests but also in the form of traps inside dispensers. Mobs like Breeze can activate these dispensers to attack you during a fight.

Here is the complete list of potion you can get if you find a Trial Chamber in Minecraft:

  • Potion of Regeneration
  • Potion of Strength
  • Splash Potion of Weakness
  • Lingering Potion of Weakness
  • Splash Potion of Slowness
  • Lingering Potion of Slowness
  • Splash Potion of Poison
  • Lingering Potion of Poison
  • Lingering Potion of Healing

Base Potions of Minecraft

The base potions are powerless potions that don't have any effect on the targets. Instead, their goal is to serve as a brewing ingredient that can be turned into a powerful potion.

Awkward Potion

Brewing an Awkward Potion is quite easy and only requires Nether warts. But the way it supports other potions is truly limitless. It can be used to make 10 powerful potions making it the most versatile base potion in the game.

  • Main Ingredient: Nether Warts
  • Effects: None

Mundane Potion

Staying true to its name, the Mundane Potion has no use for itself. But, it serves as the base for brewing the Potion of Weakness in Minecraft. Moreover, it is also the only potion that you can create with a diverse set of ingredients including Ghast tear, glistering melon, Magma cream, rabbit's foot, spider Eye, and sugar.

  • Main Ingredient(s): Ghast Tear/ Glistering Melon/ Magma Cream/ Rabbit's Foot/ Spider Eye/ Sugar
  • Effects: None

Thick Potion

The Thick Potion is easily the most useless potion in Minecraft. Not only are they effectless but they can't even be used to make other potions. So, you can only rely on them for decorative or probably, to scare other players on Minecraft PvP servers.

  • Main Ingredient: Glowstone dust
  • Effects: None

All Positive Potions in Minecraft

As you can guess, the positive potions in Minecraft are imbued with effects that can improve players' abilities.

Potion of Healing

Making it a must-have item during combat, the Potion of Healing instantly heals you by restoring 4 hearts on your health bar. To create it, you just have to brew a glistering melon slice with an Awkward Potion. Though if you can't find its ingredient, you can also get this potion by killing a witch while it's consuming it.

  • Main Ingredient: Glistering Melon Slice
  • Effects: Restores health instantly
  • Levels: 2

Potion of Regeneration

The Potion of Regeneration allows players to restore their health over time. Unlike the healing potion, it doesn't restore your health instantly. But, at the same time, it is also much faster than regular regeneration and doesn't even require food. Though, you will have to risk your life and obtain ghast tear to brew it.

  • Main Ingredient: Ghast Tear
  • Effects: Restores health over time
  • Levels: 2
  • Duration: 45 seconds

Potion of Slow Falling

Eliminating fall damage altogether from the game, the Potion of Slow Falling significantly reduces the speed of your fall. By slowing down the rate of descent, players can safely jump from great heights without taking any damage. To create this potion, you have to get a Phantom membrane and brew it with an Awkward potion.

  • Main Ingredient: Phantom Membrane
  • Effects: Reduces speed of the fall
  • Duration: 1 minute and 30 seconds

Potion of Fire Resistance

The Potion of Fire Resistance is one of the most sought-after potions in the game and all for the right reasons. It makes you totally immune from all fire-based damage including lava. As a bonus, it also improves visibility beneath the lava. You can get it by brewing magma cream into an Awkward Potion or by bartering with Piglins.

  • Main Ingredient: Magma Cream
  • Effects: Provides immunity from all fire-based damage and improves visibility in lava
  • Duration: 3 minutes

Potion of Swiftness

Unless you want to rely on horses or camels, the Potion of Swiftness is the ideal choice to speed up any journey in Minecraft. It increases your movement speed while providing a jump boost, both of which are essential movement upgrades. To create this potion, you need to brew sugar into an awkward potion and enjoy the sugar rush.

  • Main Ingredient: Sugar
  • Effects: Significantly increases movement speed and gives a jump boost
  • Levels: 4
  • Duration: 1 minute and 30 seconds

Potion of Strength

Whether you are playing on the best Minecraft SMP servers or taking down mobs, most in-game combat is based around melee attacks. That's why the Potion of Strength, which increases the damage dealt by melee attacks, deserves a special spot in your kit. Moreover, you just need Blaze powder, the fuel of a Brewing Stand, to create this potion.

  • Main Ingredient: Blaze powder
  • Effects: Significantly increases movement speed and gives a jump boost
  • Levels: 2
  • Duration: 3 Minutes

Potion of Leaping

If the best Minecraft parkour servers are giving you a hell then the Potion of Leaping is going to be your best friend. It significantly increases the height of your jump and makes it comparable to rabbits. But, before competing with the rabbits, you have to kill it and get the rabbit's foot to brew this potion.

  • Main Ingredient: Rabbit's foot
  • Effects: Allows players to jump much higher than usual
  • Levels: 2
  • Duration: 3 Minutes

Potion of Water Breathing

As you can probably guess, the Potion of Water Breathing extends the duration for which players can breathe and stay underwater. It is an essential item while taking over structures like the Ocean Monument and looking for oceanic armor trims. You have to brew a Pufferfish into an Awkward Potion to create this amazing potion.

  • Main Ingredient: Pufferfish
  • Effects: Allows players to breathe underwater
  • Duration: 3 Minutes

Potion of Night Vision

Bringing some light to dark nights of Minecraft, the Potion of Night vision helps players see clearly even in dark areas. The most common purpose of it is to enable players to deal with hostile mobs that mostly spawn at night. But, when combined with the Minecraft ore distribution guide, this potion can also turn dark caves and deep oceans into a treasure trove. You just need a golden carrot brewed into an Awkward Potion to create this.

  • Main Ingredient: Golden Carrot
  • Effects: Improves visibility in dark areas and at night
  • Duration: 3 Minutes

Potion of Invisibility

Most combats in Minecraft usually come down to the fighting skills and the weapons of the combatants. But, with Potion of Invisibility, you can bring an element of stealth to your fights by turning yourself invisible. Though, mobs like the Warden, that rely on vibrations, can still see you even with the potion's effects.

To create this potion, you need to brew a fermented spider eye into a Potion of Night Vision. The eye corrupts the existing potion and modifies its abilities. Though, you can also obtain it by killing a Wandering Trader while it's consuming this potion.

  • Main Ingredient: Fermented Spider Eye + Potion of Night Vision
  • Effects: Turns the user completely invisible
  • Duration: 3 Minutes

Potion of Luck

Exclusive to the Java edition, the Potion of Luck is a very powerful potion that you can't brew in your world. Its main purpose is to increase the amount of loot you get from mobs and blocks. Moreover, it also improves the players' chance of getting rarer loot in the game.

You have to use the following command to obtain this potion:

/give @p potion{Potion:"minecraft:luck"}

Negative Potions

Acting as a weapon, the negative potions release harmful effects on the target. Most players use them in the form of throwable splash potions and tipped arrows.

Potion of Weakness

Acting as the exact opposite of the "strength" effect, the Potion of Weakness in Minecraft reduces the melee damage of the target's attack. It is the ultimate way to tone down your enemies before the fight even begins. Moreover, even with such a powerful effect, you just need to brew a fermented spider eye in plain water bottles to create this potion.

  • Main Ingredient: Fermented Spider Eye
  • Effects: Weakens the attack damage of the target
  • Duration: 1 minute and 30 seconds

Potion of Poison

The Potion of Poison gradually reduces the health of its consumer until comes down to one heart. While it might not kill your enemies for you, it can bring fights in Minecraft Bedwars servers down to a single hit. To create it, you have to corrupt an Awkward Potion by brewing a fermented spider eye into it.

  • Main Ingredient: Fermented Spider Eye
  • Effects: Gradually decrease the health of its target
  • Levels: 2
  • Duration: 45 seconds

Potion of Slowness

Living up to its name, the Potion of Slowness reduces the speed of its targets by 15%. Those affected by the potion not only move slowly but also experience a decrease in the speed of their attacks. Much like the other negative potions in Minecraft, you have to corrupt the Potion of Swiftness with a fermented spider eye to create this.

  • Main Ingredient: Fermented Spider Eye + Potion of Swiftness
  • Effects: Gradually decrease the health of its target
  • Levels: 4
  • Duration: 1 minute and 30 seconds

Potion of Harming

Even though all the potions in Minecraft can impact fights in the game, the Potion of Harming is the only one that can kill its target. It instantly removes 6 health points from the health bar of your enemies. To brew it, you have to corrupt a Potion of Poison using a fermented spider eye.

  • Main Ingredient: Fermented Spider Eye + Potion of Poison
  • Effects: Immediately decreases the health of its target
  • Levels: 2

Potion of Decay

Exclusive to the Bedrock edition, the Potion of Decay is a non-brewable potion in Minecraft. It gives the Wither effect to its target which leaves them taking constant damage until the end of its duration. To obtain this potion, you have to use the following command in your chatbox:

/give @p potion 1 36

Potion of Turtle Master | Mixed Effect Potion in Minecraft

Unlike all the other potions in Minecraft, the Potion of Turtle Master has both negative and positive effects on its user. On one hand, it makes you completely immune from all damage in the game. But it also heavily decreases the speed of your movement and attacks.

So, in a way, it gives you a breathing period during dier fights to plan your next move. To brew this potion, you need to obtain a turtle shell which is made up of turtle scutes in Minecraft.

  • Main Ingredient: Turtle shell
  • Effects: Immunity from all damage + reduces movement and combat speed
  • Levels: 2
  • Duration: 20 seconds

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the strongest potion in Minecraft?

If you want to use potions as weapons in Minecraft then the Potion of Harming is your best option. It is the only potion in the game that can practically kill your enemies.

Can you add Glowstone and Redstone to a potion?

You can add glowstone to a potion to upgrade its level and improve its quality. Meanwhile, adding Redstone increases the duration of a potion.

What potion kills skeletons?

The Potion of Healing, ironically, harms undead mobs including skeletons, zombies, and more.

What are the recipes for all potions in Minecraft?

You can explore our dedicated guide to learn the crafting process and ingredients for all the potions in Minecraft.

Make Potions in Minecraft

Just like that, you have now practically unlocked superpowers in the world of Minecraft. But, you will still have to work on your appearance to keep up with your newfound abilities. For that, we suggest you change your skin in Minecraft and then level it up with some armor trims. And when it comes to testing these new potions and your new look, there is no better place than the best Minecraft survival servers. So, what are you waiting for? Grab your brewing kit and start experimenting!
excerpt: From brewing to effects, learn everything you need to know about each potion in Minecraft 1.20 in this all-in-one comprehensive guide.

title: How to Get Pottery Sherds in Minecraft 1.20
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Get Pottery Sherds in Minecraft 1.20 (2023)
content:
The upcoming major Minecraft update is all about self-expression, and what better way to express yourself than display your favorite Minecraft elements as symbols? The new pottery sherds offer just that. Whether you want to personalize your base on the best Minecraft survival servers or unlock a new building block, this is the item you need. So, let's dive in and learn how to make pottery sherds in Minecraft, and unlock a new level of creativity!

Pottery Sherds in Minecraft

Our guide relies on the pottery sherd mechanics of Minecraft Snapshot 23w14a. All the tutorials, images, and functions are subject to change with the final release.

What is a Pottery Sherd or Pottery Shard in Minecraft

The pottery sherds are a set of decorative crafting ingredients in Minecraft that allow you to create decorated pots. Each pottery sherd has a unique symbol engraved on itself that reflects some activity or element from Minecraft.

It's worth noting that the item was originally referred to as "pottery shards," but the developers changed the name before the release date of Minecraft 1.20 to its current name, "pottery sherds." Irrespective of what you call it, this item aligns with the game's focus on self-expression, just like armor trims.

Types of Pottery Sherds in Minecraft

At the moment, there are a total of 23 pottery sherds in Minecraft. Here is a complete list of them along with the locations where they spawn:

  • Flow Pottery Sherd - Trial Chamber (Decorated Pots)
  • Guster Pottery Sherd - Trial Chamber (Decorated Pots)
  • Scrape Pottery Sherd - Trial Chamber (Decorated Pots)
  • Angler Pottery Sherd - Warm Ocean Ruins (Suspicious Sand)
  • Archer Pottery Sherd - Desert temple (suspicious sand)
  • Arms Up Pottery Sherd - Desert well (suspicious sand)
  • Blade Pottery Sherd - Cold Ocean ruins (cold ruins suspicious gravel)
  • Brewer Pottery Sherd - Desert well (suspicious sand)
  • Burn Pottery Sherd - Trail ruins (suspicious gravel)
  • Danger Pottery Sherd - Trail ruins (suspicious gravel)
  • Explorer Pottery Sherd - Cold Ocean ruins (cold ruins suspicious gravel)
  • Friend Pottery Sherd - Trail ruins (suspicious gravel)
  • Heart Pottery Sherd - Trail ruins (suspicious gravel)
  • Heartbreak Pottery Sherd - Trail ruins (suspicious gravel)
  • Howl Pottery Sherd - Trail ruins (suspicious gravel)
  • Miner Pottery Sherd - Desert temple (suspicious sand)
  • Mourner Pottery Sherd - Cold Ocean ruins (cold ruins suspicious gravel)
  • Plenty Pottery Sherd - Cold Ocean ruins (cold ruins suspicious gravel)
  • Prize Pottery Sherd - Desert temple (suspicious sand)
  • Sheaf Pottery Sherd - Trail ruins (suspicious gravel)
  • Shelter Pottery Sherd - Warm Ocean ruins (warm ruins suspicious sand)
  • Skull Pottery Sherd - Desert temple (suspicious sand)
  • Snort Pottery Sherd - Warm Ocean ruins (warm ruins suspicious sand)

Out of these, the desert wells have the highest chances of spawning suspicious blocks that contain a pottery sherd. But, you will have to travel to the dedicated structure to find the particular type of sherd you want.

How to Get Pottery Sherds in Minecraft

Now that you know your design options, it's time to explore the world and get these amazing items. Follow these steps to find and collect pottery sherds in Minecraft:

1. First, locate ocean ruins, trail ruins, desert well, or desert temple structures. If you plan to go for an oceanic location, make sure to create a Potion of Water Breathing to keep yourself safe.
