2. Then, create a brush in Minecraft by combining a feather and a stick with a copper ingot on the crafting table. You can use our Minecraft 1.20 ore distribution guide to easily find copper in no time.

3. Next, look for suspicious gravel or suspicious sand blocks in your selected structure. They look quite similar to the regular sand and gravel blocks but have a grainer texture.

4. Once you find a suspicious block, use the brush to uncover a pottery shard from that block. Keep in mind that you may need to try multiple blocks before finding pottery sherds.

How to Make a Decorated Pot

Pottery sherds may seem useless on their own, but when combined, they end up creating a beautiful pot. When you combine four pottery sherds on a crafting table, they turn into decorated pots in Minecraft.

Each shard contributes to the design on the face of the pot, making this item highly customizable. But if you prefer a plain pot face, you can even use clay bricks instead. The design on each face of the pot depends upon the placement of the shard or brick in the crafting recipe.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is pottery a shard or a sherd?

While you can use both of these terms interchangeably, "pottery sherd" is the official term in Minecraft. Furthermore, "sherd" is also the term that archaeologists prefer in the real world.

Is pottery coming to Minecraft?

With decorated pots and pottery sherds in Minecraft, you can now create unique pots to express yourself.

Can you put plants in the decorated pots of Minecraft?

Unfortunately, there is no collision or opening at the top of the decorated pots so you can't place flowers or plants in it. However, you can make a flower pot in Minecraft to store all your vegetation and decorate your house.

Find and Use Pottery Sherds in Minecraft 1.20

Now that you have access to pottery sherds in Minecraft, it's time to redecorate your entire home. But, only a new accessory-like item might not be enough for the job. So, you should also get blocks like bamboo wood or some stone bricks to renovate the entire building. Once you are done with the exterior, you can build a bunk bed in Minecraft along with other furniture options to revamp the interior. Having said that, which pottery sherd design is your favorite? Drop your choice on the Discord server!
excerpt: Learn how to get Pottery Sherds in Minecraft 1.20 and unlock a bunch of creatively decorated pots to level up your base.

title: How to Make and Use Calibrated Sculk Sensor in Minecraft 1.20
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make and Use Calibrated Sculk Sensor in Minecraft 1.20
content:
The world of Redstone machines is about to change and the Calibrated Sculk Sensors are leading the way. This new component allows you to add a frequency filter that will help you trigger actions based on certain activities. You can rely on it to create alarms, puzzles, and a lot more. If you are planning to play on the best Minecraft 1.20 servers, this is the ultimate way to upgrade your base. So, let's dive in and learn how to make the most of Calibrated Sculk Sensor in Minecraft!

Calibrated Sculk Sensor in Minecraft

Note: The Calibrated Sculk Sensor is an experimental feature of Minecraft 1.20 Pre-Release 2 that is subject to changes before the official release.

What is a Calibrated Sculk Sensor

The Calibrates Sculk Sensor is an upgraded from the regular Sculk Sensors which are a component that can detect vibrations and send Redstone signals. But, unlike regular sensors, they have the option to filter out frequencies and only detect certain vibrations.

Thanks to them, you can create peculiar Redstone machines that only get activated under very specific circumstances. This opens up a ton of possibilities for custom maps and even the best Minecraft minigames servers.

Items Required to Create a Calibrated Sculk Sensor

You only need to get the following items to make a calibrated sculk sensor in Minecraft:

  • 3 Amethyst Shard
  • 1 Sculk Sensor

Even though the crafting recipe of this item only requires 2 items, it can get pretty hard to collect them. For each of them, you have to travel into the caves of the overworld and risk exposing yourself to hostile mobs. So, make sure to keep a shield handy during your search.

How to Get Amethyst Shards

To get an amethyst shard, you need to search for amethyst clusters that spawn in huge quantities inside caves. If you break an amethyst cluster with a pickaxe it drops 4 shards. But, when you break it with any other tool or your hand, it only drops 2 shards.

Alternatively, you can also find amethyst shards inside the chests that spawn in Ancient Cities of Minecraft. You might anyways stumble upon this structure while looking for the second ingredient for the recipe of Calibrated Sculk Sensors.

Where Do Sculk Sensors Spawn

The Sculk Sensors spawn exclusively in the deep dark biome of Minecraft, the home of Warden and the ancient cities. You can find this block all over the biome alongside other Sculk features. Once you find it, you need a silk-touch enchanted pickaxe to mine and pick it up. Breaking it with anything else will drop nothing and make it disappear.

If you have a hard time locating it, you can try your luck with the chests of Ancient Cities. But, in either case, make sure to be extremely quiet to avoid spawning the Warden. Or, you can create a Snow Golem to keep it busy while you steal the required items.

Crafting Recipe for Calibrated Sculk Sensor

After collecting the required items, follow these steps to make a Calibrated Sculk Sensor in Minecraft:

1. First, open a crafting table by right-clicking or using the secondary action key on it.

2. Then, place the sculk sensor right in the center of the crafting grid.

3. Finally, place two amethyst shards on either side of the sensor and one right above it. With that, your Calibrated Sculk Sensor is ready.

How to Calibrate the Sensor

After creating the Calibrated Sculk Sensor in Minecraft you have to calibrate it before putting it to work. But, before we do that, let's go over some of its basics.

Types of Frequencies in Minecraft

This new item can detect vibrations from a distance of up to 16 blocks and only have a cooldown of 1 second. Moreover, you can calibrate it to detect 15 unique frequencies and send Redstone signals. The frequencies and some sample triggers include the following:

  1. Motion Detection (entities moving in land, water, or air)
  2. Surface Contact (something landing on the land)
  3. Item Interaction (using items Brewing Stand, fishing pole)
  4. Special Actions (gliding with Elytra, shaking of wolves)
  5. Mount/Dismount (equipping gear or mounting mobs)
  6. Mob Interaction
  7. Damage Alert (damage inflicted on nearby mobs and players)
  8. Item Consumption (drinking or eating)
  9. Block Deactivation (closing doors, closing chests)
  10. Block Activation (pressing buttons, opening chests)
  11. Modifying Blocks (adding food to furnace)
  12. Destroying blocks (except wool)
  13. Placing Blocks (except wool)
  14. Teleportation or spawning of mobs (Sniffer hatching from its egg)
  15. Explosions or death of mob/player

Train a Sensor

Once you know what actions you want your Calibrated Sculk Sensor to detect, follow these steps to train it:

1. First, place down the Calibrated Sculk Sensor on a solid surface.

2. Then, place a Redstone comparator towards the amethyst side of it and put down a lectern next to it.

3. With everything in place, it's time to set a frequency for the sensor, which, by default is the first frequency they receive. To do so, you just have to place a book on the lectern and open it to a specific page number to calibrate its frequency. If you open the book on page 8, Calibrated Sculk Sensor will only detect players eating or drinking.

Alternatively, you can also use other options including a hopper to calibrate the sensor. It all comes down to sending the right strength of Redstone signal.

Uses of Calibrated Sculk Sensor in Minecraft

The Calibrated Sculk Sensor in Minecraft opens up a ton of creative possibilities for players. Here are some ideas you can try:

  • Farms: You can use this item to trigger certain actions of your Redstone machines and farms. For example, when a mob dies in an XP farm, you can trigger hoppers to collect its loot.
  • Puzzles: This block opens us a ton of new mini-games that will require players to perform specific tasks to solve.
  • Custom Maps: The biggest benefit of the Calibrated Sculk Sensor is for map creators who can now add a variety of custom triggers. For example, you can use this block to add a combination of jump-based actions on the best Minecraft parkour maps to unlock certain levels.
  • Security: You can use this item to set up an alarm system for your base which can send alerts if someone tries to enter or loot your place. This is extremely reliable in the Minecraft PvP servers.

Make and Use a Calibrated Sculk Sensor in Minecraft

With this powerful item by your side, it's time to push your creative plans to the next level. But before that happens, you will have to take multiple trips to the deep dark for creating enough sensors. So, we highly suggest that you get an Iron Golem in Minecraft to accompany you. Though, if you are confident in your combat skill, having a diamond sword might be enough too. Having said that, how are you planning to use this highly potent item? Drop your best ideas on our Discord server!
excerpt: Unlock new Redstone capabilities and learn how to get Calibrated Sculk Sensor in Minecraft 1.20 with this simple step-by-step guide.

title: How to Make a Bucket in Minecraft - Easy Guide (2023)
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Bucket in Minecraft - Easy Guide (2023)
content:
Buckets are one of the most underrated and vital items in Minecraft. They help create food, transport liquids, and move mobs even more freely than a boat. Whether you're a dedicated speedrunner or seeking fame on the top Minecraft 1.20 servers, buckets are essential in your toolkit. Join us on this journey as we delve into the game and learn how to make a bucket in Minecraft.

How to Make a Bucket in Minecraft (2023)

Explore our detailed guide to buckets in Minecraft, covering everything you need to know. From the crafting recipe to usage, each section is arranged in order to prevent any misunderstandings.

Items Required to Make a Bucket

You only need the following items to craft a bucket in Minecraft:


  • Crafting Table
  • 3 Raw Iron
  • Furnace

Buckets, being a basic item, only require three iron ingots to craft. But, to get these ingots, you first need to obtain raw iron by mining iron ore. Our Minecraft 1.20 ore distribution guide will lead you to it in no time. Once you find an ore block, you need to use a stone pickaxe or better to mine it.

After obtaining the raw iron, place it inside a furnace and use fuel like charcoal to smelt it into an iron ingot. Each piece of raw iron gives out a single ingot so you need to mine at least three iron ores to make a bucket in Minecraft.

Crafting Recipe of a Bucket

Crafting a bucket becomes a piece of cake once you've gathered all the required iron ingots. Simply open your crafting table and arrange the iron ingots in a V shape. Once you've done that, your bucket will be ready for use.

Where to Find a Bucket in Minecraft

If crafting doesn't glow as planned, you can also obtain buckets in the chest of the following structures:


  • Dungeon
  • Villager (savanna only)
  • Woodland Mansion

Each of these structures has a fairly similar rate but your best chances are with Dungeons and Woodland Mansions. Though, finding any of these locations is a challenge in itself. So, make sure to check our list of the best Minecraft survival seeds to make the search easier.

What Can You Store in a Minecraft Bucket

Buckets are the most versatile storage item in Minecraft allowing to transfer of liquids and even mobs. You can use a bucket to carry the following entities:

  • Water (source block)
  • Lava (source block)
  • Powder Snow
  • Milk (from cows, Mooshrooms and goats)
  • Cod
  • Salmon
  • Tropical Fish
  • Pufferfish
  • Axolotl
  • Tadpole

When you store aquatic mobs in a bucket, it automatically fills up with a water source block. This is vital to help the mob survive during travel and can be released when you place down the bucketed mob.

Uses of a Bucket in Minecraft

As you already know, the most common way players use a bucket is by picking up and placing water and lava blocks. But, this item has a bunch of additional uses as well including:

  • Food: You can directly drink a milk bucket to replenish your hunger and even get rid of any effects on your body. It even acts as a crafting ingredient to make a cake in Minecraft.
  • Cauldron: A bucket can be used to fill up and empty a cauldron with water or lava in it.
  • Fuel: The lava bucket is the longest-lasting fuel for finances and blast furnaces in Minecraft.
  • Water Collection: If you place an empty bucket in the fuel cell of a furnace while drying a wet sponge the bucket gets filled with water.
  • Nether Portal: A bucket gives you the freedom to place water and lava wherever you want. This enables players to quickly create a Nether portal in Minecraft that is made up of obsidian blocks, that spawn when water and lava combine.

Make and Use Buckets in Minecraft

Leaving the basics behind, players have discovered a variety of additional uses for buckets in Minecraft over the years. One of them is avoiding fall damage by placing water before hitting the ground, making it a game-changer if you want to master the best Minecraft parkour maps. But this is just the beginning. Thanks to the best Minecraft mods, buckets also serve as vessels, block pickers, and a lot more. The only limitation is your creativity. With that said, how are you planning to use your buckets in Minecraft? Drop your ideas in a Discord server!
excerpt: Here's how to make a bucket in Minecraft and use it to collect lava, milk, water, and much more. Follow our simple step-by-step tutorial to craft your first bucket.

title: How to Get Netherite in Minecraft 1.20 (2023 Guide)
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Get Netherite in Minecraft 1.20 (2023 Guide)
content:
Leaving gold and diamonds in hot water, Netherite is the most sought-after item in the game, and all for the right reasons. It allows you to create the strongest weapons, the safest armor, and the best-looking trims in the game. If you are quick enough to find it on the best Minecraft 1.20 servers, no other player can even think of challenging you. But, finding Netherite is no easy feat. From dimensional travel to collecting every other mineral in the game, there's a lot of work ahead. So, let's not waste another second and jump right into it!

How to Get Netherite in Minecraft 1.20 (2023)

Note: This guide is based on the game mechanics of Minecraft 1.20 Pre-Release 4, and they are subject to some changes in the final release of Minecraft 1.20

Where Does Netherite Spawn in Minecraft 1.20

Contrary to other minerals in Minecraft, there is no ore for Netherite in the game. Instead, you have to look for Ancient Debris which can be mined and turned into Netherite ingot. This unique mineral block only spawns buried in extremely secluded areas of the Nether dimension. So, you might have to mine a large area before stumbling upon it.

Luckily, Ancient Debris is immune to most explosions, so you can use TNT in Minecraft to seclude it without any damage. But, if you don't plan on ore hunting, both ancient debris and Netherite scraps also spawn in the chest loot of Bastion remnants. You can find them within:

  • Treasure chests
  • Generic chests
  • Hoglin stable chests

Conditions for Spawning of Ancient Debris

Here are the main conditions that are important for Ancient Debris to spawn and can, eventually, lead you to it:

  • Minecraft only generates a maximum of five Ancient Debris blocks within one chunk (16 x 16 area).
  • This block commonly appears within the heights of Y=8 and Y=22. It maximizes at the height of Y=15.
  • All debris blocks generate away from air exposure and are always surrounded by other blocks on all sides. More often than not, the blocks surrounding it are Netherrack, basalt, or blackstone.

Best Biomes for Netherite

While no biome officially favors the generation of Ancient Debris, the following options might be a good pick:

  • Basalt Deltas: Relatively safer due to the low spawn rate of hostile mobs
  • Nether Wastes: Made up of repetitive blocks with easy-to-spot Ancient Debris
  • Warped Forest: Loaded with resources and quite easy to find

How to Find and Mine Ancient Debris

Now that you know all about the spawn mechanics of the source of Netherite in Minecraft 1.20, it's time to find it. Follow these simple steps to learn how:

1. First, build a diamond pickaxe by combining three diamonds with two sticks. This tool is important to mine important blocks like Obsidian and even Ancient Debris.

2. Then, create a Nether portal in Minecraft and travel to the Nether dimension.

3. Next, use your diamond pickaxe and mine till you reach the world height of Y=15. Beware of the accidental lava that might slip your way or grab a Potion of Fire Resistance to keep yourself safe.

4. From that point, use TNT or strip-mining to clear out the area and look for Ancient Debris. Once you find it, use the diamond pickaxe to mine the ore block. You need four of these blocks to get one Netherite ingot.

How to Make Netherite in Minecraft

Once you have enough Ancient Debris, it's time to create your first Nethertie Ingot. Here's how:

1. To begin, create a furnace in Minecraft by combining eight cobblestone blocks inside a crafting table.

2. Then, use the furnace to smelt the Ancient Debris and turn them into Netherite scraps. You will also need fuel like planks, coal, or charcoal to power the smelting process.

3. Finally, you just have to combine four Netherite scraps with four gold ingots to create a Netherite ingot. There is no fixed arrangement for their recipe so you can place the ingredients anywhere in the crafting grid.

Additional Tips to Get Netherite in Minecraft 1.20

With all the basics out of the way, here are some extra tips to make your search for Netherite easier:

  • The Nether dimension is known for its steep hills and deep ravines. So, brew a Potion of Slow Falling before you begin your search.
  • As a whole, the process to create Netherite requires gold as well as diamond. You can use our Minecraft 1.20 ore distribution guide to find them in no time.
  • Being in the dark dimension also puts you at risk of powerful hostile mobs. To counter them, having a shield in your toolkit is a must.
  • If you don't have the resources to craft a TNT for mining, you can also rely on a bed in Minecraft. The beds tend to explode in the Nether if you try to sleep on them.

Bonus: Upgrade Smithing Template in Minecraft 1.20

There is no doubt that obtaining Netherite is already a big challenge for most players. But, thanks to Minecraft 1.20 update, things are only getting harder. In the new update, you can't use the Netherite ingot right away to upgrade your gear.

Now, you first have to find the Upgrade Smithing Template that spawns in the Bastion Remnant chests. It is vital to activate a Smithing Table and unlock the ability to upgrade one diamond item to Netherite. This concept goes hand-in-hand with the new armor trims of Minecraft that allow you to decorate your armor.

Easy Ways to Find Netherite in Minecraft 1.20

With that, you now have access to all the Netherite your need in Minecraft. But, this item isn't the only element you need to reach the next level in your world. In the Tales & Trails update, you require a brush to uncover buried items, a Sniffer to find ancient seeds, and pottery sherds to truly express yourself. Having said that, it's time to embark on the thrilling search and dive headfirst into the quest for Netherite. Happy mining!
excerpt: Dive into our simple guide to learn how to get Netherite in Minecraft 1.20 and learn how the new update changed Netherite forever.

title: How to Breed Frogs in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Breed Frogs in Minecraft - Easy Guide (2023)
content:
Frogs are truly magnificent creatures in Minecraft. They jump higher than rabbits, give more useful items than the Sniffer, and still are quite easy to find. At least, until you try to get all three variants of this amazing mob. But worry not, we are here to step in and cover how to breed frogs in Minecraft and get all of their types. So, hop onto your favorite Minecraft 1.20 servers and let the adventure begin!

How to Breed Frogs in Minecraft (2023)

From food to variants, our guide goes over all the elements you need to know for breeding frogs in Minecraft. If you have any doubts, please feel free to explore the FAQ section to go over some common queries.

Types of Frogs in Minecraft

Based on their appearance, there are three types of frogs in Minecraft:

  • Temperate Frogs: Orange in color and exclusive to neutral biomes
  • Cold Frogs: Green in color and exclusive to cold biomes including The End dimension
  • Warm Frogs: Greyish white texture and only found in hot biomes and the Nether dimension

The variant of frogs depends upon the temperature of the biome that the tadpoles grow up in. But, since frogs only spawn in the swamp (temperate) and mangrove swamp (warm) biomes, there is no way to find cold frogs naturally. This makes it vital to learn how to breed frogs in Minecraft.

What Do Frogs Eat in Minecraft

The frogs in Minecraft only eat the following:

  • Small Magma Cubes
  • Small Slimes
  • Slimeballs

As you might notice, they are the only mobs in the game that are capable of directly eating other mobs. However, for the purpose of breeding, you only need to focus on slimeballs.

How to Get Slimeballs

Follow these simple steps to collect slimeballs for breeding frogs in Minecraft:

1. First, look for slimes that spawn throughout the overworld. They are more common in swamp biomes during nighttime.

2. Then, use your sword to attack the slime. The larger slime will split into smaller ones until it becomes a tiny baby slime. The small slimes may try to attack, but they can't cause any damage.

3. Finally, kill the smallest slimes to get slimeballs. You only need two of them to breed frogs in Minecraft.

How to Breed Frogs in Minecraft

After collecting slimeballs, it's only a matter of seconds before you have an army of tadpoles. Here's how:

1. First, go to any swamp biome and find two frogs. The parent's color doesn't affect the children so you can't have to be particular with your choice.

2. Next, feed one slimeball to each of the frogs to get them into "love mode". Then, one of the frogs will go to a nearby water block and lay eggs on top of it.

3. Once the frog eggs are laid, you just need to wait for them to hatch into tadpoles. Usually, it takes less than 10 minutes.

4. Tadpoles normally just swim around until they grow into frogs. However, you can use a bucket to pick up the tadpoles and take them to a new biome.

5. The temperature of the biome a tadpole grows up in determines the variant of the frog they become. So, you can empty out your bucket to let the tadpoles out. They take around 10-20 minutes to grow into frogs.

Why can't I breed frogs in Minecraft?

In most cases, the process of breeding only fails when the frogs can't find any water nearby to lay eggs. So, you have to ensure that there is a So, please ensure that there is flowing water or a water source block nearby before feeding slimeballs to your frog. Furthermore, once a frog has been bred, you need to wait for at least 10 minutes before breeding it again.

Frequently Asked Questions

How long does it take frog eggs to hatch in Minecraft?

It takes a maximum of 10 minutes for frog eggs to hatch and tadpoles to spawn. Though, you can increase the tick speed in Minecraft to speed up the process.

How long does it take frog eggs to hatch in Minecraft?

The green or cold frogs are extremely rare as they can't spawn naturally in the game. But, once you know how to breed frogs in Minecraft, you can get as many copies of them as you want.

Can you tame a frog in Minecraft?

Unfortunately, there is no way to tame frogs in Minecraft. However, you can use silmeballs to lure them anywhere you want.

Will Axolotls eat frogs in Minecraft?

Axolotls naturally hunt and can potentially kill tadpoles (not frogs) in Minecraft. So, you might need a Potion of Night Vision to see clearly underwater and keep an eye out.

Easy Guide to Breed Frogs in Minecraft

Now that you know how to breed frogs in Minecraft, they are going to be a perfect addition to your base. Moreover, if you feed them magma cubes, you can even get foglights to light up your space. But, they are not the only mobs that give you decorative items. If you find a Sniffer in Minecraft, it will help you dig up a bunch of ancient plants in the game. They fit perfectly with the decorated pots and unlike frogs, you don't even need to feed Sniffers to get them. Having said that, which is your favorite variant of Minecraft frogs? Drop your pick in our Discord server!
excerpt: Dive into our simple step-by-step tutorial and learn how to breed frogs in Minecraft to easily get all three types of frogs.

title: How to Make a Froglight in Minecraft
author: Udayveer Singh
metaTitle: How to Make a Froglight in Minecraft - Easy Guide
content:
It's time to revolutionize the lighting standards in your Minecraft builds. Say farewell to torches that don't fit your structures and stones whose glow isn't inviting. The Froglight in Minecraft, a single block, is all you need. But creating them requires collecting items, defeating mobs, and even crossing dimensions. So, waste no time and dive into your favorite Minecraft 1.20 servers, let's learn everything there is to know about foglights.

How to Make a Froglight in Minecraft

Our guide covers the basics of foglights before diving into the process of obtaining them. If you are already familiar with them please feel free to skip ahead.

What is a Froglight in Minecraft

The froglights are a type of light source in Minecraft that are dropped by frogs. They cannot be found or crafted manually. In terms of appearance, froglights clean building blocks comparable to stripped logs in the game. Meanwhile, when it comes to brightness, froglights are on level 15, the brightest in the game. They are on the same light level as lava, lantern, and others.

But what makes froglights truly unique is that due to their shape, they can also double as building blocks. Moreover, these blocks are also immune from fire and lava, making them a perfect addition to any Nether builds.

Three Types of Froglights

Based on their appearance, foglights can be divided into three variants:

  • Pearlescent: Purple in color and dropped by white (warm) frogs
  • Verdant: Green in color and dropped by green (cold) frogs
  • Ochre: Yellow in color and dropped by orange (temperate) frogs

As you might have noticed, the appearance of each froglight directly represents the type of frog that dropped them. So, if you want a particular froglight you have to get its relevant frog first. Lucky for you, we already have a dedicated guide on how to breed frogs in Minecraft and get all their variants in no time.

Items Required to Make Froglights

The froglights cannot be crafted within Minecraft. Instead, frogs drop froglight whenever they eat a small magma cube. But, the magma cubes only appear in the Nether dimension. Keeping all of that in mind, you need the following to get a froglight in Minecraft:

  • 1 Frog (any)
  • 1 Small magma cube
  • Slimeballs, boat or lead (to transport frogs)
  • A Nether Portal
  • A weapon like a diamond sword (to attack large magma cubes)

Since frogs are an overworld passive mob, they are prone to the dangers of the Nether dimension. Their tendency to leap in random directions doesn't help the situation either. So, make sure to keep them in check while taking them to the Nether dimension.

One of the easiest ways to do so is by crafting a lead. Its recipe only requires four pieces of string and one slimeball. Alternatively, you can also rely upon a Potion of Fire Resistance to keep them and yourself safe.

Where to Find Magma Cubes

Before you even begin the process to get a froglight in Minecraft, it's important to find magma cubes. They spawn exclusively in the Nether dimension and most commonly appear in the Nether fortress and basalt deltas.

Though, keep in mind that magma cubes are hostile toward players. So, you should keep a shield or good armor handy while dealing with them.

How to Get a Froglight in Minecraft

With all the basics out of the way, follow these simple steps to get your first froglight in Minecraft:

1. First, find a frog in your world. Naturally, they only spawn in the swamp and mangrove swamp biomes.

2. Then, use a lead on that frog to make it follow you. The same also works with boats, rafts, and luring the frog with a slimeball.

3. Next, make your frog enter a Nether portal and go to the Nether dimension.

4. Once the frog is in the Nether, you have to be extremely careful and take it to the magma cubes. Then, use your sword to attack the magma cubes until they break down and turn into their smallest form.

5. In the smallest form, the magma cubes can't harm you. But, if they go in front of a frog it will immediately eat the cube and drop a froglight.

Frequently Asked Questions

How many magma cubes can a frog eat in Minecraft?

As per our testing, there is no limit to how much a frog can eat in Minecraft. So, if you have enough magma cubes, you can get a bunch of froglights in no time.

What biomes have frog lights in Minecraft?

Froglights don't spawn naturally in the world of Minecraft. But, you can get variants of this block by feeding magma cubes to frogs from biomes of different temperatures.

Can you tame frogs in Minecraft?

Unfortunately, there is no way to tame a frog in Minecraft. However, you can still capture, lure and breed all types of frogs.

Can you ride a frog in Minecraft?

You can ride any mob in the game including frogs with the help of the new ride command of Minecraft 1.20 update.

Easy Steps to Obtain Froglight in Minecraft

With that, you have now unlocked froglights in Minecraft, and with them comes a series of creative possibilities. Plus, while you are trying to upgrade your space, the pottery sherds will play a major role. As for the interiors, the chiseled bookshelves can be a truly great pick. Having said that, the question arises: How will you harness the magic of froglights in your Minecraft world? Drop your ideas on our Discord server!
excerpt: Unlock a brand new light source and learn how to make a Froglight in Minecraft with this simple step-by-step pictorial guide.
